articleSummary: A small meteorite crashed into a wooded area in Nicaragua's capital of Managua overnight. Residents reported hearing a mysterious boom that left a 16-foot deep crater near the city's airport. The crater had a radius of 39 feet and a depth of 16 feet.

A female passenger dressed in a hazmat suit - complete with a full body gown, mask and gloves - was spotted Wednesday waiting for a flight at the airport. We particularly liked the JCPenney bag - maybe that's a new business line for the bankrupt retailer.

Two Australians say they bought a few McDonald's burgers for friends back in 1995. One of the friends never showed up, so the kid's burger went uneaten. "We’re pretty sure it’s the oldest burger in the world," says one of the men.

ISIS supporters say the group's youngest soldier has died in combat. Photos posted on Twitter showed the smiling boy in military fatigues holding weapons. The photos of the boy first emerged in June, said a researcher who monitors ISIS social media. One Twitter account said the boy was killed in a U.S. air strike; that has not been confirmed.

At least 25 suspected Boko Haram insurgents killed in clashes between soldiers and the Islamist militants in northeast Nigeria. Five civilians were killed in fighting elsewhere in the region, a military source and residents said on Monday. A ceasefire agreement between Boko Haram and the Nigerian government was expected to lead to the liberation of more than 200 schoolgirls kidnapped by the militants six months ago.

The Nobel Committee doesn’t “regret” giving President Obama the Peace Prize. There is no-such thing as a “pumpkin-spice-flavored condom.” “Male birth control” will probably not be here by 2017.An anonymous Facebook page sparked all-out panic at a military base north of San Diego. A hoax e-mail bearing the logo of Mexican newspaper El Universal claimed that Shakira died in a car accident in Colombia last week. A comedian going by the name Zayn Sheikh outraged many Brits with a YouTube video that demanded the TV show Peppa Pig go off air.

A meteorite crashed down in Managua, Nicaragua, late Saturday night. It caused a loud explosion and left a crater 39 feet (12 meters) across. No damage or injuries were reported. NASA hasn't confirmed a link between the meteorite and the asteroid.

New York Post: Amazon is planning to launch ad-supported streaming video service. Service would be separate from Amazon's $99 yearly Prime membership. Amazon spokeswoman neither confirmed nor denied the rumor. Amazon is also mulling its own travel service, which would let you book stays at independent hotels.

Father John Micheal O’Neal, 71, had a heart attack at Massachusetts General Hospital. Doctors feared that he would suffer brain damage, but he woke up 48 hours later. Recalling his experience, the priest said that he was engulfed by a feeling of unconditional love as he met God.

Canadian media is reporting that a soldier has been wounded in the attack. Canada’s parliament is in lockdown following the gunfire with heavily armed police racing to seal off the building and the office of Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper. Witnesses say a gunman than ran to the nation's parliament.

U.S. military officials say they are investigating claims that Islamic State fighters seized weapons. A video uploaded by a media group loyal to the Islamic State showed a cache of weapons. The supplies were airdropped early Monday to Kurds in the embattled Syrian town of Kobani.

Cassy, aka @NessLovnTrey247, posted photos of her boyfriend's DMs with another woman. She printed out the evidence, wrapped it up, and gave it to him as a present. He thought he was getting his gifts, but it was a trap.

shar pei-crossbeed Kai was discovered tied to a railing outside Ayr station. He was accompanied by a case containing items including a pillow, toy, food and bowl. The dog was sold on the Gumtree website in 2013 and the charity is appealing for information to help trace whoever bought him.

An article saying NASA confirmed six days of “total darkness” in December is fake. It’s merely an iteration of an old Internet hoax. Similar rumors have been going on for a while and have taken on different forms. “Huzlers.com is a combination of real shocking news and satirical entertainment to keep its visitors in a state of disbelier,” the About Us section reads on the bottom of each web page.

Italian fisherman Dino Ferrari landed what could potentially be a world record wels catfish in Italy's Po Delta. Ferrari’s fish measured an incredible 8.7 feet in length and weighed 280 pounds. The current weight record for a welsCatfish is over 300 pounds.

HBO's subscription streaming service will be called HBO Now and is expected to cost $15 per month. The report says that HBO is targeting a launch for Now in early April, ahead of the start date for Game of Thrones. Last year, HBO's online streaming option for cable subscribers, HBO Go, wouldn't work for many who were trying to watch during the premiere.

A woman named Taylor Lianne Chandler has made a number of fascinating claims about herself and her alleged relationship with Michael Phelps. Among them: she was born intersex with ambiguous genitalia, met the Olympic swimmer on Tinder, and had sex with him on their first date.

Macaulay Culkin is not dead. The actor is just next victim in a long line of Hollywood death hoaxes. A fake news report also claimed that the "Home Alone" star was found dead in his Manhattan apartment. Back in April, rumors spread that Culkin had been found dead.

Sheikh Mohammed Saleh al-Munajjid issues religious ruling forbidding building of snowmen. Cleric says to build a snowman was to create an image of a human being, considered sinful. Snow has covered upland areas of Tabuk province near Saudi Arabia's border with Jordan.

Voice of Israel editor quotes YPG fighters saying Gill Rosenberg was not captured by IS. IS had claimed that Rosenberg had been captured, and that a video was coming soon. Close friends, comrades, and supporters also voiced credible concern on Rosenberg's Facebook page. Rosenberg, age 31, has become infamous in recent months for joining YPG fighters in Kobani.

15-year-old Paul Horner is being held without bail and charged under a new controversial Arizona state law called ‘Self-Rape’ This is the first time this new state law has been used since it was put into action last month by Arizona Governor Jan Brewer. “I applaud the Arizona District court systems here in Phoenix,” Brewer said.Officers confiscated the pornography and lube found in the teenagers room as evidence. Horner is currently being held at the Maricopa County Jail in Phoenix, Arizona. He presently has no bond set and the judge has restricted him from seeing visitors. Fappy The Anti-Masturbation Dolphin and Stop Masturbation Now are federally funded programs designed to teach both children and adults about the dangers and consequences of masturbation.

Abdel-Majed Abdel Bary, 24, is a former West London rapper who performed under the name L Jinny. He reportedly left his home in Maida Vale, West London, to fight in Syria’s civil war. Bary reportedly tweeted a gruesome photo of himself holding a severed head earlier this year.

Lebanese security officials detained his wife and son at a border crossing with Syria. Iraq's government later insisted the woman was not married to Baghdadi. It said the woman - identified as Saja al-Dulaimi - was the daughter of an active member of al-Qaeda's affiliate in Syria, al-Nusra Front.

The FBI has questioned a man who says he recorded audio of gunfire at the time Brown was shot. In the recording, a quick series of shots can be heard, followed by a pause and then another quick succession of shots. Forensic audio expert Paul Ginsberg analyzed the recording and said he detected at least 10 gunshots.

Abdel-Majed Abdel Bary, who went by the rap name L. Jinny or Lyricist Jinn, is a suspect in the beheading of journalist James Foley this week. Ex-ISIS hostages have said that he has the nickname ‘John the Beatle’ because of his British accent.Obama’s own military leadership made clear in recent days that the threat from the Islamic State cannot be fully eliminated without going after the group in Syria, as well as Iraq. The White House has been imploring Sunni states in the region — Saudi Arabia, Jordan and the United Arab Emirates in particular — to wield their influence with tribal leaders.

AK Verma, an executive engineer at the Central Public Works Department, was fired after last appearing for work in December 1990. Even after an inquiry found him guilty of "wilful absence from duty" in 1992, it took another 22 years and the intervention of a cabinet minister to remove him.

The London Metropolitan Police has denied reports that street artist Banksy has been arrested. A Met spokesperson said the force did not have any information of such arrest and even if they had, it was possible they would not publish a press release about it. Meanwhile, the fake press release initially published by PR Log has been taken down.

North Korea's ambassador to the U.N. says Kim Jong Un is not in bad health. Kim has not been seen by his people since Sept. 3. The leader has gained a significant amount of weight, which could contribute to ailments like gout, diabetes or high blood pressure.

A French website says the Apple Watch will start at around $500 for the steel model. Gold will be even more expensive. iGen.fr also suggests that the Watch will rank low on the iFixIt repairability scale. The only thing on the Apple watch that will be user-replaceable is the strap.

The small town of Purdon, Texas has been quarantined after a family of five tested positive for the Ebola virus. The town is located just 70 miles from Dallas, Texas, and the hospital that has cared for both American Ebola patients, Thomas Eric Duncan, and Texas nurse, Nina Pham.

Video shows three Marines during a joint helicopter raid in Helmand Province, Afghanistan, in 2013. Upon hearing gunfire, the team move out to determine where it is coming from. They travel through a short tunnel and then into another, where they all pause just before exiting. Without warning, a bullet cracks against the helmet of one of the soldiers.

One of the Batmobiles from "Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice" was stolen. Zack Snyder took to Twitter to make light of the situation. Warner Bros never confirmed the report and its still unclear whether the vehicle was ever stolen. The production is going on in Detroit, a city with the highest crime rate.

NYPD may issue tickets for low-level marijuana possession rather than making arrests. The shift could have a huge impact in black and Latino communities. The de Blasio administration is still working out the details, such as how much weed one could possess without triggering an arrest. Some are already unhappy with the proposed change.

The elusive graffiti artist, political activist, film director and long time fugitive that for years has gone by the pseudonymous name of Banksy, was arrested early this morning. According to reports, after hours of questioning and a raid of his London art studio, his true name and identity have finally been revealed. A video was even produced purporting to reveal Banksy’s real identity.

A source close to KCTV5 News says a person who lives there is sick with something that may be contagious. A Nigerian woman was taken to the hospital with a high fever and Ebola like symptoms. Her apartment building was quarantined, though that may have been lifted later.

Letter appears to have been included in a 1974 Lego box set. Message explains how 'the urge to create is equally strong in boys and girls' Image has been shared widely on the online community platform reddit.com. The authenticity of the letter could not be independently verified, and Lego was not immediately available for comment.

Nun complained of stomach pains and was taken to hospital by her sisters. Doctors quickly told her she was pregnant. The baby is healthy and the nun's convent has expressed an interest in taking care of him. The woman, who is reported to be from Bolivia, has now been discharged from hospital.

Intelligence agencies are warning the jets could be used in 9/11-style attacks. “There are a number of commercial airliners in Libya that are missing,” one official said this morning. The threat warning comes as dramatic video reveals the final moments of a Libyan combat jet.

Man accused of attempting to rape a girl left in a critical condition. Locals cut off his genitals with a meat cleaver after finding him pinning a girl to the wall in the north-eastern city of Ganganagar. Police were quick to condemn the attack, warning locals not to take the law into their own hands.

Footage shows a 'bear-like' figure covered in hair emerging from an area of snow-covered trees in the south-western Adygeya Republic. A team had set out in search of the mysterious creature after local television reported that it had been sighted in a remote region. The group claim they heard the crunching of snow as they headed out to investigate. Afterwards, they took a plaster cast of a large footprint they said they found in the snow.

Video circulated on Tuesday showed a masked Isis fighter beheading a kneeling man cloaked in an orange jumpsuit. The White House said it was working to establish the video's authenticity. Foley has worked in a number of conflict zones in the Middle East. He and another journalist were working in the northern province of Idlib in Syria when they were kidnapped in November 2012.

North Korea’s state media has not made any mention of his activities since he attended a concert with his wife on September 3. The source said that Kim hurt his leg while inspecting military exercises. Kim needs about 100 days to recuperate, said the source.

Nigeria says it has struck a cease-fire deal with Boko Haram. But mystery continues to surround the identity of the interlocutor on the other side of the negotiations. Nigerian officials said the deal was reached in Chad on Friday in talks with a Saudi Arabia-based Boko Haram representative named Danladi Ahmadu.

Source: Kim Jong-un injured his right ankle in June after pushing ahead with on-site visits. The official said Kim is overweight and appears to have sprained his ankles during a grueling tour of military bases and factories. State TV in a rare admission on Thursday showed footage of Kim limping and admitted he is ill.

McDonald’s has just announced that it will be phasing out 8 menu items the beginning of next year. This means the end of the Big Mac, apple pie and large size menu items. The Big Mac has a whopping 550 calories and 29g of fat. The Apple pie contains 250 cal, and it would take a full 69 minute to walk that off!

The KFC Corporation was approved on February 3, 2015 for their Marijuana Retail Recreational Pot / Medical Marijuana Occupational Business License. Currently, 42 of the nearly 100 KFC franchises in the state of Colorado have added this “option” to their menu. KFC is hoping to get all 100 franchisees on board with the new product by March 2016.

eBay has posted an ad listing, looking for a developer to help them come up with a bidding app for the Apple Watch. The ad was originally posted to eBay’s career page way back in November, but it has only recently come to light through an ad posted to LinkedIn.

The move comes after the actor's talks with Fox to star in 'The Deep Blue Goodbye' hit a roadblock. Danny Boyle is directing the untitled Jobs film, which is based on Walter Isaacson's book. Bale emerged as a front-runner to portray the iconic tech figure, along with Matt Damon, Ben Affleck and Bradley Cooper.

Militant who tried to reconnect with the Taliban had "several phone calls" with family members in Afghanistan. There was no indication the calls, monitored by security officials, involved any "threatening activity or planning" The five Taliban militants, including two top leaders, were released from the Guantanamo Bay detention facility in May.

HBO is in talks with Apple over a partnership that would see its upcoming web-only subscription television package available on the Apple TV. CNBC has also confirmed that Apple and HBO are in talks in the video tweet posted below. The service, aimed at cable cutters, will allow users to access HBO content without a cable subscription for a set monthly fee.

The Department of Homeland Security has repeatedly said that the assertion that ISIS-affiliated terrorists were arrested while crossing the U.S.-Mexico border is “categorically false and not supported by any credible intelligence or facts on the ground.” But the vice president of the largest union representing Border Patrol agents told BuzzFeed News on Thursday that DHS — which oversees the Border Patrol — is incorrect.

Ahmed Abdi Godane is the spiritual leader of the Somali terrorist group al-Shabab. He is believed to have ordered the massacre at a Kenyan shopping mall last year that killed 67 people. U.S. officials have not yet confirmed Godane's death in a drone strike on his convoy in Somalia on Monday night.Godane said at the time that the mall attack was carried out in retaliation for the West's support for Kenya's Somalia intervention. Al Shabab is now mostly active in Somalia's rural regions after being ousted from the capital by African Union forces in 2011. Somali military officials last week launched a military operation to oust al-Shabab from its last remaining bases.

Detroit police confirm that the Batmobile is safe of the set of Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice. The best set video we can get of the iconic vehicle in action is from about 300 feet away. Detroit police spokesman Sgt. Michael Woody said that they reached out to the producers of the movie to confirm that it had not been stolen.

Second graders can influence others so that people at the time turned into magnets. In the world there are cases when people are not only held the spoon itself, but also irons, candlesticks. For classmates magnetic properties Koli no more than fun, but the boy sees its future is with supernormal.

A $2.5 million Bugatti Veyron was spray-painted with a penis. The artwork was most likely done for a planned prank video. Instagram user andreysmygov posted a photo of the drawing with the caption, "How often do [yo]u get to spray paint on a Bugatti lol"

Pope Francis' comment that there was a place in heaven for pets was misattributed. A Vatican spokesman said he did not recall the pope saying anything like that. The error appeared to have stemmed from a piece in an Italian newspaper. The pope has not spoken much about animals in public.

Meteorologist Mike Seidel lost cellphone contact with control room. Seidel had to take off his gloves and re-dial his phone which was tethered to his ear. "Rumors hit the web that he was perhaps writing his name in the snow," Brian Williams said.

James Wright Foley went missing in on November 22, 2012, while reporting from Syria. But a shocking video apparently shows the 40-year-old being beheaded by IS. He is forced to read a letter labelling the US government as his killers. The militant group is now also threatening to kill Time journalist Joel Sotloff, unless Barack Obama calls a halt to US attacks.

The mob dragged Suresh Kumar to a butcher's shop and castrated him with a meat cleaver. They then dumped his body parts and left him bleeding in the middle of the road. The man has been admitted to a local hospital where his condition is described as critical. The girl he was trying to rape is in shock and has been sent for counselling.

Vogue recently moved to One World Trade Center. The move was documented with military precision on Instagram. Will.i.am helped schlep boxes, for some reason. Gawker is reporting that the offices are #blessed with a rat infestation. The staff "must ensure that her personal office is rat-free before she enters it," a source said.

The original contents of the time capsule were first placed in 1795 by Governor Samuel Adams, Paul Revere, and William Scollay. It was unearthed during emergency repairs to the foundation in 1855 and then buried again. The capsule is believed to include a collection of silver and copper coins dating from between 1652 and 1855.It was the most physically challenging conservation job she has ever done, she said. “I have been privileged to spend all of my working life handling incredibly precious and important objects, and it is very exciting every single time,” said Hatchfield. ‘The sense of continuation of history that you get by entering a museum or historic site, but also by having it in your hands, is incredibly rewarding and enriching. And it gives meaning to a lot of people’

Bombs packed with the venemous arachnids are being blasted into towns and villages to scatter scorpions and incite panic. Former head of chemical and biological weapons for NATO and the British army Hamish de Bretton-Gordon described the attacks as'madness'

The 3-inch fish was struggling to pass waste at Toll Barn Veterinary Center in Norfolk. Owner initially refused to pay for the procedure, but quickly changed his mind. Vet Faye Bethell administered anesthetic to the fish, then used a tiny scalpel to remove a lump.

Lovesick Tan Shen, 26, went to the fast food chain in search of some comfort food to get over the break-up. For seven days she ordered chicken wings with a side of extra large fries at the KFC near a train station by her home. She even phoned in sick to work to stay at the restaurant. After a week Tan decided she was'sick of the taste of chicken' and she went home.

Footage of a sniper bullet hitting a US marine on the helmet has gone viral on social media. The footage was uploaded to YouTube last month, and has since received just under 200,000 views. Afghanistan veteran Sam Arnold said that the video was shot while "conducting a joint helicopter raid in the Now Zad district, Helmand Province in 2013"

Vice Media CEO Shane Smith reportedly spent $300,000 on a Las Vegas meal. The Vice co-founder spent the large sum of money at Bellagio's Prime Steakhouse. Smith can certainly afford to pick up the tab after A+E Networks and Technology Crossover Ventures each invested.

Robert Plant walked away from a 35-date tour that would have paid the rock group nearly $924 million. British tycoon Sir Richard Branson had planned to reunite the Stairway to Heaven rockers. Group members lobbied hard for Plant to join in but he wouldn’t change his mind.

Tim Cook says he always wears the Apple Watch, "even in the shower" Apple Pay should reach Canada as soon as next month, says Cook. Trip Chowdhry predicts 100,000 apps for Apple Watch by time it gets launched. Apple expected to ship almost 42 million units by December this year.

Online news sites were subject to a hoax on Friday from US ‘media troll extaordinaire’ Paul Horner. Sites Complex, Death and Taxes, and Jezebel published online stories stating that Horner had been identified as Banksy. Horner is in fact editor of the cunningly-named Super Official News website.

Homeland Security Secretary Jeh Johnson tries to dispel rumors and dial back fears. He says the number of unaccompanied minors apprehended in fiscal year 2014 was 68,434. Claims that four terrorists had crossed the border were false, he said. Johnson said the government is intensifying efforts to keep Ebola out of the U.S.

iPhone 6 Plus users are complaining that their hair is getting caught in the phone's glass. The problem has been dubbed #hairgate and has its own hashtag on Twitter. Apple says it has only received a handful of official complaints about the issue. It is thought that the new handsets are susceptible to being bent because the iPhone 6 Plus is so much larger.

Brian Williams is at the center of a media firestorm after he was found out for embellishing an old war story about being in a helicopter hit by a grenade during the Iraq war in 2003. The newscaster acted swiftly on Wednesday night to attempt to diffuse the situation by apologizing during his Nightly News show. Since then a series of ex-soldiers have come forward to criticize Williams ‘half-hearted’ apology. Now it transpires that NBC News executives - and Tom Brokaw - had known for years that the story was false. Senior executives had in the past asked Williams to stop telling the story in public, reports Variety. Despite his credibility being called into question,Lance Reynolds and Pate Butler said that Williams had not been aboard their damaged helicopter when it was hit by two rocket-propelled grenades and small arms fire. The damaged Chinook made a rolling landing at an Iraqi airfield, skidded off the runway and came to a stop in the desert. Another man, Joseph Miller, who claimed to be on Williams' aircraft at the time said he had been 'calling him out on this for a long time with no response'The Nightly News anchor has often repeated the war story over the past 12 years about how the aircraft he was on was forced down by enemy fire. He repeated his old war story on Friday when he presented a segment about a public tribute at a hockey game in New York for Command Sgt. Major Tim Terpack, a retired soldier who had provided security for the grounded helicopters. During the report, Williams went further and said that the aircraft had actually been hit - and the soldiers expressed their anger on Facebook afterwards. In a lengthy Facebook post on Wednesday Williams admitted his mistake and blamed the 'fog of memory over 12 years' for his error. 'I made a mistake in recalling the events ofWilliams has anchored NBC Nightly News - the nation's highest rated news program - since December 2004 when he replaced Tom Brokaw. His reporting from inside the New Orleans Superdome in the immediate aftermath of Hurricane Katrina the next year helped earn NBC a Peabody Award.

The White House fence-jumper made it through the North Portico doors and into the East Room. Omar Gonzalez overpowered a Secret Service officer posted near the door before penetrating deep into the mansion’s main floor. An alarm box near the front entrance of the White House designed to alert guards to an intruder had been muted at what officers believed was a request of the usher's office.

Mark Oberholtzer’s former Ford F-250 pick-up truck, complete with anti-aircraft gun, was used in a propaganda stunt by Supporters of the Religion Front (Jabhat Ansar al-Deen) in the Syrian civil war. His company Mark-1 Plumbing — the name emblazoned on the truck in Syria — has been bombarded with hate calls at the office in Texas City, Texas.

A US Marine gets a direct headshot from a Taliban sniper. He was saved by his kevlar helmet. The Marines were conducting a joint helicopter raid in Helmand Province in 2013. The shot occurs right at the :45 mark in the video. It's incredible to watch, especially the face of relief and disbelief.

The woman, who belonged to an order in Macerata, Italy, said she had no idea she was pregnant when she was rushed to hospital in agony. The nun, who is originally from South America and arrived at the convent in June, was taken to the emergency department of Bartolomeo Eustachio di San Severino Marche.

Reasons cited for his mysterious disappearance range from ill health through an addiction to cheese to him being placed under house arrest. Now the latest explanation for Kim Jong Un's conspicuous absence is that he has simply injured his leg. A source with access to the secretive North's leadership today insisted the leader is in firm control of his government. The source said that Kim hurt his leg while inspecting military exercises.Abrahamian said it was unlikely Kim had been usurped. 'Kim Jong Un has always shared power with other key figures,' he said. 'It is unlikely that they would want to remove him, given his unmatchable symbolic value. Again, though, everyone is guessing,' he added.

Paul Rudd was one of the onlookers who rushed to the defense of the man attacked by an antigay bigot at Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport. You know, this guy. He was probably on a connecting flight from Kansas City. The video had a little more than 10,000 views. Now it’s got more than 1.7 million.

Mark-1 Plumbing in Texas City has been flooded with calls after the picture appeared. The picture was posted online by the Islamic extremist group Ansar al-Deen Front. Mark Oberholtzer, who has owned the company for 32 years, has no idea how it ended up in Syria.

Attorney Lopa Blumenthal says the recording was made during a video chat. The audio captures what seem like 10 gunshot sounds. An autopsy of Brown's body performed at his family's request indicated Brown was hit by at least six shots. The man who made the recording has spoken to the FBI.

Claim: Deandre Joshua was murdered after testifying before a grand jury in Ferguson. False. Joshua was shot once in the head and then burned inside his car. Joshua did not witness the shooting of Michael Brown, nor did he testify before the grand jury. The only connection that Joshua had to the case was that he was a childhood friend of Dorian Johnson.

The Bugatti Veyron 16.4 Grand Sport is the world's most expensive production car. It boasts 1,200 horse power, tops out at 252.97 miles per hour. The car was named car of the decade in 2010 by BBC show "Top Gear"

ISIS sympathisers claim the child is ISIS' youngest foreign jihadist. Pictures taken before his alleged death show him wearing military fatigues. He is said to have died fighting alongside his father in Syria in recent weeks. Images emerged after a video reporting their deaths was uploaded to YouTube.U.S. and Arab coalition carry out the most sustained period of bombing raids since their campaign to destroy the Islamic State in northern Syria started two weeks ago. Heavily outgunned Kurdish defenders said Islamic State militants had pushed into two districts of Kobane by late last night. Pentagon said airstrikes are 'not going to be enough to save that city'

The Apple Watch was unveiled alongside the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus on September 9. Apart from Apple detailing its features, not many specifications were detailed. An analysts citing supply chain sources claims to have narrowed down a significant proportion of the specifications. Apple's smartwatch will feature 512MB of RAM, likely supplied by Samsung, Hynix and Micron.

The 88-year-old former Cuban leader has not been seen in public for months. He last appeared on Jan. 8, 2014, at an art exhibition in Havana. The most recent official photographs of Castro came out of a private meeting with Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro on Aug. 21.

Critics slammed Vogue’s recent Kimye cover as “disgusting,” but the offices lately are even worse. The rodents have invaded the infamous accessories closet and made their presence known by leaving droppings on desks, computers, and pricey couture.

Republican Rep. Duncan D. Hunter claimed 10 ISIS fighters have been caught coming across the Mexican border in Texas. Homeland Security Secretary Jeh Johnson shot down Hunter's claims. "We have no credible, specific intelligence to that effect," Johnson said. Johnson called on American leaders to "not unduly create fear and anxiety"

The despot has bought up cases of the pricey plonk delivered to his palace. Locals believe snake wine helps men get their partners pregnant and improves the size of your manhood. Kim, 31, and his wife Ri Jol-su, 22, are said to be having problems adding to their family because of his weight.

Couple couldn't have wished for a better Christmas present when it was revealed they wouldn't have to worry about their house payments anymore. LiveLeak video showed their son casually taking out a letter after telling his parents he had a gift for them. When they realised what it was, both of them began to cry with joy.

30-year-old Moscow resident was hospitalized with wounds very intimate nature. The man complained that his casual acquaintance opoila in the sauna, and then gently held his castration operation. Woman sewed all the smallest blood vessels. At the hospital, the man hours spent in intensive care, doctors were forced to spend a second operation on the testicles.

Judd Nelson's agent tweeted out a photo of the actor holding today's paper. Rumors swirled on Twitter that the "Breakfast Club" actor had found dead in his apartment of an apparent drug overdose. His agent Gregg Klein tweeted out the photo of Nelson holding the paper.

Isis has flown three captured jets over a Syrian military airport in the northern Aleppo province using Iraqi pilots who joined the group. The jets appeared to be MiG 21 or MiG23 models captured from Syrian military air base. US-led air strikes against Isis in the besieged Syrian Kurdish city of Kobani have helped Kurdish fighters pushing back militants.

Police in Mexico have found mass graves near the same place where 43 students went missing last month. Authorities have begun digging up bodies and are trying to determine their identities. Governor Angel Aguirre appealed for calm. The Aytozinapa Normal school is "known for militant and radical protests"

There have been reports that iOS 8 preferences are erasing iCloud files. There are also reports that Apple's new iOS 8 operating system is erasing iOS 7 files. The company has not commented on the reports of erasing files. Apple's iOS 8 is expected to go on sale later this year.

US drones are being flown over Isil's Syrian "capital" for the first time. Residents of the northern Syrian city of Raqqa have captured photo and video footage of remotely-piloted planes. Western weapons experts have identified them as American Predators, the same drones used in Pakistan and Yemen to attack suspected terrorists.The US president is due to give a speech on Wednesday preparing the American public for a campaign against Isil. Mr Obama said the US would fight Isil in a manner "similar to the kinds of counter-terrorism campaigns that we've been engaging in consistently over the last five, six, seven years"

Tiger Woods is not serving a suspension from the PGA Tour for failing a drug test, his agent and a Tour official emphatically stated Monday. “These claims are absolutely, unequivocally and completely false,” Mark Steinberg said in a statement. The allegations were made by golf pro Dan Olsen on 730 The Game radio in East Lansing, Mich., Friday.

Cumbrian Police believe the man to be in his mid-to-late 50s. They are urging anyone with information about either of the two attacks to come forward. A shocked trainee shop assistant Gemma Prosser, 19, said: "Anyone can sneeze at any time and it's not your fault"

An audio recording of the shooting death of Michael Brown has reportedly surfaced. In the recording, a quick series of shots can be heard, followed by a pause and then another quick succession of shots. The most notable tidbit from the short recording is the existence of two distinct volleys of gunfire from Officer Darren Wilson's weapon.

Stan Beaton had kept the voicemail since his wife Ruby's death in 2003. But technical work by Virgin Media meant it was deleted in December. The telecoms company has now managed to recover the message. Mr Beaton said: "They've made this old age pensioner extremely happy"

Second-grader in Omsk, Russia, developed "superpowers" after electric shock. Nikolai Kryaglyachenko, discovered that he could attract metal items. He has now become the most popular boy at school. The boy also says that he wants to become a superhero.

Thousands duped by fake news story claiming that Nasa has forecast a total blackout of earth for six days in December. The story, entitled "Nasa Confirms Earth Will Experience 6 Days of Total Darkness in December 2014!" originated from Huzlers.com, a website well known for publishing fake stories with sensational headlines.

A former Comcast customer says he was fired from his job after complaining about billing issues and false charges. The former customer, identified only as "Conal," told his story to Consumerist, the site whose readers have named Comcast "the worst company in America" two years running. Conal says he had no problem documenting every billing error and overcharge, and he brought them in as a spreadsheet when he dropped off unwanted DVRs, modems, and other equipment.

Chinese man went to his doctor complaining of stomach ache and itchy skin. Scans revealed his entire body had been infected with tapeworm parasites. Doctors believe some of the uncooked Japanese delicacy of raw meat or fish must have become contaminated. Eating raw or undercooked fish can lead to a variety of parasitic infections.

Israeli authorities opened a number of dams near the border, flooding the Gaza Valley. More than 80 families were evacuated after their homes flooded as water levels reached more than three meters. Gaza has experienced flooding in recent days amid a major storm that saw temperatures drop and frigid rain pour down. The storm displaced dozens and caused hardship for tens of thousands.

Tan Shen, 26, of Chengdu said she had not planned her extended stay in the fried chicken eatery. She said she wound up there while wandering around depressed. After three days in the 24-hour joint, the staffers noticed that the woman had not left. She told them she needed more time to think and ordered more wings.

Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak will be played onscreen by Seth Rogen. Acting opposite Rogen will be Christian Bale as Jobs. Sorkin’s screenplay for the film (to be directed by Danny Boyle) is based on Walter Isaacson's biography, Steve Jobs.

Iraqi pilots who have joined Islamic State in Syria are training members of the group to fly in three captured fighter jets. Canada is assembling a camp in Kuwait to launch its own air campaign over Iraq, sending six CF-18 fighters, two surveillance craft and a refuelling aircraft. Four men appeared in a British court on Friday, charged under anti-terrorism legislation with swearing allegiance to Islamic State militants.

Bloomberg News: Vice Media Inc. CEO Shane Smith sprung for the dinner. The dinner was for a party of more than a dozen people at the upscale Prime. A guest at the dinner, who asked not to be identified, told Bloomberg the dinner party was closer to 25.

Gold watches generally sell for a lot more than $6,000. 18-karat gold contains 75% pure gold, and that term is regulated by law. One ounce of 18k gold occupies about 1.8 cubic centimeters of volume. A simple 42x36x10 mm rectangle of 5 mm thick 18- Karat gold would cost over $8,300.It’s pretty much impossible to find a gold watch for under $10,000 in any size and from any manufacturer. Even tiny quartz ladies watches like the tiny Chopard Happy Sport Mini sells for $11,000! Most of the bargains commenters have pointed to are either 14-karat or less, very slim and small.Many people disagree with me on the amount of gold needed for the watch case. Apple will likely create special store-within-a-store spaces in certain Apple Store locations for the Edition. I expect them to open special standalone Apple Edition Boutiques to sell the Watch Edition, accessories, and perhaps other future high-end products.

PGA golfer Dan Olsen told WVFN that he has learned that Tiger Woods failed a drug test for performance enhancing drugs and has been suspended by the PGA. “I think when it’s all said and done he’m going to surpass Lance Armstrong with infamy,” said Olsen.

Islamist groups in Libya reportedly seized nearly a dozen commercial airliners in the last month. The aircraft were reportedly stolen in August after Islamists took control of the Tripoli International Airport. Reports that Islamist militias have seized the jetliners come just weeks before the 13th anniversary of the 9/11 attacks.

Sen. Lindsey Graham says the detainees have been in touch with al-Qaida linked Haqqani network. The Pentagon says it is working with Qatar and is confident that any threat posed by the former detainees can be mitigated. Qatar gained public praise for brokering the controversial deal in May 2014 that freed Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl.

Nicaraguan officials have appealed for witnesses to a meteorite strike that left a 12m-wide crater near Managua's international airport on Saturday night. Residents reported a loud boom as the meteorite crashed but scientists said no one had come forward who had seen the streak. The meteorite may have been a fragment of a house-sized asteroid nicknamed Pitbull, which hurtled past Earth on Sunday night at a distance of 40,000km.

Pluto will pass directly behind Jupiter, in relation to Earth, on January 4th. This rare alignment will mean that the combined gravitational force of the two planets would exert a stronger tidal pull, temporarily counteracting the Earth’s own gravity. The Jovian-Plutonian Gravitational Effect will make people virtually weightless.

Hunky mensch who took down violent bully looks like Paul Rudd, is not Paul Rudd. A man who looked almost exactly like the This Is 40 star was caught on video helping to tackle a man who yelled homophobic slurs and kicked another man waiting in Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport last week.

South American nun gave birth to a baby boy in Italy after complaining to her mother superior and sisters of severe stomach pains. The sister is believed to have been impregnated before she arrived at the Italian convent in June 2014. The sisters say that they are interested in taking care of the baby if the nun does not wish to keep it.

Report: Stainless steel version will start at $500, gold at between $4,000 and $5,000. The report comes from sources at Apple via French website iGen.fr. Sources also claim that Apple is hoping to release the watch as soon as possible. Other rumors claim we may have to wait until Spring of 2015.

Mysterious explosion in Nicaragua's capital Managua appears to have been caused by a small meteorite. The impact near the international airport did not cause any known injuries, but it did leave a crater measuring 12 metres across. Nicaraguan authorities believe it was a piece of the small asteroid dubbed "2014 RC", which passed very close to Earth on Sunday.

The sound of 10 or 11 shots from the gun of Ferguson, Mo. police officer Darren Wilson being fired at Michael Brown were recorded by a man in an apartment near the Aug. 9 shooting, according to the man's attorney. The 12-second audio begins with a man seemingly leaving a message for someone on an adult video service. After a two second pause, another four or five shots ring out.

Oliver Ilic, 22, was told that he was no good in bed so it is claimed he mutilated himself then threw the remains in the bin. He is alleged to have told doctors that he had a small appendage and cited that as the reason why his girlfriend was no use to him. Police searched his house and discovered the severed organ in a bin after it had been cut off with a single swipe from a razor blade.

Italian fisherman Dino Ferrari landed an enormous 280-pounder in the Po Delta. The wels catfish was put in a sling and weighed out at 280 pounds. The Po River and Delta are known for massive welsCatfish, but anything bigger than 6.5 feet is considered extremely rare, and this one measured 8.8 feet.

Islamist militias in Libya have reportedly taken control of 11 commercial aircraft from Tripoli International Airport. Intelligence officials have been told in the last two weeks of the possibility that one of more of the aircraft could be used in an attack later this month. The country is currently witnessing its worst spasm of violence since former dictator Muammar Gaddafi was toppled in 2011.

Seth Rogen has been cast as Woz in Jobs. Christian Bale had already been cast in the title role. Danny Boyle of Slumdog Millionaire, 28 Days Later, and Trainspotting fame will direct. The whole film will offer a somewhat unconventional approach to the life of this tech icon.

Star Wars Episode VII: The Force Awakens was due for release in December. Rumour comes from industry event - the Visual Effects Society Awards 2015. Abrams is said to have told attendees he was frustrated with the slow drip of leaks from the set. Releasing in the summer would be "an extremely brave move" says Movie Pilot.

Lebanon's interior minister says DNA tests have confirmed that a child held by authorities is the daughter of the Islamic State group's leader. Nohad Machnouk also says that the child's mother, who is also in custody, was married to IS chief Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi six years ago.

James Foley is a photojournalist who has worked for several news organizations. According to a website set up in his honor, he went missing while covering the conflict in Syria in 2012. ISIL has also indicated that their next victim will be Steven Joel Sotloff, a journalist who worked for TIME.

Claims about the 34-year-old Home Alone star's alleged death began circulating Thursday. The actor's reps told The Hollywood Reporter that the news of his alleged death was a hoax. This is the second time this year that Culkin has been the subject of false death rumors.

Christian Bale is out of the Steve Jobs biopic. Danny Boyle is still looking for a replacement. Seth Rogen is in discussions to play the role of Steve Wozniak. Sorkin had previously said Bale was a slam dunk for the part, but now he's out.

An Islamic Tribunal using Sharia law in Texas has been confirmed by Breitbart Texas. The tribunal is operating as a non-profit organization in Dallas. HBO plans to launch its stand-alone Net video service next month on Apple TV and other devices, according to the International Business Times. Sources familiar with HBO’s plans told IBT that Apple TV was among the devices that the streaming service would be available on at launch. The price for the service, which like Netflix would not require a pay-TV subscription, would be $15 monthly, sources said.

Seven schoolgirls, ages 13 to 15, are pregnant after a five-day school trip to Sarajevo. Furious parents are demanding to know why there was such a lack of teacher supervision. The school in Banja Luka had taken 28 girls to the nation’s capital city for a 5-day trip to visit museums and historic sights.

Foley was abducted while on a reporting trip in northern Syria in November 2012. He was never heard from again. Foley was the oldest child of Diane and John Foley of Rochester, New Hampshire. He had been reporting from war-torn countries for the better part of four years."He was a generous colleague, never holding back a tip, phone number, or detail that could help," Frenkel says. Foley's family confirms his death in a statement posted on a webpage. We took a look at the photo said to show the body of Islamic State leader Abu Bakr Al-Baghdadi. We found it was really an ethnic Albanian militant killed in 2013. See a news report on the death of Sami Hafez Al-Abdullah here.

A Taliban commander exchanged for the release of a POW attempts to return to the battlefield. U.S. military and intelligence officials now suspect that at least one of the detainees has made contact with Taliban associates in Afghanistan. Kevin Vickers' role is largely ceremonial, symbolising the authority of the body. He was back in the chamber on Thursday, a humble hero at the centre of attention.

A letter that supposedly accompanied Lego boxes in 1974 has been making the rounds on the Internet. The letter reminds parents that "the urge to create is equally strong in all children...boys and girls" If real, this letter perfectly aligns with Lego's history of egalitarian advertising. Mic has reached out to Lego for comment.

Last year, a Vine from President Obama's trip to Israel showed just how ridiculously large his motorcade can grow. Assuming that this still really does show Russian President Vladimir Putin’s motorcade, he might not have such a large escort, but there is something a bit suggestive about the formation.

Angry locals came to the teenager's aid after hearing her scream, before then dragging the man to a butchers shop. The appendage was reportedly thrown into the road, with officers now hunting down the perpetrators. He is understood to be in a critical condition, while the girl was treat for shock.

Nasa scientists say no-one reported seeing a fireball in the sky would suggest it was caused by something else. A crater 12m wide and more than 5m deep was later found near Managua's international airport. Nicaraguan officials announced on Sunday that a "small meteorite" had come down.

Pope Francis confirmed that there is a place in heaven for dogs and 'all of God's creatures' The statement is at odds with conservative Roman Catholic theology which states that animals cannot go to heaven because they have no souls. The head of the Catholic Church had been attempting to console a distraught young boy who was mourning the death of his dog.

Syrian activists claim militants from the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria (ISIS) seized a cache of weapons airdropped by U.S.-led coalition forces. Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, 21, was found face down in a pool of his own blood in his cell. A banana peel was found on the floor nearby. A small meteor landed in a wooded area near the airport in Managua, Nicaragua. No one was hurt. The meteorite is thought to have broken off from an Earth-passing asteroid. The asteroid was discovered on Aug. 31 by the Catalina Sky Survey near Tucson, Arizona.

Vogue editor Anna Wintour has refused to show up in her office until the problem is bought under control. All employees have been banned from eating at their desks for fear of dispensing inadvertent treats to the roaming rodents. "A bunch ate through the ceiling of a sports editor's office and crawled all over his desk and left poops on his keyboard," one company source said.

Urban development minister M Venkaiah Naidu said a case of "wilful absence" had been proved against electrical engineer AK Verma. Mr Verma had been under investigation since 1992, but had refused to co-operate, the minister said. India's bureaucracy has become notorious for high levels of absenteeism.

Ahmed Abdi Godane was the leader of the al-Shabab terrorist group in Somalia. President Barack Obama said the death of Godane demonstrated U.S. counterterrorism resolve. It took the Pentagon four days to conclusively determine that Godane had not survived Monday's airstrikes.

A self-described feminist boasted of aborting her baby because it was a boy. Then, after making that declaration, claims to be shocked that some people might have a problem with that. She boasts of involvement in “fighting for women’s rights’ being all-consuming.

New York Times reports Apple will offer low power mode on Apple Watch to help boost it through longer days. With the exception of Pebble products, most current and upcoming smartwatches - including the Apple Watch - will last no more than a day on a single charge. Apple previously stated that the Watch's battery should last only a normal day.

Christian Bale will not be playing Steve Jobs in the upcoming movie about the Apple co-founder, Hollywood Reporter reports. Sources say the actor decided he wasn't right for the role, and withdrew. This is coming after the movie's scriptwriter Aaron Sorkin confirmed that Bale would be playing the prickly tech icon.

Saudi TV allegedly blurred out Michelle Obama's face when she and Barack met King Salman. The YouTube uploader appears to have added the blur, not some Saudi TV network. This version of the video shows no such blur. Nothing is real on the internet, Twitter users say.

Yang Hu, 26, believed there was no chance of ever finding a partner due to his long work hours. So in desperation he cut off his penis in a bid to stop himself thinking about finding love. Realising his mistake Yang CYCLED to hospital to get treatment only to be sent home by shocked doctors.

Detroit police confirm with producers of “Batman v. Superman: Dawn of Justice’ that the vehicle has not been stolen. “The Batmobile is safe in the Batcave where it belongs,” police spokesman Sgt. Michael Woody said. Sources close to the production being filmed in metro Detroit also said it wasn’t true that the Caped Crusader’s ride had been steal.

The New York Times has just revealed a few more details about the new Apple Watch. Axl Rose was found dead Tuesday late afternoon in his West Hollywood home. Police were called around 3:30 pm for a welfare check. A neighbor has confirmed the residence belongs to Rose but police have not confirmed the man's identity. Rose has been named one of the greatest singers of all time by various media outlets, including Rolling Stone and NME.

An alleged bug in iOS 8 appears to be deleting documents stored in iCloud Drive without the user's permission. The bug is triggered by the option to Reset All Settings. Robert Plant's publicist called a rumor that he ripped up an $800 million contract offer to reunite Led Zeppelin "rubbish" The Daily Mirror reported that Plant, Jimmy Page and John Paul Jones, and Jason Bonham were offered the money by Virgin mogul Sir Richard Branson.

A Kansas City apartment building was sealed off as a seriously ill person was taken to Research Medical Center for treatment. A source close to the situation said "all or part of the medical facility was then quarantined" The Kansas City Health Department is monitoring the patient who may have contracted a contagious virus.

A photo purporting to show the slain body of Islamic State leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi appears to be a doctored picture. Rumors circulated on social media and Iraqi media over the weekend that Baghdadi was slain in a US airstrike. The Batmobile is missing from the filming of "Batman V Superman: Dawn of Justice" Initial reports point to Bleeding Cool as the primary source of the report. There is no way to determine the accuracy of this claim except through the police. We'll keep you posted on further developments.

Apple was originally shooting to eke out an entire day of battery life from Apple Watch. The company is said to be shooting for 2.5 to 4 hours of active application use with the screen turned on. In standby and low-power modes, Apple Watch can last through two or three days.

The jets were seized from Syrian military airports now under IS control. It is unclear if they are equipped with missiles, according to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights. The jihadists also control two other airports in Syria — Albu Kamal near the Iraqi border and Tabqa in Raqa province.
