The story was sourced to a website purporting to be the Somali prime minister's Facebook page. A Somali government spokesman said the page was not official.

NBC weatherman Mike Seidel appeared to urinate in the woods. NBC claims Seidel was merely “checking his phone,” which he had clumsily dropped in the snow. Why didn’t one of the PAs in the film crew grab his phone for him? Is he even in Sugar Mountain?

A man with a rifle shot a soldier standing guard at the War Memorial in downtown Ottawa. Witnesses said they then heard shots fired, and there was an unconfirmed report of a person injured outside the Library of Parliament. Police sealed off the area while the injured soldier was given emergency medical aid. He was later put into an ambulance.

Rapper Kanye West reprised his most infamous stunt at Sunday night's Grammy awards. West popped up on stage and moved toward Beck as if he was about to take the trophy from him. Instead, West turned away and quickly jumped down. The incident was a repeat of the 2009 MTV Video Music Awards.

Kurt Sutter, creator of the hit FX drama Sons of Anarchy, has announced plans to turn the popular television series into a major motion picture. Sutter said the film will star Charlie Hunnam, who played the lead character Jax Teller, as well as Ryan Hurst who played Opie Winston. The film, which is a prequel to the storyline of Sons will also introduce fans to Jax’s father, John, played by Brad Pitt.

Rep. Duncan Hunter claimed Tuesday that at least 10 ISIS fighters were caught trying to enter the U.S. from Mexico. On Wednesday, the Department of Homeland Security said Hunter's claim was unfounded. DHS Secretary Jeh Johnson told CNN that the agency has no credible intelligence to support Hunter's claims.

British intelligence agencies MI5 and MI6 have identified the man suspected of the horrific beheading of American journalist James Foley. The hooded man with an English accent is believed to be 23-year-old Abdel-Majed Abdel Bary, known to fellow Islamic State militants as Jihadi John. British SAS forces are hunting Foley's killer, using a range of high-tech equipment to track him down and potentially free other hostages.

A fisherman is claiming to have caught a massive catfish — measuring almost 9 feet and weighing roughly 266 pounds — in the Po Delta in Italy. Dino Ferrari posted several photos on Facebook of himself posing with the wels catfish. Wels catfish can apparently grow to be over 13 feet long and nearly 900 pounds, but it’s rare to catch one over about 6 feet.

A neighbor tells 8 News NOW former baseball star Jose Canseco was hurt in an accidental shooting Tuesday afternoon at his house on the eastside of the Las Vegas valley. Police would not confirm the former player was hurt. However, records show canseco owns the home where the shooting happened.

A propaganda video claiming to show U.S. journalist James Wright Foley was posted to YouTube on Tuesday. Foley is standing next to an ISIS militant, who makes some remarks placing the blame for Foley’s death on President Barack Obama. The video gives no hint as to where Foley was being held. Foley, a freelance journalist working for the Global Post, went missing near Taftanaz in Syria in 2012.

A 19-year-old named Jess Smith revealed she was the smiling baby in the sky on ‘Teletubbies’ Since then, fans have been freaking out on Twitter. Ironically, there were rumors the true identity of the baby was a different Jessica Smith. Now, that would have been awesome!

Dmitry Nikolaev, a 30-year-old soap star living in Russia, had a drink with a ‘young blonde woman’ who approached him at a bar. They kissed and had some more beer and after that the actor remembers nothing. He woke up next day at a bus stop, feeling acute pain, and with blood on his trousers. Rushed to hospital, he was told that his testicles had been removed.

A small furor has erupted over whether a Saudi television station blurred out the image of U.S. first lady Michelle Obama. Saudi officials deny the claim. The new king shook hands with President Obama but didn't acknowledge the first lady during a brief meeting at the funeral for King Abdullah.

Mohammed Islam, 17, has been trading on the stock exchange on his lunch breaks at Stuyvesant High School. Islam trades with two other friends, and they hope to start a hedge fund when the Teen Wolf turns 18. The Teen Wolf moniker is a reference to Leonardo DiCaprio’s portrayal of Jordan Belfort — called the “wolf of Wall Street”

Ryan Roche drank a quart of eggnog in just 12 seconds, without taking a breath. The liquid in his lungs was starting an infection. He spent 24 hours in intensive care with a fever, sweats and chills. "Eggnog: not ideal for the lungs," doctors told him.

Canada is trying to confirm reports that a Canadian citizen has been captured in Syria. "Canada is pursuing all appropriate channels" to seek further information. Israeli media reports, including Haaretz newspaper quoting a website associated with Islamic State, said a Canadian-Israeli woman, Gil Rosenberg, was captured.

UK aid worker Henning has reportedly been tried by a Sharia court and found innocent of espionage. Henning was reportedly found guilty of espionage by the Sharia court. He has since been released on bail and returned to the UK. The trial took place in the town of Dagenham in the north of England.

Huzlers.com published a story about a six-day period of darkness in December. The site said a solar storm would block out 90 percent of the sun for 216 hours. A NASA scientist said there would be no problem because the planet could survive on "artificial light"

Seth Rogen is being eyed to play Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak in Sony's Steve Jobs movie. Jessica Chastain is also being sought for a role in the film. Danny Boyle is directing the film from a script by Aaron Sorkin.

The Daily Mail reports that Kim Jong-Un is considering opening a Pyongyang restaurant in Scotland. The restaurant chain is owned by the North Korean government and used to generate additional cash flow overseas. Scotland has allegedly been singled out for two reasons. The first is that the dictator and other elite North Korean officials love Scotch whisky.

Jordan Matson, 28, a former U.S. Army soldier from Wisconsin, is the face of the YPG Kurdish military force in Syria. He says civilians have been burned in an Islamic State attack, with injuries consistent with chemical weapons. Matson: "We're trying to get a video camera to Kobane because they don't have one right now to record the injured"

A pizza delivery driver delivers a single pizza to a conference room full of realtors. A video posted on YouTube shows the deliverer being presented with $2,084. "For one pizza, that's a pretty good day's work," the driver says.

Seth Rogen will play Steve Wozniak in Aaron Sorkin's Steve Jobs biopic. Danny Boyle, who directed "Slumdog Millionaire," is going to direct. The movie will be based on Walter Isaacson's biography "Steve Jobs" The next movie you'll see out starring Rogen is the controversial "The Interview"

A group of Russians claim to have captured the best footage of bigfoot. The adventurers spotted what they described as a hairy bear-sized humanoid that marched out of the woods before disappearing seconds later. The recording came when a group of people from the city of Adygeisk set off in search of the mysterious creature.

A rumor claims that Elon University has banned the term “freshman” because it’s sexist. But the rumor is not true, according to the university. A junior student wrote an article for the College Fix claiming the school dropped the term and replaced it with “first year.”

Canisters of the creatures are being blasted into villages. Hamish de Bretton-Gordon, ex-head of chemical and biological weapons for the Army and Nato, said: “It’s madness. IS have improvised devices to launch them. “Scorpions are robust – even if they are launched a couple of miles, when the canister breaks thousands are flung out," he said.

17-year-old Mohammed "Mo" Islam is rumored to have made $72 million from trading. A source familiar with the story told Business Insider that Islam is not worth $72million. The source believes it's a rumor started by Islam's friends or partners that was perpetuated by New York Magazine.

A mass grave with an unconfirmed number of bodies was discovered in a part of Mexico near to where 43 college students were abducted. An official says it would be "irresponsible" to identify the bodies as the missing students. The students disappeared after clashing with police during a protest that turned violent. Officials have detained 30 people, including 22 police officers, in the case.

Social media awash with news of Islamic State using chemical weapons in an Eastern neighbourhood of Kobane. Asya Abdullah, co-chair of the Democratic Union Party (PYD), who is in Kobane told Kurdish Question that a gas attack had taken place. Abdullah said that they didn't know where the gas had come from because there hadn' t been any explosions.

#ISIS beheads photojournalist James Wright Foley in a massage to US to end its intervention in #Iraq. #ISIS behead photojournalists James Wright. Foley was one of the most wanted men in the world at the time of his beheading. ISIS beheaded him in a bid to get the U.S. out of Iraq and Syria.

Reddit user says he bought a 128GB iPhone 6 Plus that feels different than his wife's early 16GB model. He also says he used a stethoscope to listen to the phone and found that his 128GB phone sounds “much more dull toned, indicating to me it’s more solid” He then took it under a microscope, without dismantling it.

CNN reported on January 29 that at least one of the five jihadists exchanged for Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl “has attempted to return to militant activity.” The White House had not issued a statement on the latest reports regarding the alleged attempt of one or more of the jihadists. This latest news comes at a time when the Obama administration is dealing with rumors regarding the ongoing investigation into his conduct leading to his capture.

Multiple Iraqi and Kurdish media sources have claimed that some Islamic State (ISIS) militants in Mosul, Iraq, have contracted the deadly Ebola virus. The Iraqi outlets reportedly claimed that Ebola had started to spread in a Mosul hospital. It is highly uncertain whether Mosul health authorities have the means, tools, or skill-set necessary to test for Ebola.

Tim Cook says he always wears the Apple Watch, "even in the shower" Apple Pay should reach Canada as soon as next month, says Cook. Trip Chowdhry predicts 100,000 apps for Apple Watch by time it gets launched. Apple expected to ship almost 42 million units by December this year.

The woman says her "bad experiences with men" led her to have the sex selective abortion. In the blog she says she found out she was pregnant in 2012 and describes the father as ‘the donator’ She also claims to be a feminist, fighting women’s rights "to the point of eschewing a career"

Boston.com has taken professor Ben Edelman to task over the dispute in a series of stories. Last night, the website posted a story headlined: “Ben Edelman Appears to Have Sent Racist Email to Chinese Restaurant Owner. Today.” It also included what purported to be the text of emails from Edelman containing a racial slur, which Boston.com said had been provided to the website by the restaurant owner.

Apple to hold "extensive testing programs" between Feb. 9 and 16. Store representatives will be sent to Cupertino or Austin for hands-on experience. Apple unveiled its long-awaited smartwatch in early September. Mobile marketing firm TapSense is providing a glimpse of its Apple Watch ad-buying service.

Mr Kim Jong-un has been absent from public view for more than a month. Yesterday was the 69th anniversary of the founding of the ruling Workers' Party of Korea. The younger Kim had marked the beginning of this important national holiday by leading top military and party officials on a midnight visit to the Kumsusan mausoleum in Pyongyang.

It was widely reported Lucita Sandoval was filmed having sex with a student. But the man in the video is actually in college and the woman is not Sandoval. It was also falsely reported the 'teacher' has several times faced disciplinary hearings over inappropriate relationships with pupils.

“Star Wars: The Force Awakens” is currently scheduled to be released on Dec. 18, 2015. Reports claim that J.J. Abrams wants to release “Episode 7” in the summer of 2015. The 48-year-old director made the announcement at the Visual Effects Society Awards 2015.

Fox & Friends got very excited Thursday morning over rumors that King Abdullah of Jordan had potentially participated in retaliatory airstrikes against ISIS after the immolation death of Jordanian pilot Muath al-Kasaesbeh. Fox aired photos of of King Abdullah in flight gear, which had been making the rounds on Twitter since Wednesday evening:Reports that Jordanian King Abdullah, himself a pilot, will fly sorties on ISIS targets.

The sale of a private island in Lake Mälaren has received international attention, thanks to the assertion that it is Tiger Woods who sells it. But that's not true - the true owner is a Swedish millionaire. It's not the broker real estate agency who planted the story, at least not according to Johan Vesterberg.

An audio recording of the shooting death of Michael Brown has reportedly surfaced. In the recording, a quick series of shots can be heard, followed by a pause and then another quick succession of shots. Forensic audio expert Paul Ginsberg analyzed the recording and said he detected at least 10 gunshots. The man who recorded the shooting was talking to someone on video chat when the sounds of gunfire erupted in the background.

An Italian expert studying a first century document that was recently discovered in the archives of the Vatican, found what is presumed to be the first eyewitness account of a miracle of Jesus Christ. The author describes a scene that he allegedly witnessed, in which a prophet and teacher that he names Iēsous de Nazarenus, resuscitated a stillborn boy and handed him back to his mother.

ISIS is launching bombs containing live scorpions as the latest terror weapon in Iraq. Canisters of the creatures are being blasted into towns and villages. Hamish de Bretton-Gordon, ex-head of chemical and biological weapons for the Army and Nato, said: “It’s madness. IS have improvised devices to launch them”

The USDA’s Food Safety Inspection Service went on Twitter to debunk the hoax. The article quoted the CDC as saying millions of turkeys were unsafe because of avian flu. Snopes.com—the premier debunker of internet myths—said the article was fake.

Nikolai Kryaglyachenko, 12, was blasted across the pavement when he leant briefly against a lamppost that was live from a faulty wire. He now attracts coins, spoons and glasses to him - and had decided to become a superhero when he is older. He has also found himself one of the most popular boys at school.

Mohammed Emwazi grew up in a well-to-do family in west London. He is believed to have traveled to Syria around 2012 and to have later joined the militant group. The militant has appeared in a series of videos in which hostages, including British aid worker Alan Henning, were brutally murdered.

Rep. Duncan Hunter told a Fox News audience on Tuesday that the US has apprehended about ten ISIS terrorists as they entered the country through the Mexican border. The Department of Homeland Security flatly denied that in a statement to MailOnline. 'The suggestion that individuals who have ties to ISIL have been apprehended at the Southwest border is categorically false, and not supported by any credible intelligence or the facts on the ground,' the agency said.

Unverified photo claims to show body of ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi. He was purportedly killed by US air strikes against three senior members of ISIS. Pentagon Spokesman Col. Steve Warren could not confirm the deaths. But he added that if ISIS leaders were embedded “inside troop formations they are likely to be killed”

People found with small amounts of marijuana would be issued court summonses. The change would remake the way the police in New York City handle the most common drug offenses. It would represent Mayor Bill de Blasio’s most significant effort since taking office to address the enduring effects of stop-and-frisk practices.

Islamist militias in Libya took control of nearly a dozen commercial jetliners last month. Western intelligence agencies recently issued a warning that the jets could be used in terrorist attacks across North Africa. Intelligence reports of the stolen jetliners were distributed within the U.S. government over the past two weeks. One or more of the aircraft could be use in an attack later this month on the anniversary of the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks.

Seven school girls fell pregnant during a five day school trip to Sarajevo. Parents of the girls, who are aged between 13 and 15-years-old, are furious at the school and say the children were not properly supervised. The case has reignited an ongoing national discussion in Bosnia concerning the worrying increase in teenage pregnancies.

The FBI has questioned a man who says he recorded audio of gunfire at the time Brown was shot. In the recording, a quick series of shots can be heard, followed by a pause and then another quick succession of shots. "I was very concerned about that pause... because it's not just the number of gunshots," the man's attorney says.

Sheikh Mohammed Saleh al-Munajjid was asked whether it was permissible for fathers to build snowmen for children after a snowstorm in the country's north. He argued that to build a snowman was to create an image of a human being, which is considered sinful under Sunni Islam.

Google is expected to buy about half of Redwood City's mammoth Pacific Shores Center office campus. The purchase — which could close later this month — would be Mountain View-based Google’s most dramatic real estate move this year. The impact of the acquisition, if completed, would ripple through the commercial real estate market.Pacific Shores is a half mile from the Port of Redwood City. A Google pilot project earlier this year tested running ferries from San Francisco and Alameda to the port. San Mateo County has about $22 million left in a sales-tax funded pot for ferry services in the county.

Cumbria Police are hunting a man who is slapping women if they sneeze. The middle-aged man first smacked a woman around the head after she sneezed. Then on Tuesday, officers believe the same man launched a second attack on a frail pensioner who also had a bout of the sniffles.

The Earth will experience 6 days of almost complete darkness. This will be the product of a solar storm, the largest in the last 250 years for a period of 216 hours total. Despite the six days of darkness soon to come, officials say that the earth will not experience any major problems.

Luke Somers, 33, was kidnapped by al-Qaeda's Yemen affiliate last September. His sister, Lucy Somers, claims he was killed in a failed rescue attempt. There has been no comment by US officials on the news. The Pentagon confirmed it had previously launched a failed attempt to rescue Mr. Somers.

Abdel-Majed Abdel Bary, 24, was known as L Jinny or Lyricist Jinn at home in London. He came to national attention earlier this year, when he posted a picture of himself holding a severed head on Twitter after resurfacing in Syria. His family is frequently mentioned in rap songs that are still floating around the internet.

According to the latest research from our WDE (Wearables) research service, the Apple Watch smartwatch will ship 15 million units worldwide in 2015. Apple will quickly become the world’s number one smartwatch vendor with 55 percent global marketshare this year. We forecast total global smartwatch shipments to grow 511 percent from 4.6 million units in 2014 to 28.1 million units. Most of the smartwatch growth will come from the new Apple Watch.

Report: Apple's original smartwatch featured health and fitness features. The Wall Street Journal says none of those features will make it into the final product. Some features didn't work properly, while others would have required regulatory approval. Apple is expected to unveil its first smartwatch next month.

Police in Newfoundland and Labrador posted a "wanted" status on Facebook looking for Rodney Constantine, a man wanted for assault and some outstanding warrants. Constantine commented on the post and is planning to turn himself in. Constantine kept his word and turned himself in to the local police station at 4:30pm NST. According to a Facebook update, he will face a provincial court judge in the morning.

Navarro County officials emphatically rejected as false a posting on the National Report website. The posting said the small town of Purdon was quarantined because a family of five tested positive for the Ebola virus. The father began to exhibit symptoms following a business trip to Dallas.

The K5 security guard robots from robotics company Knightscope stand 5 feet tall and weigh 300 pounds. They use a suite of alarms, sirens, and cameras to monitor and patrol the grounds of Microsoft’s Silicon Valley campus. If one spots trouble, it’ll either sound an alarm or dispatch a human security guard.

Retail employees will undergo centralized Apple Watch training the week of February 9. One or two representatives from many Apple Stores in the United States will be sent to Apple offices in either Cupertino, California or Austin, Texas to learn first-hand about the Watch. Developers are currently working with WatchKit tools and iOS 8.2 betas to build apps for Apple Watch.

Rep. Duncan Hunter, R-Calif., says that at least ten fighters for the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria have been apprehended. Hunter says that the Islamic terrorists are slipping into the U.S. through the porous southern border as several have already been captured. “If you really want to protect Americans from ISIS, you secure the southern border,” said Hunter.

Sheikh Mohammed Saleh al-Munajjid issued a religious ruling forbidding the building of snowmen. He argued that to build a snowman was to create an image of a human being, an action considered sinful under the kingdom's strict interpretation of Sunni Islam.

Apple is launching its latest i-device, a new Apple Watch, in April. The top-of-the-line "Watch Edition" will sell for as much as $4,000. Estimates online for how much Apple will charge for the top-line watch are all over the map.

James Wright Foley, an American journalist kidnapped in 2012, was beheaded in an ISIS video released on Tuesday, August 19. The video is titled “A Message to America” A figure in a black robe with a gun strapped on his person and a masked hat covering his face, apart from his eyes, appears in the video next to Foley.

The reported ceasefire between the Nigerian government and Boko Haram does not appear to be working out. At least five attacks have occurred since the announcement of the ceasefire. The terrorist group is still holding more than 200 girls captive. Family members of those kidnapped are skeptical of whether the negotiations will be productive.

Jewelry industry experts believe the Apple Watch Edition will cost around $1,200. Other jewelers estimate that Apple's fanciest smartwatch could be priced as much as $10,000. Watch expert Chad Rickicki of Pittsburgh, Penn. told TechCrunch that an 18-karat gold case that is the size and shape of the Apple. Watch Sport could rack up as many as $600.

Rep. Duncan Hunter (R-Calif.) said Tuesday night that U.S. border officials have caught “at least 10″ Islamic State fighters or people with ties to the group. The Department of Homeland Security disputed Hunter’s claim on Wednesday morning. “The suggestion that individuals who have ties to ISIL have been apprehended at the southwest border is categorically false,” a spokeswoman said.

Airstrike in Somalia by U.S. Forces Targets Shabab Leader. “We have confirmed that Ahmed Godane, the co-founder of al-Shabab, has been killed,” the Pentagon says. The death of Mr. Godane is “a major symbolic and operational loss’ to the group.

Christian Bale is reportedly in final talks to play Steve Jobs in a biopic. Bale will be directed by Danny Boyle, who won an Oscar for "Slumdog Millionaire" The film is expected to be loosely based on Walter Isaacson's official Jobs biography. There has been some turmoil behind the scenes on the project.

Tiger Woods's agent and PGA Tour deny a drug-test rumor. Dan Olsen, a former pro golfer, made the claim on a sports talk radio show. He says Woods is serving a secret Tour suspension for a failed drug test. Olsen later walked back everything he said, saying it was "only my opinion"

A.K. Verma, an executive engineer at the Central Public Works Department, was fired after last appearing for work in December 1990. India's labour laws, which the World Bank says are the most restrictive anywhere, make it hard to sack staff for any reason other than criminal misconduct. States have recently changed the law to make it easier to hire and fire staff.

Nun complained of stomach pains and was taken to hospital by her sisters. Doctors told her she was pregnant and she gave birth to a healthy baby. The woman, who is from Bolivia, has now been discharged from hospital. Her convent has expressed an interest in taking care of the baby.

Police in Carlisle are hunting a middle-aged man who is slapping high street shoppers if they sneeze. In what Cumbria Police admit is'very unusual behaviour', the man, who wears a tweed jacket, first smacked a woman round the head after she sneezed. The following day, the same man is thought to have slapped an 82-year-old woman who had just sneezing in Scotch Street, Carlisle.

Canadian police are investigating a man named as Michael Zehaf-Bibeau as a possible suspect. U.S. officials say they have been advised that the shooter was a Canadian convert to Islam. One of the officials said that the man was fromQuebec.

Rumors have been circulating that the Apple Watch will launch in February. The Apple Watch is expected to be unveiled at an event in New York City on February 12. The watch will cost $349 and go on sale in the U.S. later this year, according to reports.

Soldiers searching for dozens of students missing after clashes with police at a demonstration in southern Mexico have found a mass grave. The mass murder near the rural town of Iguala, in the crime-hot state of Guerrero, may be one of the worst massacres since the clampdown on Mexico’s drugs gangs began eight years ago.

The incident happened at a hospital in the city of Shenzhen in southern China. The woman had been discovered heavily pregnant and in labour on the street. She had been taken into the hospital and given birth, and then placed in a ward where attempts had been made to contact her family. However on the woman's third day in hospital, nurse Liu Tianlun had gone into the bedroom to find the young mother biting her son on the arm.

The operation took place in the Wadi Abdan Al Daqqar region of Shabwa Province. It targeted an al Qaeda group headed by Mubarak al-Harad, a security source said. The U.S. Defense Department, State Department and Federal Bureau of Investigation could not be immediately reached.

ISIS claims to have beheaded photojournalist James Wright Foley. Foley was kidnapped while reporting from Syria two years ago. In the video, ISIS claims they are holding a second journalist, Steven Joel Soltoff. A man on the video is identified as Sol toff and his life is threatened if the United States does not pull out of Iraq.

The woman, who is known only as Lana, describes herself as a feminist. She has fought for women’s rights “to the point of eschewing a career” She wrote that when she found out she was pregnant in 2012 she was overjoyed until she realised it was a boy.

Mark Oberholtzer has owned and operated Mark-1 Plumbing in Texas City for 32 years. He said he no longer owned the vehicle and had no idea how it ended up in Syria. He traded in the truck to an AutoNation dealership three years ago. He usually takes the decals off his vehicles when he sells them.

"Conal" claims he was fired from the accounting firm where he worked after a Comcast rep called his boss and told on him for trying to report his terrible customer service experience to Comcast higher-ups. When Conal tried to cancel his subscription in October 2013, Comcast reportedly sent him $1,820 worth of equipment he didn't request and charged him for it.

Christian Bale has reportedly dropped out of the role of Steve Jobs in a new biopic. Screenwriter Aaron Sorkin had previously said he was excited to cast Bale in the role. Leonardo DiCaprio was reportedly offered the role, but also declined. Seth Rogen is reportedly set to play Jobs' co-founder Steve Wozniak.

Questions surrounded purported deal between Nigerian government and Boko Haram for release of missing schoolgirls. The deal would mark a huge breakthrough after a five-year insurgency by extremists seeking to create an Islamic state in the north of Africa’s most populous country. The girls were abducted in April from the north-eastern town of Chibok.Boko Haram stormed the school in Chibok in April and snatched nearly 300 students. This week about 50 protesters in red shirts tried to march to the presidential villa but were repeatedly diverted by riot police. The president has blamed activists for politicising the abductions and influencing the parents.

Islamic State militants released a video that purported to show the beheading of James Foley. Foley has been missing since he was kidnapped in Syria in November 2012. The authenticity of the video could not be immediately verified. The video was first reported by Zaid Benjamin, a reporter for the Arabic-language Radio Sawa.The FBI is evaluating the video posted by the Islamic State to determine if it is authentic. Foley reported in Syria for GlobalPost as a freelancer. GlobalPost CEO: "We withheld this information at the request of the family and on the advice of authorities cooperating in the effort to protect Jim"

British actor poised to take the lead in Jobs, directed by Danny Boyle, after Leonardo DiCaprio pulled out. David Fincher had originally been announced as the film’s director, but left the project after an argument with Sony about his salary and the marketing of the film.

Paramedics are reportedly transporting the patient, who has not yet been identified. Staff and patrons of the facility are being examined for the deadly virus. Thomas Eric Duncan, the first person in the U.S. to become sick with virus, died Wednesday. More than 3,400 people in West Africa have been killed by the latest outbreak.

The depressed 26-year-old worked long hours and believed there was no chance of ever finding a partner due to his long work hours. So in desperation he cut off his penis in a bid to stop himself thinking about finding love. Realising his mistake Yang CYCLED to hospital to get treatment only to be sent home by shocked doctors.

Fourteen more police arrested as forensic investigators find no trace of students missing since violent confrontation in Guerrero state. None was among 28 bodies, some badly burned, that were unearthed a week after the 26 September attack. Forensic investigators continued to test other remains and announced the discovery of a 10th mass grave.

The United States airdropped weapons to the Syrian Kurds of Kobani. Some of the weapons meant to reach the Kurds ended up in Islamic State hands. U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry offered that not aiding the Kurds is both "irresponsible" and "morally very difficult"

Amazon plans to open its first physical store in Midtown Manhattan. The experimental store will work as a mini-warehouse for some same day deliveries in New York. The new brick-and-mortar shop is actually across the street from the Empire State Building, so it's clearly primo real estate.

The U.S. dropped 28 bundles of weapons and medical supplies to Kurdish forces on Monday. Two of the bundles missed their marks, but one was destroyed by the Pentagon. A Pentagon spokesman said the wind caused the parachute to go off course. The spokesman also stressed that the weapons will not give ISIS any advantage.

ISIS USES CHEMICAL WEAPONS. ISIS kills 300 Iraqi soldiers by chlorine gas attack in Saqlawiyah. Iraqi officials confirmed that ISIS murdered over 300 soldiers using chlorine gas. The soldiers suffocated and died from the chemical attack. ISIS reportedly looted the base after the attack.

Crews removed a time capsule dating back to 1795 on Thursday from the granite cornerstone of the Massachusetts Statehouse. Historians believe it was originally placed by Revolutionary War luminaries Samuel Adams and Paul Revere among others. The small time capsule is believed to contain items such as old coins, documents, newspapers and a metal plate that was owned by Revere. Secretary of State William Galvin speculated that some of the items could have deteriorated over time.

The state of North Dakota has named a new publicly-owned landfill after President Barack Obama. In an overwhelming 35-10 vote, the state Senate advanced a bill naming a 650-acre site currently under construction after the nation’s 44th president. Governor Jack Dalrymple is expected to sign the measure into law Tuesday.

Apple says the Apple Watch's battery life is "about a day" The company expects people to charge the watch nightly. Sources say the company is working to improve the watch's uptime. The Apple Watch is expected to launch in early 2015, but a release date has not been announced.

U.S. and British intelligence officials are eyeing a British-born rapper as the militant who beheaded journalist James Foley. A senior Western intelligence official told Fox News that 23-year-old London rapper Abdel Majed Abdel Bary is the suspect. Bary's Egyptian-born father was extradited from London to the United States in 2012.

Voice of Israel editor quotes YPG fighters saying Gill Rosenberg was not captured by IS. IS had claimed that Rosenberg had been captured, and that a video was coming soon. Close friends, comrades, and supporters also voiced credible concern on Rosenberg's Facebook page. It is illegal for an Israeli citizen to travel to an Israeli-declared hostile state, including Iraq and Syria.

Conal began subscribing to Comcast service in early 2013 after he says he was sold a 9-month promotional pricing offer. From the start, there were issues with his service, as he was being charged for set-top boxes that had yet to be activated. He says he met with a Comcast rep in May 2013 about the billing issues and promised they would all be sorted out.Comcast says it did contact Conal’s employer but that Conal “is not in a position to complain that the firm came to learn” about his dispute with Comcast. Conal doesn’t quite see how mentioning the name of his employer would have helped gain him any leverage. The problem should not have reached the point where he was even reaching out the Comcast Controller's office.

Dylan Thomas visited the Bali International Medical Centre to have a tropical spider pulled out of his stomach. The 21-year-old awoke after a quiet night in his four and a half star hotel room to find a bizarre red trail two inches from his naval and heading upwards. “It was as if someone had scratched me with the tip of a knife,” he said.

Pictures posted to social media show people arriving at airports with surgical masks and gloves on. Images appeared following days of false alarms at the nation's airports, and also after a second healthcare worker in Dallas was revealed to have contracted the Ebola virus. Amber Vinson, the second person to contract the deadly virus in the U.S., also found to have made a round-trip flight from Dallas to Cleveland.

Apple has "studied platinum watch casings" according to a new report in The Wall Street Journal. The company is not expected to announce the new case during today’s "Spring Forward" event. The Apple Watch will go on sale in April with 38mm and 42mm cases.

Jose Canseco was injured in an accidental shooting at his home in Las Vegas, Nev., according to KLAS-TV. The former MLB outfielder allegedly shot himself in the hand and is now recovering at a local hospital. Police have confirmed that a shooting took place at canseco's home.

The White House said they have not yet confirmed the authenticity of the video. The video starts with a clip of President Barack Obama earlier this month making the announcement that he had authorized targeted strikes in Iraq. In the video Foley delivers a statement calling on his friends and family to "rise up against my real killers, the U.S. government"

Lucita Sandoval was not involved in a sex tape scandal after a newspaper unearthed the truth following internet gossip sites that were filled with reports of the story. It has since emerged that the woman in the video is not Miss Sandoval, but a completely different woman from the city of Corrientes in Argentina.

Tape allegedly contains audio captured during a Ferguson resident's video chat at the time of the shooting. CNN says the authenticity of the tape has yet to be verified, but what appears to be gunfire can be heard in the background of the call. An autopsy concluded that Michael Brown, 18, was shot six times, with two fatal shots to the head.

Kevin Vickers is the sergeant-at-arms in the House of Commons. He spent 29 years with the RCMP and rose to the rank of chief superintendent. As an RCMP officer, Vickers has been responsible for security services provided for the Queen and Prince Andrew. MPs credited Vickers with saving their lives.

The New York Times has a new report sharing a few new tidbits on the Apple Watch. Among the interesting details is the existence of an unannounced "Power Reserve" mode for the watch that will display only the time and cut off all other functions as the battery begins to run critically low. Sources have also provided more context to a Wall Street Journal article from last month that discussed how many of the originally planned health features for Apple Watch were dropped due to consistency issues.

The marine was shot during a mission in the dangerous Helmand Province last year. The video was captured on the helmet camera of a marine in 2013. The team quickly fall back to safety using the radio to explain what has just happened. Following, the lucky escape the team then attempts to locate the sniper before the filming stops.

A female passenger dressed in a hazmat suit was spotted waiting for a flight at Dulles International Airport outside Washington, D.C. Another traveler snapped a photo of the woman and provided it to The Daily Caller. Thomas Eric Duncan, the first person to be diagnosed of Ebola on American soil, had a layover at the airport last month. He died last week.

North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has not been seen in public since September 3. Rumours range from a stroke to a coup d'etat. Mr Kim fractured both of his ankles and had surgery in Pyongyang in the middle of September to treat them, South Korea's largest newspaper reports.

Taylor Lianne Chandler reveals she was called David Roy Fitch at birth. She said during her teens she changed her name and used testosterone blockers. She had surgery to remove her male genitalia in her early 20s. Chandler claims the pair met on dating app Tinder and described their sex life as "amazing"

Syrian Observatory for Human Rights says militants have Russian-made MiG 21 and 23 warplanes. Militants are being trained at the al Jarrah airbase on the eastern side of Aleppo. UK authorities have charged four men with terror offences, including taking an oath of allegiance to IS.

Nikolai Kryaglyachenko, 12, was walking home after school when he lent briefly against the lamppost that was live from a faulty wire. When he woke up the next day he found coins that had been on the mattress stuck to his body. His power to attract metal mirrors that of Magneto’s – a villain from Marvel comics.Nikolai is a keen fan of comics and believes he has developed a super magnetic power. He has now decided that he wants to be a superhero when he is older. Scientists say that rather than people being magnetic, it is probably nothing more than unusually sticky skin.

Yobs targeted the silver-coloured car which was parked in a street in Seattle, US. The Bugatti Veyron 16.4 Grand Sport is the world’s most expensive production car. Twitter users are suggesting the phallic daubing could have been the handiwork of a jilted lover or jealous rival.

A newly released audio recording purportedly captures the sound of gunfire from the police shooting of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo. The unauthenticated audio was recorded by a man who says he was taping a video chat conversation when the shooting occurred. On the audio, a man can be heard video-chatting a friend while shots ring out in the background.

Iraqi Member of Parliament Ali al-Bredi has claimed that Islamic State (IS) militants are using Chlorine gas against Iraqi soldiers in Fallujah. He said that the militants deployed the gas in the Siqiliya area located of northern Fallujah, a city in Anbar province, about 70 km from the capital of Baghdad.

Kevin Vickers, 58, has been the House of Commons' head of security since 2005. He led the way as officials chased down terrorist Michael Zehaf-Bibeau on Wednesday after he murdered reservist Nathan Cirillo and entered the building. Vickers has worked for the RCMP for 29 years, but this was his first ever exchange of gunfire with a suspect. The 6-foot-4 Vickers is being hailed a hero.Vickers received a standing ovation from MPs in the House of Commons on Thursday when he returned to the more usual duty of delivering the ceremonial mace to the chamber. He released a statement paying tribute to Nathan Cirillo and revealed another police officer was shot in the leg. Earlier in the morning, a man was arrested for getting too close to Prime Minister Stephen Harper and his wife Laureen as they placed flowers at the scene of the shooting.

Oliver Ilic, 22, was unable to stop the bleeding after he cut off his penis. He was taken to a hospital in Kocani, Macedonia, where he told medics he had decided to cut it off because it was no use. Police searched his house and found the severed penis in a bin along with the razor blade he had used.

Oliver Ilic, 22, called medics after he couldn’t stop the bleeding. He was taken on a stretcher in bloodstained jeans to hospital in the eastern Macedonian town of Kocani. Police searched his house and discovered the severed organ in a bin after it had been cut off with a single swipe from a razor blade.

Omar Gonzalez, the White House fence-jumper from earlier this month, apparently surprised the guard at the front door because a nearby alarm box had been muted. Gonzalez, who was carrying a knife, dashed past the stairway leading a half-flight up to the first family’s living quarters. The intruder reached the doorway to the Green Room, a parlor overlooking the South Lawn with artwork and antique furniture.

Huzlers.com wrote a story claiming that the world would be plunged into six days without light during December. This rather bold -- and entirely fake -- claim was further entrenched into people's minds by the fact that it listed Charles Bolden, NASA administrator as the source of the claim. The story went viral with panicked and concerned citizens immediately turning to Twitter to voice their concerns over the worldwide blackout.

Islamist radicals seized Tripoli International Airport and took possession of as many as 11 commercial jetliners. News of the stolen planes have now created concerns for officials, who fear the militants may use them to carry out acts of terrorism against America. Tripoli Airport is currently occupied by two rival groups deemed “terrorists” by the Libyan parliament.

Lebanese authorities are questioning the woman and conducting DNA tests on the child. If their identities are confirmed, Lebanon may use the pair as bargaining chips. The woman, who was identified as an Iraqi, and the child were taken into custody about 10 days ago. The Islamic State group did not immediately comment on the detentions.Danish Foreign Minister Martin Lidegaard says "the Dane is doing better" Denmark and Saudi Arabia are part of the U.S.-led coalition conducting airstrikes against Islamic State militants in Iraq and Syria. The coalition is also conducting airstrikes in Yemen and the United Arab Emirates.

Apple is planning to open a dedicated pop-up shop for the Apple Watch at high-end department store Selfridges in London. The shop will likely be located near the entrance of the iconic Wonder Room, a 19,000-square-foot shopping hall. The store-within-a-store concept will display various Apple Watch models.

Georgy Myakinkin, 31, left his keys at work following his shift at Pulkovo Airport in St Petersburg, Russia. When he returned to collect them, he says "heavy-handed" security guards stopped him 'unnecessarily' and told him he had to remove his belt. Staging an impromptu protest, he then stripped naked - apart from his socks - before sauntering through the scanner, leaving the guards gobsmacked.

'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' might hit the theaters in summer along with 'Jurassic World' and 'The Avengers: Age of Ultron' A new report states that director JJ Abrams wants to release the movie this summer. The movie is currently scheduled to hit the theatres on 18 December.

Big Bank Hank, real name Henry Jackson, died from kidney complications due to cancer, according to reports. Jackson formed the Sugarhill Gang with Master Gee and Wonder Mic, having a big hit in 1979 with Rapper's Delight. The record sold several million copies worldwide and helped establish rap as the genre it is today.

Claim: Kanye West has been banned from all future award shows. The Adobo Chronicles is another "satire" publication that publishes fake news. While it is true that West created a stir at the 2015 Grammy Awards when he briefly interrupted Beck during the musician's acceptance speech (just as he had done to Taylor Swift in 2009), Kanye has not been banned.

One micro-blog shared photos under the heading "It's Hard Being a Top App Worker" A worker downloads an app to boost its rank on the App Store, calculated by how many times the app has been downloaded. Apple has previously adopted measures to deter crank-boosting in order to ensure fair rankings.

Dmitry Nikolaev, 30, had been drinking with a young blonde woman in a Moscow bar. He believes he was drugged after taking the woman to a sauna, enjoying a beer and then kissing her. He woke up in a bus stop in a lot of pain with blood staining his clothes.

CBI files case against Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh over forced castration. Former Dera follower Hansraj Chauhan had filed a petition in 2012 alleging that he along with around 400 male devotees of the Dera were castrated inside the ashram. Chauhan claimed that the castration of Dera followers was done by the chief through doctors employed in his hospital.

Nigerian officials say Boko Haram has agreed to a ceasefire and the release of more than 200 school girls. The girls were abducted six months ago from a school in Chibok. Boko Haram seeks to impose a strict interpretation of Shariah law in northern Nigeria. An estimated 5,000 Nigerians have been killed and a further 300,000 displaced.

Apple originally wanted its smartwatches to focus heavily on health-related features. The company's engineers found that hairy arms, dry skin and even how tightly the watch is worn can affect the results. Apple Watch became known as a black hole within the company, the WSJ's sources said.

Oliver Ilic, 22, cut off his organ with a single swipe from a razor blade. He allegedly told doctors that he had a small penis and so his girlfriend dumped him. Ilic contacted the emergency services when he could not stop the bleeding. Police searched his house and discovered the severed organ and the razor blade in a bin.

Images of a Starbucks PSL-inspired condom took social media by storm. There have been no official corporate announcements determining if this will be a reality or not. If there’s anything that could get the population on the condom train it would have to be the PSL trend.

Rumors are swirling about a 12-inch MacBook Air refresh. Apple is reportedly redesigning the iconic laptop to be even thinner with a higher resolution screen. Sources inside the company who have used the prototype notebook say it will eschew many of the conventional laptop features. The updated MacBook Air could be announced in mid-2015.

Father John Micheal O’neal was declared clinically dead on January 29. Medics were able to re-start his heart with the aid of a high-tech machine. He woke up less than 48 hours later and seems to have fully recovered. The 71-year-old claims he had an out-of-body experience during which he met God. The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Boston has not confirmed if they will allow him to resume his preaching.

The red and white spotted toadstool is called Amanita muscaria, or fly agaric. Titchmarsh, 65, asks in an ITV show to be screened on Christmas Day: “Is it edible?”Professor Crawley replies: ‘That depends what you mean. It’s eaten in some cultures for its hallucinogenic affects.’

The 85-year-old woman admitted to trying to raise her own cats, but became too attached to them. Prosecutors claim the retired fashion designer skinned the cats in her basement. It is believed that it took thirty cats to make a single coat. If the unnamed woman is found guilty, she could face up to eighteen months in prison.

A homeless man was given a hundred dollars, and what he did will make you cry. YouTube channel owner Josh Paler Lin decided to see it for himself and capture it all on camera. Normally when you think of the homeless, you probably picture some drug or alcohol addict who is only taking money from passerby to support their next fix.

Nigeria's official news agency says the government fighters from Boko Haram have agreed to an immediate ceasefire. It quoted the chief of defence staff, Air Marshal Alex Badeh, as ordering his troops to immediately comply with the agreement on Friday. News comes as another official confirmed there had been direct negotiations this week in neighbouring Chad about the release of more than 200 schoolgirls abducted six months ago.

YouTuber Josh Paler Lin wanted to see what would happen if he gave $100 to a hungry homeless man. To find out, Josh approached a homeless man by a motorway in Los Angeles, and handed him $100. He then proceeded to follow the homeless man in secret with a camera to see how he would spend it.

Kevin Vickers, 58, led a ceremonial parade into the chamber on Thursday morning and was greeted by a standing ovation. He managed to stay mostly expressionless during the minutes-long applause, but as the cheers continued, he appeared to tear up. Prime Minister Stephen Harper thanked Vickers for ending Michael Zehaf-Bibeau's shooting spree. Vickers took over the role of sergeant-at-arms 8 years ago after working with the RCMP for 29 years.Kevin Vickers, Canada's House of Commons' sergeant-at-arms, led the way as officials chased down Michael Zehaf-Bibeau on Wednesday after he murdered reservist Nathan Cirillo and entered the Parliament building. Vickers serves a largely ceremonial role, carrying a scepter and wearing rich green robes, white gloves and a tall imperial tricorne hat. A fit, tall 6-foot-4, Vickers spends many of his lunch breaks running in order to stay fit.Prime Minister Stephen Harper and other MPs stopped to lay a wreath at the war memorial on Thursday morning. Police wrestled a man to the ground for getting too close to the leader, CTV reported. Corporal Cirillo, from Hamilton, Ontario, has been remembered as a generous man and a fitness fanatic, who rescued dogs.

A Bolivian nun gave birth in San Severino Marche after being taken to hospital where she complained of a bad stomach ache. The newspaper said the nun, whose age wasn't given, gave birth last Sunday and intends to keep the baby. The nun had been staying at a cloistered convent in the province of Macerata since June.

Henry “Big Bank Hank’ Jackson of the Sugarhill Gang died early Tuesday from kidney complications due to cancer, his manager said. He was 57. “[Sugarhill Gang's Wonder Mike and Master Gee] had been in contact with him in the past year,” manager David Mallie said.

At least 15 bodies have so far been dug out of pits discovered Saturday on a hill. The grim find came a week after the students disappeared when a protest turned deadly. Witnesses in Iguala say municipal police officers whisked several of the students away. Authorities are conducting DNA analysis to identify the victims.

The wife and son of Islamic State chief Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi were arrested in Lebanon. Details about the development are still coming into focus. It's unclear how useful these arrests will ultimately be, but they come as Lebanese authorities attempt to secure the release of 20 soldiers held captive by Islamist groups.

Home Alone star Macaulay Culkin is still very much alive. The hoax has gone super-viral and is currently trending all over Facebook. Facebook users have shared the link to the hoax story over 700,000 times. Culkin was still performing with his band on Friday night.

Chosun Ilbo: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un underwent surgery to repair fractures in both ankles. Kim has not been seen in public since September 3, and his absence has prompted rampant speculation about his health. The 31-year-old is rumored to be suffering from various ailments, including gout.

Sources at a hospital in the northern Iraqi city of Mosul say they have seen suspected cases involving two IS fighters. They are believed to have unknowingly travelled from their African homelands with Ebola. News will spark fears that the jihadists could use the killer virus to hit Britain with so-called "human-bug bombs" Intelligence experts have already urged authorities to be ready for members of the extremist outfit deliberately trying to spread Ebola in the West.

Dylan Thomas, 21, was abroad with friends when he discovered the red trail. Doctors at the Bali International Medical Centre said he was suffering from an allergic reaction to an insect bite. When the red mark began to blister, and almost double in length, Dylan knew there was something wrong.

A newly discovered bug causes iCloud Drive documents to be permanently erased from the cloud. Documents are disappearing from Apple's iWork apps upon reset. It's unclear how widespread the bug is or whether it affects everyone that has transitioned to iCloud Drive. For now, the best option is avoiding "Reset All Settings" entirely until a fix is in place.

A senior Western intelligence official told Fox News that 23-year-old London rapper Abdel Majed Abdel Bary is the suspect. Bary's Egyptian-born father was extradited from London to the United States in 2012 for his alleged connection to Usama bin Laden and the 1998 U.S. Embassy bombings in Africa.

A photo of a note purportedly printed on a LEGO pamphlet from the 1970s has gone viral. The legitimacy of the note has been called into question, but there's good reason to believe it's real. The LEGO logo in the note is noticeably different from the more modern LEGO logo, which was updated in 1998.

A fake photo of a pumpkin spice condom is making the rounds on Twitter. Durex refuses to make it happen. Just eat a slice of pie and then have sex. Or sex then pie. Point is, waffles come first. It is not a good idea. You’re gonna think it’s agood idea, but, girl, it is not.

Abdel Majed Abdel Bary, a 23-year-old London hip-hop artist, has emerged as one of the main suspects in the investigation into the beheading of journalist James Foley. Counterterrorism police and MI5 believe Bary is the person who appears in the video posted by ISIS. Bary's father was extradited from Great Britain to the U.S. in 2012 because of his connection with Osama bin Laden.

Knightscope K5 robot security guards are fitted with lasers, GPS and heat-detecting technology. Unlike human security guards, the egg-like Knightscopes are not armed. The robots analyse information from government, businesses and social media sources to predict the likelihood of a crime being committed.

News of guitarist Willie Nelson’s death spread quickly earlier this week causing concern among fans across the world. However the February 2015 report has now been confirmed as a complete hoax and just the latest in a string of fake celebrity death reports. Thankfully, the guitarist best known for hit songs like To All the Girls I've Loved Before or Pancho and Lefty is alive and well.

Kim Jong-un, 31, is under armed guard by his personal protection team at a hospital in North Korea’s capital, Pyongyang. He is believed to have sprained then fractured his ankles during a gruelling tour of military bases and factories in shoes with Cuban heels to give him more authority.

NBC meteorologist Mike Seidel was caught on camera peeing in the snow while on-air with Lester Holt over the weekend. Anchor Brian Williams explained that Seidel didn't realize he was live on-camera. Williams also called for an apology from social media for the confusion.

The Nigerian government says it reached a cease-fire agreement with Boko Haram. The agreement includes provisions for the release of the kidnapped girls. The Nigerian government has lied about the girls several times in the past. Some experts questioned the credibility of the officials’ claims, in part because news comes as President Jonathan prepares to launch a re-election bid.

Casey Dean and Eduard Nitz bought the burger for a friend in the mid-90s. He never turned up and asked them to keep it safe for when he was in the city next. Now 20 years later, it remains under lock and key and bears an uncanny resemblance to its far fresher contemporaries. The pair showed off the mould-free specimen on The Project tonight.

A new video shows a man who looks like Paul Rudd. The actor's reps have denied that the man in the video is him. The video was filmed at the Dallas airport, where a man went on a homophobic rant. A group of passers-by tackled him and pinned him to the ground.

Investment firm Piper Jaffray issued a report on Monday breaking down expected Apple Watch average selling prices. Analyst Gene Munster anticipates combined Apple Watch ASPs to fall closer to $550, or $575 to $600 including additional bands. Apple Watch will come in three separate price tiers — Apple Watch Sport, Apple Watch and Apple Watch Edition.

Michael Zehaf-Bibeau, 32, was identified as the gunman in the Ottawa shootings. He killed a soldier and wounded two other people before being killed by a police officer. He had recently converted to Islam and had been designated a "high-risk traveler" by Canadian officials.

Stan Beaton has treasured his wife Ruby's voicemail since her death in 2003. In December, the message was lost during a service upgrade. Beaton contacted Virgin Media to see if they could retrieve it. With the help of nearly a dozen engineers, they did.

The World Health Organization is investigating reports that ISIS militants have contracted the deadly Ebola virus and are seeking help at a hospital in Mosul in Iraq. The virus, which has claimed thousands of lives in West Africa, is believed to have been brought to the city by jihadists from several different countries. A WHO spokesman confirmed that the health agency is reaching out to ISIS officials in the region to gather more information.

Taylor Lianne Chandler, 41, told Radar Online that she was actually born a male. Chandler, whose birth name was David Roy Fitch, said she was an “intersex baby,” with partial male and partial female genitalia. Chandler said she met Phelps, 29, on Tinder in August.

Comcast has reportedly told customers using Tor Browser to stop using the browser or risk termination of service. Comcast has previously been listed by the Tor project as a Bad ISP that is not friendly to Tor. Comcast already monitors its customers internet usage to prevent them downloading pirated media in violation of copyright laws.

Analyst John Gruber predicts that the gold Apple Watch would cost $5,000. He based his estimate on the going rate for solid gold watches from other manufacturers. Gruber suspects that the reason Apple has been mostly silent about the specs for the device is that they don't know what the capabilities of the finished product would be.

A Twitter user by the name of Cassy delivered the ultimate f*ck you to her cheating boyfriend on Christmas. The details are scarce (outside of the this tweet) but it appears our heroine printed out Twitter DM’s her significant other exchanged with another woman. At last check, it had garnered over 13,000 RTs.

Taugan Tan Kadalim says he and prankster Josh Paler Lin arrived at a liquor store in the same car. He says he spotted Lin sitting in the driver's seat of a nearby vehicle and recognized him from previous prank videos. In the actual video, Thomas appears to be followed from a distance for several blocks.“I’m frustrated because it’s dishonest and exploitive.” Lin told Vocativ that not a single scene had been staged or scripted. “There is no way we’re making any of this up,” he said.

Dimitry Nikolaev, a married Russian television actor, was having a drink at a bar in Moscow when an attractive, blonde woman approached him. The unidentified woman invited him to accompany her to a sauna where, according to police reports, they drank beer and kissed before he blacked out. The next morning, Dimitry woke up at a bus stop to find his phone, wallet, and testicles had all been stolen.

Apple is reportedly relying on Samsung’s chip-building talents to mass-produce the brand-new chip in the Apple Watch. The S1 system-in-package (SiP) contains various other components on top of the chip, including mobile DRAM, NAND flash, and other peripheral chips. Samsung has won orders from Apple to make some 3,000 to 4,000 12-inch wafers each month.

French Apple website iGen.fr is reporting pricing for the stainless steel Apple Watch may start at $500. The gold Apple Watch's pricing could start between $4,000 and $5,000. The site's sources also indicate that Apple still aims to release the Watch by Valentine's Day 2015.

The authenticity of the video could not be verified. YouTube later took down the four-minute, 40-second video. Mr. Foley, 40, disappeared in Syria on Nov. 22, 2012. He was on what he thought would be a four-week adventure vacation when he was kidnapped.Mr. Foley, who was last seen in Binesh, Syria, was also abducted in Libya in 2011. He was among dozens of journalists who disappeared in 2012 and 2013 in Syria. The terrorist group said it executed Mr. Foley in retaliation for American airstrikes in Iraq, not Syria.

UK Prime Minister David Cameron condemned the beheading of David Haines. UK PM David Cameron condemns the beheadings of David Haines, a British soldier. David Cameron: 'I am deeply saddened by the loss of this young man's life. I am deeply concerned for his family'

The fat dictator is eyeing up locations as he looks to expand the state-backed chain of restaurants. Michael Madden, editor of the North Korea Leadership Watch blog, claimed Kim is desperate to build diplomatic ties with European countries with left-wing leanings. He said: “It would not surprise me at all if they opened a restaurant in Scotland’

Abdel-Majed Abdel Bary has reportedly been identified the ISIS militant who beheaded American journalist James Foley in a video released this week. Reports over the last several days had indicated that British intelligence forces were focusing in on the 23-year-old former London resident. Bary is believed to have traveled to Syria and recently tweeted a picture of himself holding a severed head.

A “breaking news” story claiming, “Macaulay Culkin Found Dead at Age 34″ is a 100 percent fake hoax that’s gone viral on Facebook and Twitter. The rumor has been fueled by what looks like a screenshot from a cable news broadcast. At least one version of the “dead’ story appears on a MSNBC.website URL.

Seth Rogen will play Steve Wozniak in Sony's Steve Jobs biopic. Christian Bale has been cast in the role of Steve Jobs. Rogen is a popular actor who has starred in movies like Neighbors, Pineapple Express, Knocked Up and This Is the End.

Jess Smith was selected to be the giggling baby sun at the age of nine months. The show was a global hit and Jess, now 19, became one of the most famous faces in the world - but only her family ever knew it was her. There were even rumours the true identity of the baby was another Jessica Smith - the 27-year-old star of American teen soap Laguna Beach.

David Cameron denounces IS as the "embodiment of evil" UK PM vows to hunt down those responsible and bring them to justice. Video showing the beheading of David Haines released by IS militants late Saturday. It was the third beheading by the terror group in less than a month.

Apple Watch rumoured to have 512MB of RAM and 4GB of RAM. Analyst Timothy Arcuri of Cowen and Company says this is from a source in Apple's supply chain. Chipworks has provided a visual teardown of the Apple Watch internals. It reckons it's spotted the Broadcom Wi-Fi chip that Cupertino has chosen.

Bale was rumored to be the finalist to play the Apple co-founder in the Aaron Sorkin-written film biography. The Jobs biopic has been in the works since at least 2012. The film is to be directed by Danny Boyle, who won an Oscar for "Slumdog Millionaire"

Oliver Ilic, from Kocani, told doctors that his girlfriend had complained about the size of his penis. Police found his severed penis in a bin. Mr Ilic was then transferred to a hospital in the Macedonian capital, Skopje, where he underwent a five-hour operation to reattach the penis.

A PGA Tour golfer said he has sources who tell him that Tiger Woods is currently serving a one-month suspension for PED use. “When it is all said and done, he is going to surpass Lance Armstrong with…a…infamy,” Dan Olsen said.

Comcast has reportedly begun telling users that Tor is an “illegal service.” Tor is a type of Web browser that, in theory, makes all your Internet activity private. Up to 1.2 million people use the browser, which became popular after Edward Snowden leaked information showing that the NSA was eavesdropping on ordinary citizens.

Big Bank Hank died early Tuesday after a battle with cancer, according to TMZ. He was born Henry Jackson but was also known as Imp the Dimp. Rapper's Delight is considered the moment that hip-hop became commercially viable. "Rest in peace... Big Bank Hank," wrote DJ Funkmaster Flex on Instagram.

Taylor Lianne Chandler, who dated the 29-year-old US swimmer for months, wrote a long post on her Facebook page. She revealed that she was "born intersex and named David Roy Fitch" at birth. Chandler met Phelps on dating app Tinder, and was with the Olympian when he was arrested for drink driving on Sep 30.

Nigeria claims to have reached a deal with Boko Haram militants on a ceasefire and the release of more than 200 kidnapped schoolgirls. But doubts immediately surrounded the purported breakthrough. A precedent of previous claims from the government and military about an end to the deadly five-year conflict and the fate of the missing teenagers left many observers urging caution.Turaki on several occasions maintained that he was negotiating with legitimate Boko Haram commanders. But nothing materialised from Turaki's protracted negotiations. Shekau said that he never sent delegates to any talks and attacks continued at a relentless pace. He said: 'I am not a terrorist. I am a man of peace'

A crater outside Nicaragua's capital was reported early Monday. Some Nicaraguan astronomers attributed the blast to a weekend asteroid flyby. But NASA scientists have now cast doubt on whether the blast was even a meteorite. A small asteroid passed within 22,000 miles (36,000 kilometers) of Earth on Sunday.

Father John Micheal O’neal, 71, claims he went to heaven and met God, whom he describes as a warm and comforting motherly figure. ‘The fact that God is a Holy Mother instead of a Holy Father doesn’t disturb me, she is everything I hoped she would be and even more!’

Woods' former 62-acre island in Lake Malaren, Sweden, has been put on the market. The island features one golf hole in addition to a “mini mansion,’ secluded villa, hunting lodge, private barber and landing strip for propeller planes.

Mohammed Islam, 17, is the son of Bengali immigrants who live in Queens. He attends Stuyvesant High School in downtown Manhattan. Islam and his team of three teen Wall Street JV investors plan on starting a hedge fund together in a few months.

James Foley, an American journalist who went missing in Syria more than a year ago, has reportedly been executed by the Islamic State. Video and photos purportedly of Foley emerged on Tuesday. A YouTube video identified a man on his knees as "James Wright Foley," and showed his execution.

A video of a bunch of Dallas airport heroes tackling the fuck out of that violent homophobe guy. One of the heroes was Paul Rudd, because you are not Internet sleuth Sara Benincasa. This is even better than the time Ryan Gosling Hey Girled Laurie Penny from getting hit by a lorrie!

Esquire published an article suggesting ESPN was planning to host a male-only panel discussion on domestic violence during this week’s “Monday Night Football” broadcast. The assertion that ESPN would host such a panel discussion and not invite any women to participate sparked outrage. On Monday, ESPN's John Wildhack, executive vice president of programming and production released a statement refuting the original report.

Kevin Vickers became the sergeant-at-arms in the House of Commons eight years ago. He spent 29 years with the RCMP and rose to the rank of chief superintendent. As an RCMP officer, Vickers has been responsible for security services provided for the Queen and Prince Andrew.

Dim Xiong Chien, 22, had taken three large boxes of fireworks onto campus. He planned to set them off as he got down on one knee and popped the question. When she forgot to turn up he lit the fireworks anyway, hoping she would see them and come to see what was happening.

Seth Rogen has reportedly signed on to star as Steve Wozniak in the upcoming Steve Jobs film. The comic actor would join Christian Bale, who is tipped to play Jobs. Sony's flick would be the fourth such feature film that's either in the works or has already been made.

Jess Smith, 19, was the giggly baby sun that kids saw each week on the PBS show Teletubbies. She was chosen to be featured in the series when she was just 9 months old. Smith earned 250 pounds (roughly $390 in the U.S.) for her bit and a box of toys.

London rapper Abdel Majed Abdel Bary is the main suspect in the beheading of American journalist James Foley. Bary's music was played on the BBC radio in the past. He left London last year to go to Syria and fight with the ISIS. High-tech equipment was used to identify the man seen in the video beheading Foley.

The male Shar-Pei crossbreed was discovered tied to a railing outside Ayr station. The suitcase included the dog's pillow, toy, food bowl and food. The Scottish SPCA traced a previous owner but were told it was sold in 2013 to someone they did not have details for.

The World Health Organization and the Ministry of Health in Iraq made that clear in a statement late Monday. That came after rumors spread online and through several media outlets on Dec. 31. Most of them cited anonymous medical sources in the city of Mosul, which has been under the control of Islamic State militants since June.

Pentagon spokesman: U.S. has not conducted any targeted airstrikes against specific ISIL personnel. “With every terrorist that we kill from the air, that is one less terrorist on the ground,” Col. Steve Warren said. President Barack Obama will address his nation Wednesday night.

J.J. Abrams has reportedly approached Disney about moving up the Star Wars: The Force Awakens release date. Disney is reportedly taking Abrams’ request very seriously and is looking at a possible summer release. This would put Star Wars up against other giant franchise releases, namely Jurassic World and Avengers 2: Age Of Ultron.

A pizza delivery guy in Ann Arbor, Michigan, received a tip of $2,084 Thursday. He delivered a single pizza to a conference of real estate agents. Agents from Keller Williams Realty had gathered for a regional conference. They decided to surprise the delivery guy with a random act of kindness.

shar-pei cross was found tied to a railing outside Ayr station in Scotland. A suitcase held a number of the dog's belongings, including a pillow, toy, food bowl and food. The Scottish SPCA (Scotland’s Animal Welfare Charity) is appealing for information. Abandoning an animal is an offence under the Animal Health and Welfare (Scotland) Act 2006.

Casey Dean, 14, and his mate Eduard Nitz, 13, bought a Quarter Pounder with cheese in 1995 for a friend who never turned up. Now the boys have become men and the burger has turned 20. The last McDonald's cheeseburger ever sold in Iceland is still going strong and mould-free.

The officers served in the Iraqi military during the 24-year rule of Saddam Hussein. They are conducting the training at the captured al-Jarrah military airport east of Aleppo in northern Syria. The aircraft are believed to be MiG-21s andMiG-23s that were seized at Syrian air bases.

The FBI is evaluating a video purporting to show James Foley's beheading. The images show a man resembling Foley kneeling next to a masked militant. Foley has been missing since November of 2012, when he was kidnapped in Syria. The Islamic State also says it's holding another American journalist, Steven Joel Sotloff.

Knightscope co-founder Stacy Stephens said rumors that its K5 security robots are roaming Microsoft's Silicon Valley campus are not true. The 5-feet, 300-pound K5 looks like R2-D2 from Star Wars. They roam around with a slew of sensors, looking for trouble, sounding alarms and alerting security guards.

A man in his mid-to-late 50s is reportedly slapping people in Cumbria, England, for sneezing in public. One of his most recent victims was an 82-year-old woman who sneezed on Tuesday. Police are appealing to the local community to help trace the man.

Eleven Iraqi police officers were taken to hospital after an ISIS chemical weapons attack, with the Defense Ministry and doctors recently confirming the gas as chlorine. This marks the first officially documented militant attack with the chemical. The Islamic State (IS, formerly ISIS/ISIL) militants’ chlorine gas attack occurred on September 15, in the town of Duluiyah.

Claim: The town of Purdon, Texas was quarantined after a family of five there tested positive for the Ebola virus. The town is located 70 miles from Dallas, the city in which Ebola patient Thomas Eric Duncan died of the disease. Shortly after Duncan's death, the Centers for Disease Control disclosed that a nurse at Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital had contracted the hemorrhagic virus while caring for Duncan.

The World Health Organization is looking into reports that ISIS fighters in Iraq have been showing up at hospitals with Ebola symptoms. An unknown number of ISIS militants have shown up at a hospital in the militant-controlled city of Mosul, about 250 miles north of Baghdad. The paper reported that foreign terrorists brought the disease into Mosul from “several countries” in Africa.

The monarch may personally take part in bombing raids on extremist strongholds on Thursday, according to reports in Arabic-language newspapers. It comes after the former general told members of Congress that he was ready to exact a blistering revenge against the ISIS terror army for the brutal execution of military pilot Moaz al-Kassasbeh. He quoted a Clint Eastwood movie character to make his point. 'Any man I see out there, I'm gonna kill him,' Eastwood's William Munny says in 'Unforgiven' 'He said there is going to be retribution like ISIS hasn't seen,' said California Republican Rep. Duncan Hunter.Al-Kassasbeh was captured in December when his F-16 jet crashed over northern Syria, a mission that was part of the U.S.-led coalition campaign against the jihadists.
