Apple has declined to state a price of the Apple Watch Edition. The watch will be given an 18-karat gold treatment. It is possible that the gold Apple Watch could retail for as much as $1,200. This is a significant leap over the base Apple Watch which is priced starting at $349.

Apple Watch will start at $349 for the basic Sport model with a rubber strap. No one knows how much the stainless steel and 18-karat gold Edition models will cost. Apple is expected to reveal the Watch's pricing structure and release date at a media event before the end of April.

Mexican authorities say remains found in a mass grave outside the town of Iquala are not those of the students. The mystery surrounding the disappearance of 43 students last month has deepened. The remains have been identified as those of a male and a female student. The investigation is ongoing.

Multiple news outlets were duped by a fake news site posing as Chinese public broadcaster CCTV. The fake site lists as good names "'proper' traditional names" like Elizabeth, Michael and William. No-no names include "Surprise, Dragon, Fish [and] Lawyer," as well as "food as a name"

Jess Smith, from Chatham, Kent, was selected to be the giggling baby sun who looks over Teletubbyland when she was just nine months old. The show was a global hit and Miss Smith, a first-year dance education student at Canterbury Christ Church University, became one of the most famous faces in the world. But only her family knew it was her. Miss Smith only revealed her secret during a game with her university friends - where they all had to say something about themselves.Miss Smith said she is not disappointed by her small payment of £250. The production company also sent the family a video of her performance. She said: 'I am sure I loved the box of toys. No one knew how big the show was going to be so we didn't get offered royalties'

Suresh Kumar, 40, was beaten with sticks for about an hour before his genitals was cut off. The incident occurred in the city of Ganganagar, where Kumar was left bleeding as his penis and testicles lay on the road next to him. An eyewitness, Aamir Dhawan, who was at the scene, said people were reluctant to help the rapist, after seeing his private parts.

Shane Smith, the chief executive of Vice Media, paid for the meal personally. More than 30 people were at the dinner, including friends, other Vice executives and staff members. Liquor flowed freely, with some bottles of wine costing more than $20,000.

Apple originally wanted its smartwatch to focus far more prominently on health-related innovations. If Apple had had its way, the Apple Watch would have boasted smart sensors capable of tracking blood pressure, heart rate and even stress levels. Despite hiring top people from the biosensor industry, the technology didn't work quite as well as had been hoped.

US officials say 11 commercial aircraft have gone missing from Tripoli International Airport in Libya. The airport was the scene of a fierce battle that ended on August 26, when fighters from the Islamic Fajr Libya (Dawn of Libya) coalition captured the airport. The planes are being held by a group called the Masked Men Brigade, and it plans to use them in terror attacks.

40-year-old Suresh Kumar found pinning the girl against a wall. The mob dragged him to a nearby butchers’ shop where he was beaten up with sticks for an hour before castrating him. Police said people can't take the law into their "own hands" and are looking for the attackers.

Elon University in North Carolina has banned the word “freshman’ from its website and student orientation. The school says the term suggests that young women might make good rape victims. The word is apparently so dangerous that any orientation leader who dared to use it was immediately corrected.

ISIS has released a video purportedly showing the beheading of British aid worker David Haines. The authenticity of the video has not been independently confirmed. The organization, also known as ISIS, had threatened to kill Haine just under two weeks ago. The 44-year-old father of two from Perth, Scotland was abducted in Syria in 2013.

Ryan Roche says he downed a quart of eggnog in 12 seconds without taking a breath. He soon began coughing and gasping. A friend drove him to the hospital as Roche was shaking and struggling to breathe. He was put on oxygen and antibiotics and released from the hospital after three days.

French Apple website iGen claims to have heard from their sources that this event could be held on the 24th of February. Apple is expected to share the finalized specs and launch plans for the Apple Watch, and will also be announcing the rumored 12-inch MacBook Air.

Ting Su, 29, caught husband Cheng naked in an underground carpark in China. She tracked the pair down using a mobile tracking system. When Su arrived on the scene to confront them, the surprised pair reacted to the bust and jumped out of the car. Su seized the moment by taking some happy snaps before driving off.

The man who jumped the White House fence Sept. 19 pushed his way past a female Secret Service agent before he was overpowered by a male agent in the building’s large East Room. After he pushed past the female agent, he ran past the stairway that leads to the president's personal quarters. The Secret Service's response to Gonzalez's dash from the front railing was slowed because perimeter alarms — dubbed “crash boxes” — had been muffled.

A new report from TechCrunch details a hidden "diagnostic port" inside one of the channels on the Apple Watch where watch bands slip into place. While the port is currently used only for diagnostic purposes, the report argues it could be used in the future to interface with "smart band" accessories bringing additional functionality to the watch.

Rep. Duncan Hunter, R-Calif., said at least 10 Islamic State operatives were detained trying to come in from Mexico. "We have no credible, specific intelligence to that effect," Homeland Security Secretary Jeh Johnson said. Johnson never mentioned Hunter by name, but he has called on lawmakers to act responsibly and not frighten Americans.

Ryan Roche of Lehi, Utah, chugged a quart of eggnog in 12 seconds. He was rushed to the hospital after he started to feel sick. Roche spent a full day in the ICU and two more days recovering at the hospital. "It took me a full week of recovery to be 100 percent," he said.

Dim Xiong Chien is a 22-year-old college student studying in Shenyang, China. He organized a surprise proposal with fireworks for his girlfriend Cong Yen, but she never showed up. So he decided to set them off anyway, hoping she’d see the huge display.

Lebanese army detained a wife and a son of Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi. The wife was a Syian citizen and the detained son was nine years old. They were detained 10 days ago and have been questioned at the ministry of defence. The armed ISIL group has seized wide areas of Iraq and Syria.

Bleeding Cool had reported that one of the two batmobiles that are being used for “Batman v. Superman: Dawn of Justice,” was stolen in Detroit. Well Zack Snyder solved the case himself over Twitter. Snyder released this photo below, to make fun of that rumor and take a friendly shot at J.J. Abrams.

Chinese people prefer to use an English name, particularly if they conduct business with the West. A satirical website has poked fun at the practice in a report urging citizens to think carefully before making their decision. The site, which is done in the style of the state-owned CCTV website, warns people against picking names that could cause offence.

A pizza delivery driver gets a $2,000 tip for delivering a pizza to a group of realtors. Pizza House delivery manager Brian LeFevre said he received a call Thursday morning. The driver was escorted to a conference room filled with more than 200 real estate agents.

Unconfirmed reports say a soldier was shot at the War Memorial on Parliament Hill. There have been no confirmed reports of any injuries. The incident is believed to have taken place at around 2.30pm on Wednesday. The shooting is not thought to have been a result of a single incident.

Luke Somers was shot by his captors during a raid by US forces, a US official said. US Defence Secretary Chuck Hagel confirmed the killing and said a second, non-US hostage, also died. Yemen's defence ministry confirmed a "major operation" had taken place in Yemen's southern Shabwa province.

An actual Batmobile was stolen from the set of Batman v Superman yesterday. No official word has come down from the powers that be with the film, until Zack Snyder’s latest Star Wars tease. Strange that GCPD cracked the case before Batman did. Maybe he was just boosting their egos.

Brian Williams addressed rumors that meteorologist Mike Seidel was writing his name in the snow during a live appearance with Lester Holt. Williams explained that Seidel has lost communication with the NBC station and couldn’t hear Holt through his earpiece so he took off his gloves and redialed his phone.

Microsoft recently installed a fleet of 5-feet-tall, 300-pound robots to protect its Silicon Valley campus. The robots are packed with HD security cameras and sensors to take in their organic, protein-based surroundings. A single charge will last 24 hours, and if the robot notices that its battery is getting low, it will return to a charging port.

The Islamic State terror group has burned the corpses of five of its fighters due to the belief that they had contracted the deadly Ebola virus, according to an Iraqi health official. The Islamic State organization incinerated five militants infected with Ebola to prevent further spread of the disease in Mosul (Iraq), said Faisal Ghazi.

A think-tank run by defectors says Kim Yo Jong may be at least temporarily leading the government. The group has not revealed the source of its information, and CNN cannot independently confirm it. North Korea-watchers are concerned about her being in the top leadership spot, if only temporarily.

Apple’s next-generation MacBook Air is expected to come with a 12-inch screen, according to a report. The device is said to be a quarter-of-an-inch narrower than the 11-inch version, while also sporting a taller body in order to incorporate the slightly larger display. The new MacBook Air could also feature an edge-to-edge keyboard with a redesigned key set, allowing each key to sit closer together.

Saudi state TV allegedly blurred out the face of Michelle Obama during a brief televised meeting between the new Saudi King Salman and the President at Riyadh, the capital of Saudi Arabia. The new King reportedly refused to acknowledge the presence of the First Lady and did not say hello or shake hands with her, the report adds.

A video shared online made it seem as if Vladimir Putin got some unwelcome love from a feathered friend Sunday during a speech. Putin was speaking about the sacrifice made by Russian soldiers in World War I, linking the Great War to his own current political troubles. The video was falsely doctored to show a bird defecating on Putin.

The tape is the voice of a  Ferguson man talking during a video chat. In the background you can hear what sounds like several gunshots, a pause and then several more gunshots. The shooting death of Brown, at the hands of Ferguson police officer Darren Wilson, sparked nightly protests and clashes with law enforcement.

Video and pictures of journalist James Wright Foley’s final moments have been published via Twitter by accounts claiming to be associated with the Islamic State. Mr Foley was abducted in Idlib, Iraq, in 2012. The identity of the man in the high-definition footage, titled “A Message to America” has not yet been confirmed.

Four bodies have been found at the suspected massacre site of missing students. The bodies are believed to have been there for more than a week. The site is believed to be the site of a massacre by a group of students in the 1970s and 1980s. The victims were believed to all be students from the same school.

The hashtag refers to a meme that blew up after a Fox contributor declared certain British cities had been swallowed whole by Muslim immigrants.

The directive was issued in January 2011 after the death of Kim Jong-il. The process requires changing names on official documents, such as government ID cards and school diplomas. The authenticity of the document cannot be independently verified and South Korea has refused to comment on it.

43 students went missing three weeks ago amid violent protests in Iguala, south of Mexico City. Mexico's attorney general says further tests are being carried out on four other grave sites. About 50 people have been arrested in connection with the students' disappearance, with the vast majority being local police officers.

Iraqi Interior Ministry says woman detained by Lebanese authorities was not wife of Islamic State leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi. Saja Abdul Hamid al-Dulaimi is the sister of a man convicted of bombings in southern Iraq, ministry spokesman says. She was part of a group of female detainees freed in exchange for the release of nuns captured by Islamist rebels in Syria, he says.

Seth Rogen is reportedly in talks to play Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak in Aaron Sorkin's Steve Jobs biopic. Hollywood actress Jessica Chastain is also being courted for a role in the film. Bale has already been cast as the lead in the Steve Jobs biography. The film is expected to follow the late technology whiz during three stressful and high profile product launches.

A young cloistered nun, of Bolivian origin and 35 years, gave birth to a baby at the hospital Bartolomeo Eustachio San Severino Marche (Macerata) The nun would however confided to doctors the decision to hold the child. For the moment, the baby was conducted to investigations in Neonatology Hospital of Macerata.

A photo recently uploaded online in China showing someone reportedly working on an array of mobile phones has gone viral overnight. In the photo, a woman with about a hundred iPhones placed before her appears to be giving out fake ratings to apps by going phone by phone. About a hundred fake ratings, which have the potential to affect the top lists of Apple's App Store, can be created within an hour or two.

Sources tell Re/code that Apple is working to improve battery life before the product's 2015 debut. The Apple Watch will go on sale in early 2015 with a starting price of $349. The smart watch will be available in two sizes with a variety of colors, materials and watch bands.

US website National Report claimed artist had been arrested in Watford. Claimed his art studio in the capital had been raided and counterfeit money found. Scotland Yard confirmed the story - which left Banksy's name trending on Twitter - was fake. The story hit a chord with Louise Mensch, the former Conservative MP who is active on Twitter.

Seth Rogen is being eyed to play Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak in Sony’s Steve Jobs biopic. Danny Boyle is directing the untitled film, based on Walter Isaacson's book and adapted by Aaron Sorkin. Christian Bale, the actor who is to play Jobs, is still in the midst of closing his deal.

Gawker reports that Vogue has a rat problem. The rats are nibbling away at shoe boxes, noshing on taffeta, and leaving droppings everywhere. Anna Wintour and Condé Nast may have requested architectural changes prior to the move-in date.

Gill Rosenberg, a former Israel Defense Forces soldier, is believed to be in ISIS custody. ISIS-affiliated web forums claim she was captured while fighting with the Kurds against ISIS in Kobane. ISIS members urged leaders to use Rosenberg as a bargaining chip for a prisoner exchange with Israel.

Small meteorite left a crater in a wooded area near Managua's airport. crater had a radius of 12 meters (39 feet) and a depth of 5 meters (16 feet) It is still not clear if the meteorite disintegrated or was buried.

The man who broke into the White House two weeks ago was able to make his way far into the property before being tackled in the East Room. The agency's director, Julie Pierson, will be on the hot seat Tuesday as the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee hold a hearing.

Amazon is planning to open a brick-and-mortar store in New York City, The Wall Street Journal reports. The store would reportedly function like a mini-warehouse, with inventory for same-day delivery. It would also act as a hub for product returns, exchanges, and pickup of online orders.

In North Korea, no one can have the same name as supreme leader Kim Jong Un. Newborns cannot be given the name, and citizens who bore it before the ban were required to assume new names. South Korean media outlets said the name ban was contained in a directive from 2011.

DNA tests have confirmed that a daughter and an ex-wife of the head of Isis, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, are indeed being held by Lebanese authorities. The woman, who has been named as Saja al-Dulaimi, was travelling with two sons and a daughter, Interior Minister Nouhad Mashnuq said. He said DNA tests showed the girl was Baghdadi's child.

Audio allegedly recorded at the time of Michael Brown’s death has been released. The audio features a man speaking via video chat about unrelated topics. The recording is regarded as such an important piece of evidence. One can clearly hear at least 10 gunshots ring out over the course of the 12-second file.

A few new rumors suggest that we’ll get the Apple Watch sometime in February. The software itself is still in development, and the company has yet to release the WatchKit SDK.

Three senior members of the Islamic State of Iraq and al-Sham (ISIS) - including an aide to its leader - were killed in a U.S. airstrike in Iraq. Pentagon Spokesman Col. Steve Warren said ISIS leaders had not been targeted. But he added that if ISIS leaders were embedded "inside troop formations they are likely to be killed"

A rumor surfaced that Durex had launched a pumpkin spice condom. The company did not immediately confirm or deny the existence of the product. The Internet had a field day with the pumpkin spice rumor. An unnamed company spokesperson told BuzzFeed that the condom would not be coming out.

A FOX News impostor website posted a false report saying that Judd Nelson was found dead in his West Hollywood condo. The fake news site even created an elaborate story surrounding Judd Nelson’s alleged death, writing that the Los Angeles County Department of Medical Examiner-Coroner was trying to determine his cause of death. The actor's agent and his manager both confirmed that the news of his death was premature.

Iraqi group ISIS beheaded American photo-jornalist James Wright Foley, releasing gruesome pictures and video to the internet on Tuesday. Foley had been missing after being captured in Syria in 2012 while working freelance for AFP. Time journalist Steven Sotloff is also shown in the video, and that ISIS threatens he will be next if the U.S. doesn't cease and desist its operations in Iraq.

HBO and Apple may be talking about an exclusive partnership. The news comes as HBO puts the finishing touches on its impending HBO Now streaming service. Reports say Time Warner, which owns HBO, is aiming to build a network of distributors. Pulling Apple TV on as a partner would be a huge win-win for both companies.

Sources say the actor came to the conclusion he was not right for the part. Seth Rogen is in discussions to play Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak. Bale marks the second high-profile actor to receive an offer from Sony for the Jobs role but eventually pass.

Glenn Beck fears that the 11 jets seized by radical Islamist groups in Libya could be used to cause extraordinary damage to the United States. Extremists could crash the planes into the oil fields in any of the oil-rich countries on which the U.S. is dependent.

Unverified photo claims to show body of ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi. Comes after three senior members of ISIS were also killed by US air strikes. Sheikh Mohammed Saleh al-Munajjid issued a religious edict forbidding the building of snowmen. He argued that to build a snowman was to create an image of a human being. The action is considered sinful under the kingdom's strict interpretation of Sunni Islam.

Robert Plant ripped up a $800 million contract with Virgin Atlantic billionaire Richard Branson, a report said. The Rock and Roll Hall of Famers were set to perform just 35 tour dates in three locations including London, Berlin and New Jersey. Branson was left stunned when the 66-year-old Plant tore the agreement to pieces.

The store will open on 34th Street in Manhattan across the street from the Empire State Building. It will function as a small warehouse, holding limited inventory for same-day deliveries only in New York. The store may also host tech showcases for items such as Kindle e-readers, Fire phones and Fire TVs.

YouTube star Josh Paler Lin gave a homeless man $100 and followed him around with a camera to see what he would do with the money. The video has already garnered more than 11 million views because of its wonderful ending. Lin found out that Thomas had quit his job to take care of his sick parents.

A picture began making the rounds on the internet this weekend that caused all basic girls to clutch their North Faces with joy. Durex has heard that people are saying we launched a ‘Pumpkin Spice’ condom. We can’t claim this one, but we do love it when people spice it up in the bedroom.

Utah man chugged a quart of eggnog in 12 seconds to win a restaurant gift card. Ryan Roche said he was also awarded with a three-day stay in the hospital. Roche: "I just opened up my throat, didn't even swallow" "Eggnog: not ideal for the lungs," Roche said.

Rep. Jason Chaffetz, a Republican from Utah, said four alleged terror suspects were captured on Sept. 10 in Texas. Chaffetz said the men flew from a Middle Eastern country to Mexico City, where they paid a smuggler to take them to and across the border. The Department of Homeland Security strongly denied Hunter’s claim that terror suspects had been caught.

A group of Marines fighting in the Now Zad District of Helmand Province in Afghanistan were ambushed by insurgents when a sniper's bullet struck one of them directly in the helmet. The soldier survived to fight again thanks to his Kevlar-reinforced helmet. 'You lucky son of a b****,' one of the Marines marvels.

North Korea's Supreme Leader, Kim Jong-un, has been out of public view for five weeks. That hasn't quelled speculation on who might grasp the reins of power if they slip -- or have slipped -- from his chubby hands. Kim Yo Jong, 27, is youngest daughter of the late departed leader Kim Jong Il and granddaughter of the founder of the country.Gen. O Kum Chol was shown in July sitting two seats away from Kim Jong-un at a volleyball game. As Vice Chief of the KPA General Staff, his portfolio includes military strategy and planning. #FoxNewsFacts has been a brilliantly British response to the Fox News statement. It looked like Fox News had got rather upset about the hashtag, and started responding from @FoxNewsPress. Except, not really. At the time of writing, the account has only made 25 tweets, and it appears it was set up in the middle of last night.

The Apple Watch could arrive in the United States by the end of March. Apple is planning on familiarizing its Apple Store employees with the wearable product. The company is holding training programs in Cupertino, California, and Austin, Texas. Apple declined to comment to CNBC Tuesday evening.

A statement attributed to the Islamic State group claimed that an American female hostage was killed in a Jordanian airstrike on Friday on the outskirts of the northern Syrian city of Raqqa. Christian Bale has pulled out of the Steve Jobs biopic. The actor "came to the conclusion he was not right for the part and decided to withdraw," according to The Hollywood Reporter. Bale becomes the second high-profile star to bail on the film in the last month.

Gill Rosenberg, the Canadian Israeli volunteer fighting with Kurdish forces, posted on Facebook on Monday night. "Guy, I'm totally safe and secure. Dan Olsen, a journeyman professional golfer, says Tiger Woods has been suspended. Olsen, who last played a PGA Tour event at the 2011 PGA Championship, says he heard it from a player. The Tour and Woods' agent vehemently deny any of the claims made by Olsen.

Macaulay Culkin was born on August 26, 1980 in New York. Culkin is best known for his roles in the 1990s Home Alone films. The Facebook page memorializing the still-living star was soon taken down, but not before hundreds of thousands of social network users were duped by its claims.

Josh Paler Lin gave a homeless man $100, then followed him in secret. The man took the money to a liquor store, then to a park to share it with others. Lin apologized and gave the man more money. The video has already racked up over 10 million views on YouTube.

Australian man had spider removed from his stomach after it burrowed its way into his body. Tiny creature borrowed through a small appendix scar and traveled up his torso. The spider survived for three days before being removed from Dylan Maxwell's stomach. "Haven't felt so violated in my life before! Just glad it's all over", he said.

ISIS militants reportedly used chlorine gas to attack Iraqi security officials in Duluiyah. 11 Iraqi police officers were rushed into the hospital emergency room in Balad. Jess Smith, 19, was just nine months old when she became one of the most familiar faces on British television in March 1997. Her decision to come out and'say hello' came after her first week at Canterbury Christ Church university.

Vox.com, the brainy news-explainer site, has announced that it fell for one of the Internet's many tricks. Putin’s unintentionally ironic speech decrying “excessive ambitions in war,” though, was very real. The white blotch falls not on Putin's dome, an obvious landing spot for a hoaxster.

U.S. officials suspect that one of the five Taliban detainees released from Guantanamo Bay in exchange for Army Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl has attempted to return to terrorism. The former prisoner, being held in Qatar, is believed to have tried to make contact with Taliban associates in Afghanistan.

Mohammed Emwazi is a Briton from a well-to-do family, the Washington Post reports. He graduated from college with a degree in computer programming, the paper says. Police declined to comment on the reports. In videos released by ISIL, the masked man appears to have carried out beheadings.

SIS has developed a new weapon in Iraq designed to strike fear among its victims. The militant group is launching bombs with live scorpions as the militants blast towns and villages. Prosecutors say 17 of the missing youths were rounded up and killed. They were marched to the site on the outskirts of Iguala, Guerrero state. Investigators found 28 bodies there, though local officials say as many as 34 were buried across six separate pits. It could be days before the identities of the dead are known for sure.

The egalitarian message was included in a select number of Lego doll house products sold 40 years ago. It has since been shared by thousands online after a picture was posted on Twitter. The note, calling for parents to look past gender stereotypes, says: “The urge to create is equally strong in all children. Boys and girls”

Kim Yo-jong was introduced to the public as a ‘senior official of the party central committee’ in March. The 27-year-old is one of the country’s most prominent women. Pentagon claims the vast majority of the U.S. supplies dropped over the weekend had reached the Kurdish fighters despite an online video showing jihadists in possession of a bundle. Tayyip Erdogan today said the mission had been a mistake. ISIS posted the extremely graphic video 'A Message to America' to social media. Gurmeet Ram Rahim is being probed by India's Central Bureau of Investigation. A former follower alleged he was manipulated into having the 'painful' operation. Anna Wintour is not happy with the rat infestation at 1 World Trade Center. The editor-in-chief has told staffers to clear her glass-walled office of the long-tailed pests. A Vogue employee says the editorial department may be postponing its move from the old Times Square offices.

Michael Zehaf-Bibeau, the slain gunman in Wednesday’s shooting at the Ottawa War Memorial and Parliament Buildings, had a criminal record in Quebec and British Columbia. Court documents obtained by CBC News show he pleaded guilty to charges including drug possession and robbery.

Apple Watch will start at $349 for the basic Sport model with a rubber strap. No one knows how much the stainless steel and 18-karat gold Edition models will cost. Apple is expected to reveal the Watch's pricing structure and release date at a media event before the end of April.

Mates Casey Dean and Eduard Nitz wish a happy 20th birthday to a Quarter Pounder they bought from McDonald's in 1995. They bought it for $1.50 each and it's now 20 years old. They're celebrating with a party at their home.

British tabloids like the Daily Mail picked up the story, going so far as to write that there would be a criminal investigation. eBay has posted a job listing for an Apple Watch software engineer. The position requires five years of experience in software design and development. The Apple Watch app is being developed by eBay's New Technology Group. It is unclear if eBay for Apple Watch will work untethered, that is without constant connection to an iPhone.

Meng Xiangyan, 29, is trying to sell her son on the streets of Qingdao, China. She wants to raise money to pay for life-saving chemotherapy for her daughter. The 29-year-old claims she and her husband love both their children. But they are willing to sell their son to a good home in order to try and save the life of his twin sister.

North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has been hospitalized after surgery on both ankles. Kim cracked bones in his ankles after neglecting an injury sustained during field supervisions in June. Australian Dylan Thomas found a spider living under his skin after returning from a trip to Bali. Thomas noticed a strange mark on his stomach while vacationing on the Indonesian island. Macaulay Culkin was the victim of a celebrity death hoax this week. A fake news story was published at a fake website this week claiming that the Home Alone actor was found dead at his apartment. This led to an “RIP Macauly Culkin” Facebook page and numerous tweets from people mourning the loss of the world’s greatest child actor.

Suresh Kumar, 40, was caught pinning the girl against a wall in Ganganagar. He was dragged to a butchers shop where he was beaten with sticks for an hour. People found with small amounts of cannabis would be issued with a court summons but would not be handcuffed or taken to a police station for fingerprinting. Low-level marijuana possession is one of the most common drug offences seen by the New York Police Department. Mayor Bill de Blasio is said to be welcoming the potential change.

Father John Micheal O’neal was declared clinically dead on January 29. Medics were able to re-start his heart with the aid of a high-tech machine. HBO is reportedly in talks with Apple to launch a cable-free streaming service. HBO Now, as it's allegedly being called, would cost $15/month and open up access to HBO's film and TV titles to distributors like Apple TV and Roku. HBO's existing streaming app HBO Go is currently available only through a cable subscription.

A resident living in the apartment complex where Brown was killed was using a video messaging app called Glide at the time of the shooting and unwittingly captured the sound of gunfire. The recording suggests nearly a dozen shots were fired in an altercation between Brown and Ferguson police officer Darren Wilson. The audio could prove to be critical piece of evidence in the ongoing investigation into Brown’s death.

A group of defectors claim that Kim Jong-un’s sister Kim Yo-jong is now in charge of the dictatorship. The claim comes amid some more serious theories that a coup may be imminent. Dylan Thomas visited the Bali International Medical Centre on his first trip to Bali. There have been reports that Islamic State militants in Mosul have contracted Ebola. Ebola symptoms are also similar to those associated with a number of other diseases, including malaria, Lassa fever and yellow fever viruses.

Staff of all Conde Nast titles were issued with a new rule: no eating at your desk. The city's health authority has now been notified. A newly surfaced audio recording allegedly captures the exact moment that unarmed teen Michael Brown was shot and killed by Ferguson police officer Darren Wilson. Luke Somers, a British-born U.S. citizen, was abducted a year ago in Sanaa where he had been working as a freelance photographer for the Yemen Times. Oliver Ilic, 22, called medics after he could not stop the bleeding. He was taken on a stretcher in bloodstained jeans to hospital in the eastern town of Kocani. Police searched his house and discovered the severed organ in a bin. Doctors realised they did not have the competence to reattach the member. Instead Ilic was transferred to the hospital in Skopje where surgeons reattach it.

Suresh Kumar, 40, was dragged into a butchers in the city of Ganganagar. He was accused of trying to rape a teenage girl down an alley. Planetary Alignment On Jan 4, 2015 Will Decrease Gravity For 5 minutes Causing Partial Weightlessness. British astronomer Patrick Moore calls this the Jovian-Plutonian Gravitational Effect. Some users are reporting that trying to reset the settings on their iPhone could delete all of their documents saved in iCloud. Apple informs you as you reset your phone settings that "no data or media will be deleted," but people are claiming that the reset wipes their iCloud Drive documents. An asteroid about 60 feet in diameter missed hitting Earth Sunday by about 25,000 miles. It did not, contrary to some reports, break off a little piece that landed with a bang in Nicaragua. NASA officials, though, are skeptical that the reported explosion and crater was caused by a space object.

Meng Xiangyan, 29, said that she and husband loved both of their children. The woman belonged to an all-female closed order in Macerata, Italy. She was rushed to nearby Bartolomeo Eustachio di San Severino hospital after complaining of severe abdominal pain. The South American, who arrived in Italy in June, surprised her fellow nuns when she gave birth to a baby boy.

Report claims that from January 1st 2015, McDonald's will stop serving overweight customers. The claims in the report are false. McDonald's is not about to implement such a policy. ISIS terrorists have released a video purportedly showing the beheading of American freelance photojournalist James Wright Foley. Foley, a 40-year-old New Hampshire native, was kidnapped at gunpoint from an Internet café in Syria. ISIS has threatened that Steven Sotloff will also be executed depending "on Obama’s next decision" regarding U.S. military strikes against ISIS in Iraq.

Lebanese army says it has detained the second wife of the Islamic State (Isis) leader, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, and their eight-year-old son near the Syrian border. The arrest reportedly took place in the past week and followed information provided by western intelligence agencies. The woman was identified as Saja al-Dulaimi, an Iraqi.

India's Central Public Works Department sacked a senior electrical engineer. The employee stopped turning up for work in 1990, and an inquiry was launched in 1992. The department then seems to have forgotten about it for 13 years. In 2014, a German civil servant admitted he hadn't done any work in the last 14 years.

Militants release a video purporting to show the beheading of American journalist James Wright Foley. Foley has been missing since he was kidnapped in northwest Syria on November 22, 2012. In the video, the man identified as Foley delivers what appears to be a prepared statement. The video has not yet been independently verified.

Islamic State (Isis) militants in Mosul may have contracted Ebola, according to Iraqi media reports of suspected cases. The government and Kurdish media reported that militants were displaying symptoms similar to those of Ebola. The World Health Organization has not been able to confirm this but has offered assistance to Iraqi officials.

A group of ISIS militants in Iraq have allegedly gone to a local hospital to be treated for what is believed to be Ebola. Three local media outlets reported this week that a number of ISIS fighters have shown signs of the deadly disease and were taken to a hospital in Mosul. The reports are currently unconfirmed, but the World Health Organization says that they are investigating.

Mohammed Emwazi is a Briton from a middle-class family who grew up in London. He was made famous in a video showing the death of American captive James Foley. In each beheading video, he is dressed entirely in black, a balaclava covering all but his eyes and the ridge of his nose.

Amazon is reportedly planning to open its first brick-and-mortar store in New York. The store would be located in midtown Manhattan. It would be a same-day product pickup location and customer service hub. This isn't the first time Amazon has thought about moving off of the internet.

There's a chance a Batmobile was stolen from the set of Batman v Superman set in Detroit. The scuttlebutt from sources in Detroit is that one of the Batmobile models being used in the filming of Batman Vs. Superman has gone missing, believed stolen. So far we have no clue or confirmation, but if this is true, we should quickly form a list of suspects.

NEW: The FBI obtained the audio and interviewed the man who made the recording, a lawyer says. NEW: A quick series of shots can be heard, followed by a pause and then another succession of shots. The sounds could be a piece in the larger puzzle of what happened during the shooting. Police have said Brown was trying to grab the officer's gun when he was fatally shot.

Christian Bale will play Steve Jobs in an upcoming film about the Apple co-founder. Aaron Sorkin wrote the screenplay, and he's jazzed to have Bale on board. Danny Boyle is set to direct, meaning we have an Academy Award-winning screenwriter, director, and actor.

The author, known only as Lena, wrote that she found out she was pregnant in 2012 and describes the father as ‘the donator’ Describing the pregnancy as a ‘diagnosis’ she said that she was ready to have a child. But when she went for an ultrasound on the baby and it turned out to be a boy, she reacted with the man-hating bile that the rest of her blog seems to follow.

The $2.5 million Bugatti Veyron was vandalized with penis graffiti in Seattle. A photo of the car was uploaded to Instagram by AndreysMyGov of VG Productions. The video featuring the vandalized Bugatti hasn’t been released yet but here’s a look at their previous prank video.

A US website is carrying a report that the world’s richest street artist Banksy has been identified and arrested. It is, of course, completely fake, and the quotes used in the National Report piece were originally ‘issued’ via a press release hosted by a satirical website in 2013.

Syrian Observatory for Human Rights says IS is using Iraqi officers to train fighters. Witnesses say the planes are being flown around a military airport in Aleppo. Meanwhile, Iraqi forces have launched an attack on IS militants near Tikrit. Kurdish forces, backed by US-led air strikes, are continuing to fight militants in Kobane.

Forensic experts have revealed the video was probably staged, with the murder happening off camera. No blood can be seen, even though the knife is drawn across the neck area at least six times. The sounds allegedly made by Foley do not appear consistent with what may be expected. British security services MI5 and MI6 reportedly identified a British hip-hop artist as the key suspect in the hunt for the killer.Bary, who went to Syria last year to fight in its bloody civil war, has a build, skin tone and ­accent all similar to those of “John,” according to The Telegraph. Also under investigation are Abu Hussain Al-Britani, 20, a computer hacker from Birmingham, and Abu Abdullah al- Britani, in his 20s, from Portsmouth. Bary was an aspiring rapper whose music was played on BBC Radio 1.

EBay is seeking an iOS Engineer/Architect who can work on “elegant solutions for the Apple Watch that will complement our core iOS eBay app. The listing was first published on eBay’s job page in November, but it has been getting more attention thanks to its appearance on LinkedIn this month.

Nigeria has reached a ceasefire deal that will include the release of kidnapped Nigerian schoolgirls. The deal is expected to come into effect within days. The Nigerian army has been fighting Boko Haram militants in Nigeria since April. The conflict has claimed the lives of more than 20,000.

Survivors of an Iraqi army regiment in Saqlawiya, near Fallujah, say the radical group used the gas against the besieged soldiers. There were conflicting government statements about whether the gas had been used. The siege on the regiment, which consists of nearly 400 soldiers, has created an uproar in Iraq.

The Amanita muscaria was found growing wild in the extensive palace gardens during preparations for a television show. The mushroom's hallucinogenic properties have long been known and it has commonly been used in rituals. Palace officials said Friday there are several hundred species of mushrooms growing in the palace gardens.

Vet used a mini-scalpel to remove blockages near the anus and dorsal fin. The fish, a member of the carp family, survived the 50-minute operation before going home. The man originally declined the operation when told it would cost £300, but quickly changed his mind.

The US Vogue offices are moving to 1 World Trade Center in New York City. A Vogue employee told Gawker that the new offices are infested with rats. And the problem is apparently so bad that the editor-in-chief is reportedly refusing to enter the premises. Wintour, 65, has allegedly informed her staffers that the vermin must be removed before she clicks her dainty heels into their new home.

Residents of Nicaragua's capital Managua heard a loud boom Saturday night. The explosion was caused by a small meteorite, government officials confirmed on Sunday. The meteorite landed near a city airport and did not cause any injuries. The Nicaraguan government has asked for help from international experts to further analyze the event.

Yasir Abdulla, a security guard from Keighley, went to Iraq to fight against ISIS. The 36-year-old bought a set of combat fatigues online for £100 before going to Kurdistan and buying an assault rifle. He then joined hundreds of other Kurdish and Peshmerga forces who are trying to stop the spread of ISIS by patrolling a ten-mile front line. He returned to the UK last week but told The Sun how an elderly Kurdish woman, whose son was captured by ISIS and taken to Mosul, was then fed his body.Last year was the deadliest in Iraq since its 2006-2007 sectarian bloodshed, with a total of 12,282 people killed and 23,126 wounded. Yasir Abdulla also says that ISIS fighters terrorise locals by calling them on the phone and threatening to bury them alive unless they surrender to them.

Doctor in besieged Syrian town reports arrival of patients with blisters, burning eyes and breathing difficulties after explosion. Dr Walat Omar said he could not identify their cause, but suspected a chemical weapon. Islamic State is thought to have obtained stocks of ageing but still potent chemical weapons when it seized Iraqi army bases where they were stored.“Some fighters were further away, they complained about their eyes watering and burning, and pain in their nose,” he said. The three most seriously injured patients, who ranged in age from 17 to over 40, stayed in the clinic overnight for observation. One Kurdish activist said Kobani may have been hit by teargas for the first time.

The 62-acre island, in Lake Mälaren, Sweden, was the former home of the 14-time major winner and his ex-wife, Elin Nordegren. It boasts six tee-off areas for a custom-made golf hole, a secluded villa, a hunting lodge and its very own landing strip for propeller planes.

Meteorite landed in Managua, Nicaragua, just before midnight on Saturday. It left a crater 12 metres (40ft) wide and five metres (16ft) deep. Officials said they "thanked God" there were no injuries as the rock landed. It is believed to have been a small part of the asteroid 2014 RC.

The website, which has the appearance of a news site, is reporting a the town of Purdon has been sealed off by the CDC and local police. Local Emergency Management officials, the Corsicana/Navarro County Health Department and Navarro County Sheriff Elmer Tanner all report there is no truth to the claim on the website.

ISIS killed over 300 soldiers using chlorine gas for the first time in Saqlawiyah, north of Fallujah. MP Ali al-Badri said, at a press conference at the parliament building in the presence of a number of deputies of Diwaniyah province.

A time capsule believed to date as far back as 1652 has been extracted from a Massachusetts State House cornerstone. The capsule is thought to hold coins, newspapers, the seal of the Commonwealth, cards and the title page of the Massachusetts Colony Records. It's now being held in a safe at the Boston Museum of Fine Arts.

A story that began circulating on Tuesday afternoon created a bit of a frenzy, but the fact is, there’s no sign KFC will really be selling marijuana in its stores. The story began at the Racket Report, where it was announced that marijuana profits were hitting such high levels that the fast food restaurant chain had decided to get in on the game. While the idea may appeal to pot lovers who think they can get the munchies in a single stop, there are a few problems with the story.

Banksy, the elusive graffiti artist, political activist, film director, painter and long time fugitive, was arrested early this morning by London’s Metropolitan Police. After hours of questioning and a raid of his London art studio, his true name and identity have finally been revealed. The City of London Police say Banksy”s real name is Paul Horner, a 35-year old male born in Liverpool, England.The counterfeit money thing has either been planted or its part if his art and not actual real counterfeit cash. As soon as news of the arrest was made, the City of London Police say they began receiving dozens of phone calls from people either claiming to be Banksy. As of 6 PM London time, hundreds of people were gathered outside the London Police Department chanting “I’m Banksy!” and holding signs demanding his release.

Mike Seidel appeared on camera Saturday night with his back turned, leading some to speculate the reporter may have been relieving himself. Brian Williams took a moment on Monday’s “NBC Nightly News’ to push back on a social media dustup over a Saturday night liveshot that didn’t quite happen.

Kayla Mueller, 26, was killed by a missile strike during a bombing raid by Jordanian planes on the Syrian city of Raqqa early on Friday. Jordan announced that it sent tens of fighter jets to hit Isis targets in Syria on Thursday, including what they claimed were ammunition depots and training camps. Jordanian officials seemed to cast doubt on the reports of Mueller’s death.Mueller graduated from Northern Arizona University in 2009. She had long made helping others a priority, according to the Mueller family spokesperson. In a story in her hometown paper, the Prescott Daily Courrier, Mueller said she felt drawn to help after learning more about the situation in Syria.

According to a news source from Taiwan, the mass production stage of the Apple Watch will not begin until January. In addition to the delay in start of mass production, the G for Games blog also reported that the Watch will instead be assembled by only one supplier. The Apple Watch was unveiled by Apple on Sept. 9, in the same event where the company unveiled the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus.

Cesar Millan should have died, according to a post on the site noticiasunam.com. But there are many obvious oddities in the post - Viral Inspector shows why it probably is fake. Millan's team have not directly denied the information we dare say he most certainly not dead.

U.S. special operations forces targeted Godane in southern Somalia in a Sept. 1 attack. It took several days to confirm initial reports that he died in the attack. Al-Shabaab, an offshoot of al-Qaeda, was declared a terrorist organization in 2008.

Bernard the bear performs to passers by outside The Loft café in Shefford. An enforcement officer has now visited the café's owners, warning that Bernard has been causing a public nuisance. A shop employee told Bedfordshire on Sunday ‘it seems really silly that someone would moan about a bear when we’re on the high street'

The remains of at least 28 people were found in unmarked graves, an official says. A tip from suspects led authorities to the grave sites, the attorney general says. 43 students and a soccer team were ambushed in Iguala, Mexico, on September 26. Three students were killed, and 22 police officers have been detained.

Weather Channel meteorologist Mike Seidel was relieving himself when Lester Holt threw to him during his coverage of the storms in North Carolina. What else could he have been doing? It sure looks like he was taking a break from his job. It's a good thing he was wearing a towel.

Doctors removed a matchhead-sized insect from under Dylan Thomas’s skin. It had been there for three days and burrowed up to his chest, leaving a trail of red blisters. The 21-year-old was on his first trip to Bali. The results of the tests on the creature should come back next week.

Joe Riquelme, an app developer from New York, surprised his parents with a special gift on Christmas Day: he paid off their mortgage. In a video he uploaded to YouTube, Joe is sitting at home with his parents and their dog, when he presents them with an envelope. When his parents realise what Joe has done, they are moved to tears.

Report: Apple is looking to Samsung to supply RAM, NAND flash storage, and batteries for future iPhone 6 production. If Apple and Samsung strike a deal, Samsung will supply both DRAM and NANDflash to the iPhone 6. The same Korean industry sources also claim Samsung will Supply Apple with application processors for the Apple Watch.

The White House said the intelligence community was trying to determine the video’s authenticity. The video entitled “Message to #America (from the #IslamicState)” purporting to show “James Wright Foley” on his knees ahead of his execution by a man whose identity is disguised and who speaks with a distinct British accent.

Reports of suspected Ebola cases appeared in Iraqi media in the past week. The World Health Organization said it and the Iraqi health ministry had conducted a full investigation. "All sources contacted have negated the existence of any suspected cases of Ebola," the WHO said. The laboratory facilities in Mosul "do not have the necessary capabilities to diagnose and confirm the Ebola virus"

The rapper was a founding member or Sugarhill Gang, which produced the first mainstream rap hit Rapper's Delight in 1979. Wonder Mike and Master Gee released a statement, communicating their condolences: 'So sad to hear of our brother's passing. Rest in peace Big Bank'

Stan Beaton, 68, of Mirfield, was left devastated in December when an upgrade of his phone line by Virgin Media wiped the precious greeting he had kept for 14 years. The retired forklift truck driver took comfort in the voice of wife Ruby, who died of stomach cancer aged 63 in May, 2003.

Mohammed Emwazi was born in Kuwait and grew up in West London. He studied computer science at the University of Westminster. He became radicalised after graduating and was known to authorities. He is believed to have travelled to Syria in 2012, where he became responsible for guarding prisoners.

Seth Rogen will play Steve Wozniak in the upcoming Steve Jobs biopic. Rogen is famous for comedic roles in hits like "Superbad" and "Knocked Up" The film will be directed by Danny Boyle and written by Oscar winner Aaron Sorkin.

A Shar Pei was found abandoned at a railway station in Ayr, Scotland. The dog was microchipped, so the charity was able to find the dog’s name, Kai. His previous owners said they sold him on the classified ads website, Gumtree, in 2013.

South Korea newspaper claims Kim fractured both ankles in June. Kim has not been seen in public since 3 September, when he attended a concert with his wife. Outside commentators have guessed that Kim has gout, which runs in the family, or has been drinking and eating too much.

Seth Rogen is in early talks to play the Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak. Christian Bale is in line to play Jobs himself, the famed technology guru. Oscar-winning writer of Facebook movie The Social Network, Aaron Sorkin, is writing the screenplay for Britain's Danny Boyle to direct.

Rumors that Fidel Castro has died are circulating on Twitter. Cuban media outlets have denied any news conference is scheduled. The hype also comes "suspiciously close" to the actual death of Fidel Castro Odinga, the 41-year-old son of a Kenya opposition leader.

NEW: Iraq's Interior Ministry says the woman is not Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi's wife. NEW: The woman's name doesn't match either of the names it has for his two wives, it says. The woman is believed to be the sister of a man sentenced to death for a series of bombings. Her apparent attempt to cross into Lebanon with a child raises questions."We got little out of her, and when we sent her back, Zarqawi killed her," an official says. The identity of the child with al-Dulaimi is still the subject of conflicting reports. The full picture of who exactly Lebanese authorities have in their custody is still to be revealed.

The properties are part of the Pacific Shores Center office park in Redwood City, California. The company signed office-lease agreements for a total commitment of about $1 billion through 2028. The Silicon Valley Business Journal reported this month that Google was close to completing a deal at the site.

Conal O'Rourke claims that he got fired for complaining about Comcast's service. He says he was fired because he complained about the company's customer service. The company has denied the claims, saying he was let go because he was unhappy with his service. O' Rourke says he is suing the company for wrongful termination.

Father John Micheal O’neal was rushed to the hospital on January 29 after a major heart attack, but was declared clinically dead soon after his arrival. Doctors at Massachusetts General Hospital managed to unblock vital arteries and return his heart to a normal rhythm. He woke up less than 48 minutes later and seems to have perfectly recovered. The elderly man claims that he has clear and vivid memories of what happened to him while he was dead.

The recording, allegedly made near the shooting scene, seems to indicate the officer who shot Brown paused briefly in the middle of shooting at least 10 times. CNN aired the tape but cautioned that it could not independently verify whether it was authentic. It was reportedly recorded by a Ferguson resident who could be heard talking with or about a woman while gunfire suddenly erupted in the background.

ISIS militants claim to have captured a supply bundle dropped by U.S. forces. Video posted to a YouTube channel associated with ISIS shows them rifling through packages containing dozens of grenades. The supply package was apparently one of many intended for Kurdish fighters who have been battling ISIS militants for control of the strategically important town for weeks.

WARNING: GRAPHIC IMAGES. James Wright Foley, 40, has been missing since Nov. 22, 2012. Foley appears to be forced to read an anti-American statement before he is beheaded in the gruesome five-minute clip. A masked militant claims the murder is in retaliation for American airstrikes against the Islamic State militants in Iraq.

Rep. Duncan Hunter (R-CA) told Greta Van Susteren tonight that ten ISIS fighters have crossed the border from Mexico into America. In September Rep. Jason Chaffetz also said four known terrorists were apprehended at the the US border in Texas and were still being held.

Report: New MacBook Air will have fewer ports and a slimmer keyboard. Designers are channeling the old 12-inch PowerBook by pushing the keys all the way to the edge. The trackpad will no longer click in order to make the body thinner. It almost sounds like some sort of feature liquidation.

Father John Micheal O’neal was rushed to the hospital on January 29 after a major heart attack. He was declared clinically dead soon after his arrival. Doctors at Massachusetts General Hospital managed to unblock vital arteries and return his heart to a normal rhythm. He woke up less than 48 minutes later and seems to have perfectly recovered.

Research Medical Center is waiting for test results after concern that a patient might have a contagious disease. The hospital does not believe the patient has Ebola, and says the patient is being treated for another illness. The health department says it should know the patient’s diagnosis by Monday.

Islamic State, in video titled "A Message to America," beheads American journalist James Wright Foley. Foley was kidnapped in 2012 from his home in Foley, Louisiana. Islamic State beheaded Foley in a video posted on YouTube on September 14. The Islamic State video was posted on September 13.

A man scaled a White House fence and breached the mansion's front door. He apparently rushed past a Secret Service agent inside and was stopped only after reaching the building's East Room. New details of the incident involving Omar Gonzalez were first reported Monday by The Washington Post. Secret Service spokesman Ed Donovan, citing an ongoing investigation, declined to comment.

Lucita Sandoval, 26, was apparently unaware the unnamed student was using a camera phone to document the incident. He later promised he’d deleted the 23 minute video but had actually sent it around on the app, with it soon making its way on to a porn site in Argentina. Sandoval had previously faced disciplinary hearings at her school in the city of Santiago del Estero.

Christian Bale will star as Apple CEO Steve Jobs in the upcoming biopic. Screenwriter Aaron Sorkin confirmed the decision in an upcoming interview. He says Bale didn't even have to audition for the role. The still-unnamed film is based on Walter Isaacson's 2011 biography about Jobs.

YouTube prankster Josh Paler Lin decided to give a man named Thomas the money and follow him to see how he spends it. His first stop was a local liquor store but instead of buying alcohol he purchased food that he gave away to others in need. Thomas explained that he recently quit his job and was caring for his ailing stepfather who died of cancer.

A patient in Frisco, Texas, walked into an urgent care facility on Wednesday exhibiting signs and symptoms of Ebola. He told health-care workers he had had contact with "patient zero" in Dallas, local officials said in a statement. The Texas Department of State Health Services refuted that claim to CNN, saying "no indication" the man had contact.

Alleged attacker Suresh Kumar, 40, molested a teenager in a street. Her screams for help alerted a crowd which came to her aid. Kumar was dragged into a butcher's shop and beaten heavily with sticks. Vigilantes then hacked at his genitals with a meat cleaver.

A 10-year-old member of the ISIS terror group has been reportedly killed while fighting in the Middle East. Going by the name Abu Obadya al-Abassi, ISIS posted a video on YouTube announcing his death. The YouTube video has garnered over 75,000 hits as of Friday morning and depicts photos of the boy.

Apple is reportedly limiting what Apple Watch apps are capable of doing, ruling out certain features in order to ensure battery life is not too heavily drained in the initial model. Developers working on applications for the new Apple wearable have cautioned that consumers should temper their expectations of what the initial Apple Watch is capable of. The primary issue is battery life, and Apple’s continued attempts to increase the time between recharges.

McDonald’s has just announced that it will be phasing out 8 menu items the beginning of next year. This means the end of the Big Mac, apple pie and large size menu items. One notable “ingredient” – preservatives – might also be eliminated from the menu altogether.

Nigerian military and intelligence officials raised doubts on Sunday about the validity of a ceasefire with Boko Haram. Reports of fresh attacks and fighting in the country's northeast. Chief of defence staff and a senior presidential aide announced on Friday that agreement had been reached to end hostilities and secure the possible release of more than 200 kidnapped schoolgirls.

Dino Ferrari hooked the huge wels catfish, which was 2.67m in length. Wels catfish can grow as long as 13ft and weigh up to 62st. Mr Ferrari's fish might set a new record for the biggest ever caught on a line.

Taylor Lianne Chandler, 41, claims to be Michael Phelp's girlfriend. Admitted on Facebook that her birth name was David Roy Fitch. Was born with both male genitalia and a uterus but no ovaries or testicles. She underwent corrective surgery in her early twenties to remove her penis. Also described her love affair with the swimmer – saying the pair met through dating app Tinder.

A Canadian soldier was shot at the Canadian war memorial in Ottawa. A shooter was seen running towards the nearby parliament buildings. The buildings were put in lockdown as police and tactical teams converged on the area. The shooting comes two days after an Islamic convert ran down two Canadian soldiers, killing one, near Montreal.

A story circulating via social media reports that more than 250,000 holiday turkeys on a Texas farm may be infected with the deadly Ebola virus. The report features a photograph depicting dead turkeys in a farm shed. No such incident has occurred in Texas or anywhere else in the US. The story comes from a dubious 'news' site called Daily Buzz Live.

British Intelligence officials have zeroed in on a suspect in the on-camera ISIS murder of American journalist Jim Foley, and he is widely believed to be a slim, light-skinned rapper from London. Reports say Abdel-Majed Abdel Bary — also known as “Lyricist Jinn” or “L Jinny” — is the main suspect.

Three outlets reported that Ebola showed up at a hospital in Mosul. The reports, however, have perpetuated mostly in pro-government and Kurdish media. “We have no official notification from [the Iraqi government] that it is Ebola,” WHO’s director of communications told Mashable.

Some iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus owners are getting strands of hair caught between the screen and the aluminum frame of the iPhone. The seam on my iPhone 6 where the aluminum meets the glass is definitely catching my hair and pulling it out. #seamgate— Paul Peavler (@CardMeHD) September 28, 2014

Mohammed Islam, the alleged teenaged prodigy, said he had no idea where that dollar figure came from. Instead the figure is believed to be a few million dollars, but Mr. Islam declined to be more specific. "The attention is not what we expected – we never wanted the hype," he said.

Vogue's new offices at 1 World Trade Center have a rat infestation. The rodents are actively shitting on staffers' desks and other belongings. Editor-in-chief Anna Wintour is wary of entering her personal office. Are you a Vogue staffer affected by the current rat crisis? Send us an email.

The Weather Channel’s Mike Seidel has taken a lot of ribbing about what he was doing live on network TV this weekend. To an awful lot of people who saw Holt dump out of the live shot, it appeared Seidel was zipping up his pants. But that is not what happened at all, said a Weather Channel spokesperson. Seidel, she said, was using his cell phone as an IFB (that is short for interruptible feedback)

The North Korean leader already has a restaurant in Holland and is hoping to branch out and build diplomatic ties with European cities. North Korea watchers believe Scotland may be the next prime location, largely thanks to the popularity of whisky among the communist ruling elite. The chain has begun springing up across China and Asia, with proceeds funnelled back to North Korea.

Amazon is reportedly planning to launch an ad-supported media streaming service. The service would exist in addition to its $99 Prime membership subscription. The Wall Street Journal reported similar plans in March, pegging the service as being free. At the time, Amazon denied that it had plans to offer a free streaming-media service.

A water leak led to the discovery of a time capsule at the Massachusetts State House. It was buried by Paul Revere and Samuel Adams in 1795. The contents are of concern, but the plaster that held the box in place is in good condition. The capsule's contents are expected to be revealed sometime next week.

A hoax video of a pigeon pooping on Vladimir Putin went viral on Monday. Putin was giving a speech on the dangers of military aggression. The video is fake, but if it had been real, the symbolism would have been spot on. Russia announced on Monday that it will hold military exercises on its border with Ukraine.

Stan Beaton had kept a voicemail from his late wife for 14 years when an upgrade to his phone line caused the recording to be deleted. The clip was recorded by Ruby to serve as the message people would hear when they called Beaton's phone. Virgin Media is sending Beaton a CD of the recording and the retired forklift truck driver plans on thanking whoever delivers it in style.

Father John Micheal O'neal claims that God is a warm and comforting motherly figure, whom he met in the heaven. The 71-year-old Catholic priest from Massachussetts was officially dead for more than 48 minutes. Doctors at Massachusetts General Hospital managed to unblock vital arteries and return his heart to a normal rhythm.

NASA: Lack of eyewitness accounts suggests something else was likely behind the event. The impact near the international airport did not cause any known injuries. It did leave a crater measuring 12 metres across and was felt throughout the capital. People who live near the crater said they heard a blast they took for an explosion.

Claim: A vacationing man discovered that increasing pain he was experiencing was due to a tropical spider's living under his skin. Claim: A tropical spider had burrowed itself into the scar from Dylan's recent appendix removal. No documented cases of spiders living and burrowing under human skin, or any information suggesting that such an occurrence is possible."Bunbury Local Discovered a Spider Had Burrowed Under His Skin on Bali Holiday." NT News. Orr, Aleisha. "Spider Burrowing Into Appendix Scar, Crawled Through WA Man's Body." The Age. Woodcock, Mitchell. "Bunburbury Man's Bali horror." South Western Times.

Ting Su found her 30-year-old partner naked in a parked car with her own twin. Realising they had been caught, the pair hopped out of the vehicle completely starkers. Ting Su jumped in and drove off, leaving her sister and unfaithful hubby embarrassed and without dignity.

The photo is an obvious fake, but Durex is sitting on a potential goldmine if they could make your penis smell like Starbucks in October. So far, they’re playing it cool, neither confirming nor denying the existence of a pumpkin-flavored love glove. A spokeswoman for Virgo Health said she couldn't say whether the company was or was not actually developing such a thing.

New MacBook Air is slimmer than its 11-inch and 13-inch predecessors. Has a single USB port, no SD card slot and no fan. Release date and pricing for the new model are yet to be announced. Reports claim Apple is preparing for the Apple Watch to go on sale in March.

Sheikh Mohammed Saleh al-Munajjid issued a religious ruling forbidding the building of snowmen. He argued that to build a snowman was to create an image of a human being, an action considered sinful under the kingdom's strict interpretation of Sunni Islam. That provoked swift responses from Twitter users writing in Arabic.

Survey finds 10 percent of respondents are "very likely" to buy a smartwatch in the next year. Based on projections of Apple's iPhone sales and the current installed base of iPhones compatible with the Apple Watch, the analysts predict Apple will sell 24 million Apple Watches within the first nine months.

German distribution sources claim resellers will be shut out at launch. Stores will have glass viewing cases for the expensive models. Vaults will supposedly be added to Apple Stores to keep the pricey gold Apple Watches secure. Apple most likely wants to keep selling experience on its terms until people are more familiar with what an Apple Watch is.

Small meteorite left a crater in a wooded area near Managua’s airport. Residents reported hearing a loud boom on Saturday night. crater had a radius of 39 feet and was 16 feet deep. Asteroid had been forecast to pass by on Saturday.

Luke Somers, 33, had been held hostage since being kidnapped in September 2013. There were conflicting reports about the outcome of the operation on Saturday. Some said an unnamed American hostage had been rescued while others said Mr Somers was dead. His captors had taunted his family after a previous attempt by American and Yemeni forces to free him, saying they would execute him within three days.

Israeli authorities opened a number of dams near the border, flooding the Gaza Valley. Gaza has experienced flooding in recent days amid a major storm. The storm displaced dozens and caused hardship for tens of thousands. In Dec. 2013, Israeli authorities also opened the dams amid heavy flooding in the Gaza Strip.

A gunman fired multiple shots at the National War Memorial in Ottawa on Wednesday. The gunman then ran towards Parliament Hill, which is located across the street. The incident comes just a day after police killed a Muslim convert in Quebec after he had hit two soldiers with his car. The top spokesman for Prime Minister Stephen Harper said Harper was safe and had left Parliament Hill.

Alan Titchmarsh found Amanita muscaria during filming for The Queen's Garden at Buckingham Palace. The red and white spotted toadstool can cause vivid hallucinations and is known for the unpredictability of its effects. The fungus, also known as fly agaric, contains the psychoactive chemicals ibotenic acid and muscimol and can be found throughout the UK.

An intrepid Seinfeld fan noticed that everyone’s favorite show about nothing seemed to be running slightly faster. To check, he compared the airing of a recent episode to a digital recording of the same episode from ten years ago on the same hardware. He found that the show was running 7.5% faster, which amounts to freeing up two minutes of ad time.

Star Wars: The Force Awakens could be released this summer, according to unconfirmed reports from Ikwiz and Movie Pilot. The film has a current release date of December 18 2015. Abrams is reported to have made the comments at the 2015 Visual Effects Society Awards on February 4.

Axl Rose is not dead, despite internet reports to the contrary. The Axl Rose death hoax started on a bogus site forged to look like a page on the MSNBC website. Gossip Cop, which specializes in debunking rumors about celebrities — dead or alive — was among the first to expose the fakery.

Christian Bale has withdrawn from the role of Steve Jobs in a forthcoming biopic. Bale decided he "was not right for the part after much deliberation and conflicting feelings" The as-yet-untitled biopic has been written by The Social Network writer Aaron Sorkin and will be directed by Danny Boyle.

Retina MacBook Air rumour article brings together everything we know or can plausibly predict about Apple's next MacBook Air laptop. We report on (and analyse for credibility) all the rumours about every aspect of the new MacBook Air with Retina display. We'll update this article whenever we hear of new information, clues and rumours about thenext MacBook Air.New 12in MacBook Air will have one USB port on each side of the laptop. USB Type-C connector is significantly smaller than 3.4x MagSafe's 8.6mm port. New MacBook Air is also said to feature a keyboard that stretches to the edge of the chassis.New MacBook Air rumours suggest it will have a 12in screen. The new MacBook Air is also said to be even thinner than the existing MacBook Air. This is based on the theory that it will use Intel's new Intel Core M processor, a chip that doesn't need fans. It could also offer USB Type C support, which is smaller than USB 3.Canalys analyst Daniel Matte believes Apple will add a Retina display to the MacBook Air. He expects that we will see a 11.88-inch model with a resolution of 2,732x1,536 pixels. Apple may use the IGZO display technology for the new display, offering improved power efficiency.New MacBook Air may not use Intel Core M processor. New U Broadwell chip is said to consume 30 percent less power than Haswell. New MacBook Air could mark some sort of crossover between the iPad and the MacBook, perhaps an iPad Pro. Apple may ditch Intel processor in favour of its own home-made A-series.The new MacBook Air may use the U Broadwell processor, which may not ship until 2015. Shipment of Skylake – the successor to Broadwell which will offer even more power than that chip - is also delayed. If Apple launches a 12in MacBook Air, will it discontinue the existing models? We think that a MacBook Air that offered a dual boot system for iOS 7 and Mac OS X would be very interesting.

Erdogan argued that the Turkish weapons drop has harmed the fight against ISIS. He said that the drop of weapons has made it more difficult to fight the terror group. A goldfish owner in Norfolk, England, took his constipated fish to the veterinarian. The procedure was completed at Toll Barn Veterinary Centre by Faye Bethell. Goldfish can live between 10 and 25 years in captivity, with some reported to thrive well into their 30s.

Rachel Martin speaks with Carol Leonnig of The Washington Post, who found that the recent fence jumper at the White House, Omar Gonzalez, got much further into the building than previously reported. Rachel Martin: What do you think? Share your thoughts in the comments below.

The New York Police Department will no longer arrest people for low-level marijuana possession, according to people with knowledge of the city’s drug strategy. ESPN will feature a discussion on domestic violence on Monday night. The panel will include 11 men, all between the ages of 39 and 74. There will be no women on the panel. Corporal Nathan Cirillo, 24, was shot in the chest by a masked gunman. The photo has apparently gone viral in China. A worker downloads (and deletes and downloads, etc.) an app to boost its rank on the App Store. One worker can operate as up to 100 unique users. Getting into the top 10 free apps costs RMB 70,000 (US$11,200)

Yasir Abdulla was fighting on the front line with Kurdish forces in Iraq. Homeless man who spent $100 donation on food for beggar friends gets makeover and hotel stay in new video released amid claims it is a hoax. Short film posted by'serial prankster' Josh Paler Lin shows Thomas, a man living on the streets of California, being taken to a sushi restaurant. After night's sleep, filmmaker takes him to a hairdressers for a haircut and then to a mall where he buys a new suit. The videos are part of a campaign to raise more than $120,000, via an Indiegogo page for Thomas to get his life back on track. But now, viewers have questioned its authenticity, citing a number of apparent flawsYouTube personality Josh Paler Lin filmed homeless man, Thomas, buying food. He then secretly followed him to a nearby Liquor Mart, where he bought alcohol. Lin then filmed Thomas handing out the food to homeless people in a park. But one YouTube user questioned the choice of a liquor store, saying: 'It seems like an odd coincidence' He also claimed Lin is a well-known prankster, having previously staged a Halloween-themed video with him that was'set up' to gain traffic. But Lin strongly denied staging any of his films or having met Thomas before the $100 exchange.Paler Lin - who earns money based on how many users view his videos, most of which are 'pranks' - not only scooped $52,000 from the film, but also gained 13,000 new subscribers. In the footage, Thomas told Paler Lin he had quit his job to look after his parents, but after both of them died, he couldn't afford to pay for their condo.

Israel denies responsibility for releasing storm waters flooding parts of Gaza. A site called iKwiz is reporting that director J.J. Abrams, has asked Disney for the release date of Star Wars: Episode VII to be moved up from it’s original release date. Apple has asked its suppliers in Asia to make a combined five to six million units of its three Apple Watch models during the first quarter. eBay may be developing an app for the Apple Watch which ties to its existing iPhone and iPad software. Rep. Duncan Hunter of California says at least 10 ISIS fighters were captured trying to cross the Mexico border into Texas. Durex denies rumors of a ‘pumpkin spice’ flavored condom. One user tweeted, "Because safe sex is important, no matter what season it is" The photo appears to be an altered image of Durex's flavored "Taste Me" condoms.

Reports that Comcast will deny Internet service to users of the Tor Internet browser are false, the company says. Comcast's Jason Livingood: "Our customers can use Tor at any time, as I have myself"

Nun, originally from South America, was rushed to hospital in agony. She claimed to have 'no idea' she was pregnant when she was taken to hospital. The baby was born healthy but remains in hospital to undergo more checks. The nun's convent has expressed an interest in taking care of the child.

'Serial prankster' Josh Paler Lin filmed giving $100 to homeless man. But the man, named only as Thomas, spent the money on food for his friends. However, the YouTube user claimed the start of Lin's recent homeless video - which sees the director hand Thomas $100, before secretly following him with a camera - immediately suggests it may be a hoax.
