Tan Shen, 26, accidentally on-purpose spent a full week at a 24/7 KFC in Chengdu, calling in sick to work, to mourn the loss of her relationship. "I just wanted some chicken wings,” Tan told Yahoo. “Once I got in there and started eating I decided I needed time to think”

Research firm Strategy Analytics predicts that Apple Inc. will sell more than 15 million Apple Watches worldwide in 2015. Strategy Analytics forecasts that global smartwatch shipments will increase by more than 500 percent from the 4.6 million units shipped in 2014. Apple CEO Tim Cook recently revealed that development of the wearable is right on track.

The Batmobile was spotted cruising the set of Batman vs Superman: Dawn of Justice last week. Reports began to surface online that the iconic vehicle had gone missing, presumed pinched from the Warner Brother's set. But according to the Detroit Free Press, there had been no such crime. Detroit police spokesman Sgt. Michael Woody said the force had spoken with the producers to confirm all was well.

Rumors have hit social media that the Batmobile has been stolen from the Batman V. Superman: Dawn of Justice set in Detroit. The local Michigan media seems to be taking the reports seriously enough that the police department has been contacted to look into it. Most sites seem to be pointing to Bleeding Cool as the source of the rumors.

British and US intelligence have identified British rapper Abdel-Majed Abdel Bary as a prime suspect in James Foley's murder. British and U.S. intelligence has identified a British rapper as aprime suspect in the murder of James Foley. The rapper is believed to have been killed in a car bomb attack in May.

Dylan Thomas' stomach selfie has gone viral around the globe. Doctors at Bali International Medical Center apparently figured out his "mystery condition" was caused by a spider living under his skin for three days. Some arachnid experts have expressed skepticism over the story, saying it is unlikely to be true.

A Banksy illustration of broken pencils has been shared over 130,000 times on social media. The illustration is actually by Lucille Clerc, a London-based illustrator. A spokesperson from Banksy's camp said "We can confirm this is not by Banksy"

#hairgate has people chattering about an unintended problem with the iPhone 6. According to a forum post, the phone traps hair in the seam between the glass and aluminum. A variety of men and women tested the new iPhone by taking calls, rubbing the device on their beards, “combing” their curls with it.

HBO is in talks with Apple to make Apple TV one of the launch partners for its highly anticipated streaming service. HBO and streaming partner Major League Baseball Advanced Media are working to have the standalone service ready to launch in April. The retail price is expected to be $15 a month when purchased directly from HBO.U.S. pay TV providers lost 125,000 subscribers in 2014, according to Leichtman Research Group. HBO and Cinemax its highest number of new subscribers -- 2.8 million -- in 30 years. Among the challenges HBO faces to get HBO Now launched is how to avoid confusion with HBO Go.

Joe Riquelme, an entrepreneur who created the iPhone app Videoshop, paid off his parents’ mortgage for the ultimate holiday gift. Joe caught the moment he gave his parents the gift on video and the clip shows his parents cuddled around him on the couch as he gives them an envelope containing the special note.

A website is reporting that the Batmobile, from the upcoming Batman v. Superman flick, has gone missing in Detroit. If this is true I could only imagine seeing it driving down 696 in rush hour. How would the cops catch it with all the Bat devices that come standard? Is the Batcave set in the GPS? If so you would be safe from the cops, I presume.

Witnesses reported gunfire inside the halls of Parliament, including a dozen shots outside the Parliament Hill library. Police and ambulance are on the scene, and Parliament Hill is in lockdown. According to a witness, the shooter had black hair, was wearing a grey jacket and a scarf.

Nigeria has agreed a truce with militant Islamist group Boko Haram. They look set to the release schoolgirls it abducted earlier this year. Boko Haram had demanded the release of detained extremists in exchange for the girls, but Nigeria president Goodluck Jonathan would not swap prisoners. This truce marks the end of a five-year conflict between the Nigerian government and the Islamist insurgents.

The fish-lover had taken the sick, three-inch pet for a consultation at North Walsham’s Toll Barn Veterinary Centre. At first he had baulked at the price quoted for the treatment and went away. But he had returned five minutes later and asked for it to go ahead. Goldfish can be bought for less than £3 each, can live up to 10 years.Miss Bethell spent Boxing Day operating to remove a corn on the cob which had got trapped in a dog’s intestines. She also recently helped wildlife rescue groups save an injured sparrow hawk by pinning a broken wing, so that it could recover and be released. “It’'s been an absolutely brilliant year with lovely clients and lovely animals,” she said.

Apple Watch will take approximately two hours to fully charge and deliver all-day battery life with normal on-and-off usage, according to a new report. The report also claims that the Apple Watch will only deliver notifications while worn on the wrist. Apple continues to tweak Digital Crown on Apple Watch, giving the button a "weightier, higher-end feel"

Rats spotted under - and on top of desks at Vogue's new NYC offices. Condé Nast have just moved into a new home at 1 WTC. Anna Wintour allegedly told staff: "I don’t want to hear about it" But another Vogue source denies that there's a rodent presence in the offices.

The SPCA says the dog was found Jan. 2 tied to a railing at the Ayr railway station. Officials said the male shar-pei crossbreed, who is 2 or 3 years old, had a microchip. In the country, abandoning an animal violates the Animal Health and Welfare Act of 2006.

Macaulay Culkin has once again died — at least, according to a death hoax spreading online. The troubled actor, who at one point was reportedly entrenched in heroin addiction that friends feared he had only months to live, is once again the subject of a hoax claiming that he was found dead in his Manhattan apartment. News that Culkin had allegedly died spread quickly on Facebook and Twitter.

A picture of a letter to parents from a box of Lego in the 1970s is going viral after being uploaded to Reddit. The image was uploaded by Reddit user fryd_ on Saturday morning. He spoke to BuzzFeed News about it: "I came across the pamphlet whilst playing Lego with my niece & nephew at their Grandma's house"

Father John Micheal O'Neal, 71, was rushed to the hospital in late January after being hit with a major heart attack. He was brought back to life via some sort of newfangled mechanical gadgetry. A spokesman for Archbishop Sean P. O'Malley says the story is a hoax.

Tan Shen, 26, said that she was walking around depressed after being dropped by her lover. She went into a branch of the fast food outlet in a train station in Chengdu, China. Staff eventually realised after three days that she had not left the store. She told them that she just needed time to think while ordering another box of chicken wings and extra large fries.

Michael Zehaf-Bibeau, 32, fatally shot Corporal Nathan Cirillo, a 24-year-old father, as he stood guard at the War Memorial on Wednesday morning. He then ran inside the Parliament, where he opened fire before he was shot dead by the House of Commons Sergeant-at-Arms. He was born in Quebec as Michael Joseph Hall and was arrested five times while living in Montreal. He served one day in prison in 2004 for marijuana possession and 60 days for PCP possession.Sgt. At Arms Kevin Vickers reportedly killed the shooter this morning in the Canadian parliament. A parliamentary guard was shot in the leg during the gunfight but is recovering in hospital. Prime Minister Stephen Harper is safe after being evacuated from Parliament Hill. He had been scheduled to give Pakistani activist Malala Yousafzai, co-winner of this year's Nobel Peace Prize, her Canadian citizenship.At least 10 Royal Canadian Mounted Police squad cars converged on Parliament Hill's Centre Block as people were rushed out of the city's Post Office. The RMP advised people in downtown Ottawa to stay away from windows and off roofs as they responded to the incident. White House spokesman Josh Earnest said the nation's thoughts and prayers are with Canada. The caucuses for the Conservative and Liberal and NDP were holding their meetings when the incident happened.

Macaulay Culkin's representatives confirmed that the 34-year-old actor is alive. The flurry of RIPs on social media sites were due to an online death hoax cooked up about the child star of the Home Alone film series. Earlier this year, a similar death hoax surfaced, but it was also dismissed by Culkins' representatives.

Henry Jackson, aka Big Bank Hank of the pioneering rap group Sugarhill Gang, has died of cancer. Jackson, 57, was best known for this verse in the iconic song, “Rapper’s Delight.” Released in 1979, the track became hip-hop's first crossover hit and paved the way for rap to enter the mainstream.

The actor turned musician was also reported dead back in April, with Facebook users mourning his alleged death and even a memorial page popping up. Mila Kunis' longtime boyfriend is doing perfectly fine for himself, despite pranksters with no consciences attempting to spread such nasty rumors.

Oliver Ilic, 22, was told that he was no good in bed so he allegedly mutilated himself then threw the remains away. The man told doctors he believes his small penis was to blame for the split. Police searched his house and found the severed organ in a dustbin after it had been sliced off using a razor blade.

Mum took to the streets with a placard offering to sell her son to the highest bidder. He was standing alongside his 29-year-old mum, Meng Xiangyan, as she appealed for someone to come forward and buy the boy. His sister is suffering from acute leukemia and, though the mum said she and husband loved both of their children, their daughter would most certainly die.

Mohammed Islam, 17, was profiled by the New Yorker, which claimed he made $72 million from the market. Islam told CNBC that the figure is not accurate, although he declined to be more specific other than saying it’s closer to a few million dollars. The New Yorker claimed that it got the figure from rumors.

Law enforcement analyst Tom Fuentes and former Los Angeles police officer David Klinger questioned the authenticity of an audio clip. The clip is purported to have captured the gunshots that killed 18-year-old Michael Brown in Ferguson, Missouri, earlier this month. A man's voice can be heard in the audio telling a woman, "You are pretty. You're so fine, just going over some of your videos"

One of the five Taliban members swapped by the Obama administration in exchange for Army Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl has reportedly tried to return to terrorist activity. Military officials declined to specify which of the former detainees has allegedly been making overtures toward other militants near Qatar. Sen. Kelly Ayotte, New Hampshire Republican, said she was disturbed by the news, which only served to highlight “the danger of the administration’s irresponsible decision”

Joe Riquelme, creator of the popular iPhone video editing app Videoshop, surprised his parents on Christmas by revealing that he had paid off their mortgage. The entrepreneur, who goes by "Joey Trombone," took to YouTube on Thursday to share the touching footage of his parents reacting to his gift.

Incident took place at Pulkovo Airport, in St Petersburg, Russia. The man stripped off in a nonchalant manner before strolling through the metal detector watch by bemused airport workers. The cheeky man even jokingly hesitate by the workers as if to check they don't want to search him further.

Michael Zehaf-Bibeau, a Canadian citizen from Quebec, was born in 1982. The alleged shooter had a criminal history for drug trafficking in Montreal and robbery in Vancouver. He was designated as a “high-risk traveler,” and the government had seized his passport.

Brokaw's ire was prompted by Williams' admission that a story he has often repeated about being in a helicopter was untrue. Williams had repeatedly claimed that he had been traveling on a U.S. military helicopter that was downed by RPG fire during the 2003 invasion of Iraq, most recently on a Jan. 30 broadcast.

Comcast customer representatives have branded Tor "illegal" and told customers that using it is against the company's policies. Tor is a type of web browser that, in theory, makes all your internet activity private. The software routes traffic through a series of other connected internet users, making it difficult for governments and private companies to monitor your internet usage.

Astronomers question whether a crater near Managua, Nicaragua, was caused by a meteorite. The crater, measuring roughly 40 feet across, was reported earlier this week. NASA officials say the lack of eyewitness accounts raises doubts about that scenario. Nicaraguan officials have asked the U.S. to help sort the whole thing out.

Meng Xiangyan, 29, took to the streets to auction off her son to the highest bidder. They need money to pay for cancer treatment to save the life of his twin sister. The little girl has acute leukemia and the parents were told that she would die without urgent medical treatment.

Seth Rogen will play Steve Wozniak in Sony’s upcoming biopic on Steve Jobs. The film is written by Aaron Sorkin and directed by Danny Boyle. Other actors haven’t been announced for the Steve Jobs film, but Scott Rudin Mark Gordon and Guymon Casady are producers.

Evander Kane and the Winnipeg Jets appear to be hitting a wall in their relationship. Kane, 23, has been the subject of trade rumors for the past few seasons. With three-years left on his contract, Kane is an extremely valuable asset. The Montreal Canadiens and Philadelphia Flyers have expressed significant interest in Kane.

Dylan Thomas first noticed the mark on his stomach during his trip to Bali. He visited a doctor Sunday when he noticed the wound growing and producing a burning sensation. The doctor told Thomas he had been bitten by an insect and gave him antihistamines. Thomas said the wound continued to worsen Monday and he went to a hospital.

ISIS beheads James Wright Foley, an American freelance journalist who was captured in Syria in 2012. The video says the killing is a warning to the U.S. to end its intervention in Iraq. Steven Sotloff, a freelance journalist working for Time, is also shown in the video.

A Lego pamphlet from 1974 was unearthed and posted on Reddit this weekend. The pamphlet's authenticity was questioned after it went viral over the weekend. Lego spokesman Roar Rude Trangbæk confirmed to Quartz that the document is real, and was included with a series of Lego dollhouses.

Banksy appears to have shared a message of sorrow and hope after an attack on the Paris office of the satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo left 12 people dead. The drawing was shared from an Instagram account and Facebook page that many believe are associated with the street artist. There is debate about the authenticity of the image.

Cowen analyst Timothy Arcuri says Apple Watch will have 512 megabytes of RAM. He also expects a "mainstream version" with 4 gigabytes of internal storage. The Apple Watch was announced earlier this month. It will include a heart-rate monitor, fitness tracking, support for Apple Pay and Siri.

Two Australian buddies, Casey Dean and Eduard Nitz, were only 14 and 13 at the time they purchased the Quarter Pounder with Cheese for their friend. Dean states that he is pretty sure that this burger is the oldest burger in the world. While folk’s might store wine to age for 20 years, ground beef is not something you would eat after being left out a few hours, never mind decades.

Nigeria's army announced a ceasefire with the militants on 17 October. But the group's leader, Abubakar Shekau, said the ceasefire was a lie. He said the girls had converted to Islam and been married off. Boko Haram sparked global outrage in April by abducting 219 schoolgirls.

President Obama says the world is “appalled’ by the beheading of an American journalist by militants in Syria. “The United States of America will continue to do what we must do to protect our people,” Mr. Obama said. The president called ISIS a “cancer” in the region.

Vice President Osama Nujaifi condemned the "heinous crime which perpetrated by terrorist Daash" Three hundred soldiers were trapped in the regions of Saqlawiyah and Alsger of Anbar province. Terrorist, Daash used Chlorine gas in the area of Saqulawiyah, after surrounding more than 400 soldiers.

Dim Xiong Chien planned to propose to his girlfriend, Cong Yen, by setting off fireworks as he got down on one knee. The plan bombed, though, when the fireworks set the grass ablaze at the Liaoning Advertisement Vocational College in the city of Shenyang.

An explosion was reported near Managua, Nicaragua, on Saturday night. The explosion produced a crater that was over 12 metres (39 feet) wide and about 1.5 metres (5 feet) deep. A 20-metre wide asteroid named 2014 RC passed by Earth on Sunday, flying underneath the planet. Some saw a potential connection between these two events, leading some to suggest that the two events are related. However, experts who have been examining the evidence, including those at NASA, say they are completely unrelated.Meteorite hunter Geoff Nodkin tweeted his thoughts about the possibility of this being authentic. He said that if it was meteorite-related, he would expect there to be a very bright fireball, sonic booms during the object's dark flight and then the impact. One very real possibility is that it was a landmine explosion.

Apple’s 18-karat gold Apple Watch Edition may sell for as much as $4,999. The device will not just be gold-plated, but actually manufactured using 18- Karat gold. For the record, John Gruber thinks the stainless steel/sapphire Apple Watch will set customers back $999.

Turkey expressed dismay that the weapons intended for the Kurds ended up with ISIS. The weapons were intended for Kurds but were instead given to ISIS. Turkey has been fighting ISIS in Iraq and Syria for more than a year. The U.S. has also been sending weapons to ISIS in the region.

The Sunday Times reports that MI5 and MI6 have identified the British member of the Islamic State jihadist organization. The newspaper attributed the information to "senior government sources" It did not name the killer, saying that its sources "gave no details of the man they have identified"

A young man gives his parents an envelope for Christmas. Inside that envelope is a note telling them that he has paid off their mortgage. Things then get teary very quickly. Here’s a photo of what was in the envelope, along with some nice reaction shots.

Dylan Thomas says he was on holiday in Bali last weekend when he awoke to find a mysterious red trail on his chest. He says doctors initially thought it was an insect bite but later discovered a spider inside his stomach. Thomas's story has not been verified by the Guardian.

Internal state document obtained by South Korea’s KBS TV station. It contains an ‘administrative order’ from then leader Kim Jong-il. The order was issued in January 2011, shortly after Kim Jong un had been anointed as his father's successor. The authenticity of the official directive could not be independently verified.

The tape was allegedly made by a man video chatting in a building near where Brown was fatally shot August 9. CNN says it has not independently verified the tape's authenticity. The man's attorney, Lopa Blumenthal, said the FBI had already interviewed both her and her client. "I personally heard at least eleven," Blumenthal said.

U.S. Central Command says it is not aware of Islamic State flying jets in Syria. Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said it was the first time the militant group had taken to the air. The group has regularly used weaponry captured from the Syrian and Iraqi armies. U.S-led forces are bombing Islamic State bases in Syria and Iraq.

Jihadists are being trained by Saddam Hussein’s former pilots to fly three fighter jets. The planes are capable of flying although it is unclear if they are equipped with missiles. The jets were seized from Syrian military airports now under IS control in the northern provinces of Aleppo and Raqqa.

Ahmed Abdi Godane was killed in a U.S. military strike, an al Shabab source told NBC News. The Pentagon confirmed the death later in the day. The source said that 11 militants were killed in the strike on Monday. The siege last September at the Westgate Mall in Nairobi left 67 people dead.

YouTube prankster Josh Paler Lin set out to capture a simple social experiment on video. Lin decided that he’d give a homeless man named Thomas $100 and then secretly follow him around. The video, released on Monday, shows Thomas as he takes a stack of bills and walks right into a liquor store.

The burial pits were found Saturday on a hill in a community outside Iguala, Southern Mexico, the town where the students were last seen. Witnesses claimed that they had last been seen being led away by police. Twenty-two police officers were arrested in Guerrero today, accused of killing two students during the clashes last week.Thousands of students and teachers blocked the highway between Chilpancingo and Acapulco for hours on Thursday. The missing students are from a teacher training college known as a hotbed of protests. Governor Angel Aguirre appealed for calm in his state, mired in poverty, gang violence and social unrest.

Mark Oberholtzer has owned and operated his Mark-1 Plumbing company in Texas City for over three decades. He confirmed that his pickup truck had indeed found its way to the front lines of Syria’s civil war and been converted into an anti-aircraft vehicle. The photo surfaced on Monday after the Ansar al-Deen Front of ISIS militants posted it to Twitter.

The World Health Organisation is investigating reports that ISIS militants have been showing up at an Iraqi hospital with Ebola. According to three media outlets an undisclosed number of militants displaying signs of the disease attended a hospital in the ISIS-held city of Mosul. Mosul has been under control of ISIS since June 2014 and over the past few weeks militants have reportedly executed more than a dozen doctors.

Anna Wintour's Vogue offices in New York City are full of rodents. "The girls that work there see the droppings everywhere. It's nasty," an insider says. Another issue is the location, next to the former World Trade Center towers. "You're always reminded of 9/11," another source says.

A meteorite left a 12-meter crater in Nicaragua's capital Managua on Sunday night. The space rock might be a fragment of a larger space object that passed near Earth. NASA said it’s possible that a meteorite caused the crater, but the American space agency is skeptical.

Jess Smith, 19, revealed that she was the laughing sun baby that watched over Tinky-Winky, Dipsy, Laa Laa and Po in Teletubbyland. She was paid £250 and a box of toys for her role in the British TV series. The BBC will make 60 new episodes of the television show.

The story was written on the website NationalReport.net. Snopes.com created an entry debunking the story after it was shared 79,000 times in nine hours. The story claimed the town of Purdon was quarantined after a family of five tested positive for the virus.

Meng Xiangyan faced a real-life Sophie's Choice when poverty forced her to decide between her twins. The distraught 29-year-old said that she and her husband loved both of their children. But with certain death awaiting their daughter unless they could get medical treatment, they were prepared to sell their son. Pictures published in local media show her standing on Weihai Road in Qingdao.

One of the five Taliban members released from Guantanamo Bay in exchange for Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl is believed to have returned to militant activity in Qatar. The White House was already facing renewed criticism for the deal made this summer. Many experts criticized the plan, saying it set a precedent to negotiate and exchange prisoners with terrorist groups.

Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau laughed away government reports that he had died or that his group had begun peace talks. Nigeria's government had claimed that the group, which controls much of northeastern Nigeria, had agreed to a truce. “We will not negotiate with anyone,” Mr. Shek Kau said.

Parliament’s sergeant-at-arms, Kevin Vickers, shot one gunman dead. Veteran Affairs Minister Julian Fantino told QMI Agency that Vickers killed one gunman. Bernard Trottier, a Toronto-area MP, tweeted that the gunman inside Centre Block “has been shot and killed”

ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi has reportedly been killed by a U.S. airstrike. The ISIS leader was killed during an air strike in the city of Mosul. A Pentagon spokesperson did not confirm the death, but thousands of social media users have passed around an unverified photo claiming to be the ISIS leader’s body.

Big Bank Hank was a member of the early hip-hop group the Sugarhill Gang. The group were responsible for one of the most popular rap songs of all time, Rapper’s Delight. The musician died Tuesday at a hospital in Englewood, New Jersey.

Dylan Thomas, 21, was on vacation in Bali, Indonesia, when his body was invaded. He awoke one morning to find a mysterious red trail stretching up his abdomen. A match-head-sized tropical spider had burrowed into Thomas’ skin through his scar.

Stan Beaton lost his wife a decade ago, so he cherished the voicemail greeting she had recorded at their home in northern England. Then, without warning, it disappeared; deleted by his phone service provider, Virgin Media. When Virgin heard about his story, they set a team of 10 employees to the task of bringing the audio back.

The dog, a shar-pei crossbreed, was found tied to a railing at Ayr Station. Next to the dog was a suitcase containing a pillow, toy, food bowl and food. The dog was microchipped, so the SPCA found out his name is "Kai" Anyone found guilty of abandoning an animal can be banned from keeping any animals.

King Abdullah of Jordan is reportedly planning to fly a bomber in retaliation for the death of an ISIS pilot. The king was in Washington when news of Muadh al-Kasasbeh’s demise broke. He reportedly told a House committee that Jordan would pursue the jihadis until it ran “out of fuel and bullets”

ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi probably isn't dead, but no one who's in a position to know for sure is saying anything. Rumors of his death exploded over the weekend along with a photograph purporting to show his body. The photo was debunked as a fake by several sources and appeared to have been a doctored version of an image of an Albanian militant.

Rumours that the iPhone 6 Plus could bend people's hair surfaced last month. Apple said the claims were "extremely rare" Mashable conducted its own experiment to conclude that "hairgate is a bust" Many are, in fact, referring to #hairgate as the new #bendgate.

The Amanita muscaria mushroom, commonly known as fly agaric or fly mushroom, is a white and red toadstool, with hallucinogenic properties. The species contains poison which, in rare cases, can cause death if consumed. The fungi is also important to the growth and development of many types of tree, and provides food for flies.

North Koreans are prohibited from sharing the name of their leader, South Korean media reported. The ban on anyone being named Kim Jong Un would probably affect thousands in the reclusive nation. The surname Kim is one of the most common in both Korean states and the given name Jong Un is also popular.

Luke Somers had been held hostage since September 2013 in Yemen's capital Sana'a having moved to the country two years earlier. His sister Lucy said she learned of her 33-year-old brother's death from FBI agents at 5am this morning. 'We ask that all of Luke's family members be allowed to mourn in peace,' she said from London. Last week the U.S. said it had attempted a rescue operation to free a number of hostages, including Mr Somers.American commandos tried to rescue Mr Somers in a raid on an AQAP camp late last month, but he had been moved by the time they arrived. Mr Somers was kidnapped in September 2013 as he left a supermarket in the Yemeni capital, Sana'a. The U.S. considers Yemen's al-Qaida branch to be the world's most dangerous arm of the group.

Pope Francis said 'all of God's creatures' have a shot of ending up in heaven when they die. New York dog owners and animal lovers everywhere rejoiced at the good news. The Pope’s stance was also hailed by animal-rights activists. The puppy pardon is the latest move in his apparent campaign to make the Catholic church more inclusive.

The wels catfish, which was set free, could be one of the largest ever caught. It was found in the Po Delta, which is known for having the perfect living conditions for giant wels to flourish. The fish are not fussy eaters and have reportedly been known to feed on ducks, rats and even pigeons.

Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh, 47, said the castrations would bring the men closer to God. The painful procedures were carried out at a hospital owned by Singh. The men were castrated around the year 2000 but the cases are only now coming to light. Singh is accused of grievous bodily harm by India's Central Bureau of Investigation.

A video has emerged with claims that it shows a large, hairy figure walking swiftly through a snowy, wooded area in Russia. Key details about the incident are missing. The researchers claimed they captured that video footage -- seen above -- of the hairy Yeti. They also made a plaster cast of a large footprint found in the snow.

Syrian activists and ISIS supports both allegedly reported seeing, photographing and posting images on social media of a predator drone reportedly seen hovering over Raqqa, Syria.Reports the ABC story; Syrian activists andISIS supports both reportedly reported seeing and photographing a Predator drone hovering over Syria.

The Islamic State released a video of its jihadists beheading American journalist James Wright Foley in Syria. The video is almost five minutes long and includes threats against President Barack Obama and the United States. Foley was an independent journalist in the Middle East. He was one of four journalists kidnapped by Qaddafi’s forces in Libya in 2011.

A soldier was reportedly shot at Canada's National War Memorial while a second person, believed to be a fatally wounded gunman, was given medical attention beside the Library of Parliament. The area is on lockdown as police search for possibly two other gunmen following the Wednesday morning shooting. The suspect is described as standing 5-foot-10-inches, overweight with a dark jacket and white scarf over his face.

CCTV, China's state-run broadcaster, wants to solve this problem. In an article published by its English-language channel, the network laid out a series of guidelines for how not to name yourself. For example, avoid naming yourself after a food item ("Candy"), a famous person ("Obama") or a very old person ("Gertrude")

A meteorite left a crater in a wooded area near Managua's airport. The crater has a radius of 12 metres and is 5 metres deep. Local residents reported hearing a loud boom on Saturday night, but said they did not see anything strange in the sky.

Michael Zehaf-Bibeau was fatally wounded by Sergeant-at-Arms Kevin Vickers. Mr. Vickers then walked to a nearby room where the Conservative caucus was meeting, and told MPs the shooter was dead. Prime Minister Stephen Harper was rushed to safety.

Bosnia has a widely publicised problem with underage pregnancies. A recent unverified report highlights the full extent of the problem. Last year in Sarajevo 31 underage girls became pregnant. One schoolgirl wrote: "I would have sex with my boyfriend, even though I'm only 14"

Several Iraqi media sources stated Wednesday that some of the Islamic State militants in Mosul have contracted Ebola. Three Iraqi media outlets reported that two cases of Ebola have been'recorded' in Mosul, which is considered to be the jihadist group's stronghold. Two cases have been recorded in Mosul.

Saalbach-Hinterglemm in the state of Salzburg has saved up tons of snow from last year which they have now put back on the slopes. Resort management collected around 13,000-square-metres of snow earlier in the year and then stored it by covering it with an artificial fleece.

The Batmobile, or at least one of the Batmobiles used for filming Superman v. Batman: Paths of Glory, has been stolen. The movie is being filmed in Detroit, which hasn't been going through the best times of late. There's no official confirmation yet, but hey, maybe somebody needed it to drive out of town to get some fucking water.

A gold-plated Apple Watch Edition model is rumored to sell for up to $5,000. The standard Apple Watch and Apple Watch Sport retailing for $500 and $350, respectively. All versions are rumored to arrive on Feb. 14. If these rumors hold up, Apple will at least have the title of "most expensive wearable" secured.

A 46-year old man, Suresh Kumar was seen pinning a teenager to the wall in Ganganagar in Rajasthan. The next moment, he saw his penis chopped off and thrown on the road. He was dragged and taken to a local butcher shop where he was beaten with sticks for more than an hour.

Secret government document has been leaked revealing the "administrative order" It is believed anyone with the same name would be forced to have official documents, identity cards and even school certificates altered. Officials have said that the names of each North Korean leader in the past - Kim Il-sung and Kim Jong-il - have been banned.

A video allegedly showing the beheading of American photojournalist James Wright Foley, who has been missing in Syria for 636 days, was released today. The video has sparked a discussion online on whether such material should be permissible on the world wide web on the grounds that it allows the ISIS to share its "propaganda"

Tim Cook said that he wears his Apple Watch “even in the shower.” This is in contrast with what we had previously heard, courtesy of tech journalist David Pogue. Cook also spoke about his efforts to improve working conditions in China. He said that Apple is trying to ensure that there is no abuse of employees on the supply chain.

NEW: Nigeria's defense ministry says it is "studying" the latest video. In a video released Saturday, Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau denies a deal with the government. He says the more than 200 schoolgirls abducted in April have converted to Islam. He also denies knowing the negotiator with whom the government claimed it worked out a deal.

Shane Smith, the co-founder and chief executive of Vice Media, has taken his place among the high-rollers in Las Vegas. He spent $300,000 of his winnings on a meal for more than 30 employees and business partners. The lavish meal at Bellagio’s Prime Steakhouse took place during the Consumer Electronics Show. It included bottles of wine costing $15,000 each.

The FBI is investigating the recording. The man who recorded it seems to be, er, “enjoying” a video chat while it happened. If it’s authentic, it tells us how many shots were fired. A forensic examiner who listened to the tape told CNN he heard “at least 10,” six shots followed by a pause followed by four more.There’s virtually no delay between the first and second shots fired, certainly not long enough for words to be exchanged between Brown and Johnson. Unless the audio here picks up after the first shot was fired, i.e. unless it begins with what's actually the second shot fired at Brown, I don’t know how to square Johnson's account with this. That seems more likely than Wilson squeezing off a bunch of rounds while still inside his car.

Mohammed Emwazi is believed to be a Kuwaiti-born British man from west London. He is known to British security services, who chose not to disclose his name for operational reasons. Jihadi John has appeared in videos showing the killings of U.S. journalists James Foley and Steven Sotloff.

People found with small amounts of marijuana would be issued court summonses. The change would remake the way the police in New York City handle the most common drug offenses. It would represent Mayor Bill de Blasio's most significant effort to address the enduring effects of the department's excessive stop-and-frisk practices. The new policy could push prosecutors out of the process.In 2013, people failed to pay or show up to court about a quarter of the time for the 329,198 summons cases on the dockets of the city’s lowest level criminal courts. More than half of those arrested for marijuana were released a couple of hours after being brought to a station house, according to 2012 data.

Georgy Myakinkin, 31, works at the airport in the city of St Petersburg in north-western Russia. He said he had finished his shift and was going home when he remembered he had left his keys at work. Three Marines are seen moving through a building in search of a source of gunfire. As they near a doorway in single file, a bullet bounces off the middle soldier's helmet. The three men quickly retreat to the back of the building to inspect the damage. The footage was uploaded to YouTube last month, and has since received just under 200,000 views.

CEO Tim Cook supposedly said that the Apple Watch is resistant enough to use in the shower. This would perhaps allay the worries of some over the device's "water resistant" only properties. The one place that Tim Cook doesn't take his Apple Watch to is apparently his bed.

The New York Times was the biggest of several outlets relating an apparently apocryphal tale about pets. There is no evidence that Francis repeated the words during his public audience on Nov. 26. The urban legend became unstoppable a week later when it was translated into English and picked up by the British press.The story had so much going for it: Francis took his papal name from St. Francis of Assisi, the patron saint of environmentalism. Report: Stainless steel version will start at $500, gold at between $4,000 and $5,000. The report comes from sources at Apple via French website iGen.fr. Sources also claim that Apple is hoping to release the watch as soon as possible. Other rumors claim we may have to wait until Spring of 2015.

The bodies found in a mass grave were confirmed not to be the missing students. The bodies were found in an unmarked mass grave in a rural area. The students were believed to have been killed in a car crash on the way home from a school trip to a nearby village.

It's now unofficially Fall, which means you'll see the word "pumpkin" trotted out even more often. Brands like Starbucks do not seem to have heeded the “enough with the pumpkin stuff!” warning. Durex and its PR AOR Virgo Health refused to give Quartz a definitive answer on the most absurd trend to emerge from Twitter this weekend.

Mohammed Islam, 17, is a Stuyvesant High School student known around campus for spending his lunch breaks flipping stocks. Islam is the son of Bengali immigrants. He and a few other hobbyist traders and poker players appear to have created a cool nerd gang for the ages.

Luke Somers was held by al-Qaeda militants following his abduction in September last year. His sister says he was killed during a failed rescue attempt early Saturday. There was no immediate comment from U.S. officials, who rarely discuss their drone campaign in Yemen. In a YouTube video released Wednesday, Somers says is certain his "life is in danger"

ISIL beheaded British aid worker David Haines as shown on released video. ISIL behead British aid workers David Hainses as seen on releasedVideo. ISIS beheaded David Haininges asshown on released Video. ISIS video shows David Hainedes being beheaded.

Tiger Woods' Swedish luxury island is now up for grabs. The 62-acre haven features a villa, hunting lodge, private ferry boat, horse stables and landing strip for propeller planes. The island was previously home to Woods and his then-wife, Swedish native Elin Nordegren.

Amateur filmmaker Josh Lin filmed a homeless man asking for money. The man bought food, walked to a neighborhood park and gave it to others in need. The video has been viewed more than 11.4 million times on YouTube since it was posted on Monday. Lin says he was so moved by the man's generosity that he put him up in a hotel.

A time capsule has been removed from the cornerstone of the Massachusetts State House. The capsule is believed to have been stashed there by then-Governor Samuel Adams and patriot Paul Revere. The full catalog of its contents are as-yet unknown. The Secretary of State's office is looking into whether the box will be reinstated.

A neighbor tells 8 News NOW former baseball star Jose Canseco was hurt in an accidental shooting Tuesday afternoon. Metro Police confirm there was a shooting at the address, but would not confirm the former player was hurt. Caneco was a hitting star in the 80s, making a name for himself on the Oakland A's.

Three hundred Iraqi soldiers died in a chlorine gas attack carried out by ISIS. ISIS's use of chlorine gas in attacks isn't new. Violence conducted by ISIS militants has claimed more than 1,400 lives in Iraq. 1.2 million Iraqis, including Turkmens, Arabs, Christians and Ezidis, have fled their homes.

The New York Post is reporting that the World Health Organization is looking into whether ISIS fighters in Iraq have Ebola. A WHO spokesperson told them they’ve had “no official notification” from the Iraq government about the cases. A spokesperson for the Iraqi health ministry called the reports “incorrect” and “unfounded”

Suresh Kumar, 40, was caught trying to rape a girl in Ganganagar city of India. He was severely beaten by lynch mobs who heard the girl's scream for help. After he was mercilessly beaten, Suresh was dragged to a butcher's shop and a meat cleaver was used to chop of his manhood.

Twitter is abuzz with rumours that Cuba's former communist leader Fidel Castro has died, although the timing is suspiciously close to the death of another high-profile person who shares his name. There has been no official confirmation and his death has been mistakenly claimed on social media many times in the past. Also casting doubt on today's rumours is the possibility it has been confused with the recent death of the son of Nairobi's opposition leader.

Islamist militias in Libya took control of nearly a dozen commercial jetliners last month. Western intelligence agencies recently issued a warning that the jets could be used in terrorist attacks across North Africa. Intelligence reports of the stolen jetliners were distributed within the U.S. government over the past two weeks.

Juan Pedro Ramos died from anaphylaxis after eating some recently developed tomatoes containing fish genes. The young man’s health rapidly deteriorated after he suffered an unexplained allergic reaction. The medical staff was unable to identify the cause of his allergic reaction in time and none of the usual treatments or drugs seemed to work.

A text written by an anonymous person on an anonymous blog has outraged thousands worldwide. It's all about the signature "Lana" story about why she is a feminist chose to abort her child when she found out it was a boy. The text was published on January 17, but began to pick up on social media until around February 9th.

Mark Oberholtzer traded in his truck to a Texas dealership that then placed it up for auction in 2013. The original tweet, below, was posted to an account associated with the Jabhat Ansar al-Din militant group based in Syria. It is unclear how the car ended up thousands of miles away in the Aleppo province of Syria.

Rep. Duncan Hunter, a Republican from California, made the comments on "On the Record with Greta Van Susteren" The Department of Homeland Security said Hunter's comments were "categorically false" Hunter's spokesperson said the congressman was "conveying what he knows—and what he was told"

Christian Bale is in talks to play the leading role in the upcoming Steve Jobs biopic. Leonardo DiCaprio was originally in talks, but withdrew from negotiations earlier this month. The film, which has yet to receive a release date, will focus on three separate 30-minute scenes depicting Apple's product launches.

Comes with body of a deadly cobra inside the bottle were delivered at the supreme leader's palace in North Korea. Locals believe snake wine helps men get their partners pregnant and improve the size of their manhood. The 31-year-old despot and his wife Ri Jol-su are said to be having problems adding to their family because of his weight.

After Stan Beaton's wife, Ruby, passed away in 2003, he saved the "leave a message after the beep" recording. The recording was lost after Virgin Mobile conducted some technical work. With the help of BBC Radio Leeds, the company was able to retrieve the deleted message for Stan.

A newspaper report that Kim Jong-un has been hospitalized for ankle surgery has fuelled new theories about the North Korean leader’s long absence from the public eye. Kim has not been seen in public in almost a month and missed a session of parliament on Sept. 25 for the first time since coming to power almost three years ago. Since an event with key officials in July, he has been seen walking with a limp.

The artist posted a poignant image in the wake of the shooting that killed 12 at the offices of the French satirical magazine in Paris yesterday. The following image was posted via this Instagram yesterday, which has since been shared by over 100,000 people. A spokesperson for Banksy told The Independent: "We can confirm this is not by Banksy."

Three Iraqi news outlets reported that Ebola showed up at a hospital in Mosul, a city 250 miles north of Baghdad which has been under ISIS control since June 2014. A Kurdish official, who was convinced the cases are Ebola, told the Kurdish media outlet Xendan that the militants’ symptoms were similar to those of the Ebola virus. World Health Organization officials have yet to confirm the reports.

Twitter abuzz with rumours that Cuba’s former communist leader Fidel Castro has died. There has been no official confirmation and his death has been mistakenly claimed on social media many times in the past. The timing is suspiciously close to the death of another high-profile person who shares his name.

Vogue staffers are still seeing rodents at Condé Nast’s new 1 WTC digs, which are still under construction. A source told us editors spotted at least one critter this week under a desk. Anna Wintour replied, “I don’t want to hear about it,” according to our source.

North Korean authorities issued a directive in 2011 to reject birth certificates of newborns named Kim Jong Un. The directive was obtained by a North Korean defector who reached South Korea in 2008. Both Kim's father and grandfather instituted the same vanity project, insisting on being the first and last holders of their names.

Report claims iOS 8's "Reset All Settings" feature also deletes data stored in iCloud Drive. The issue presents itself when iPhone and iPad users attempt to reset preferences. It appears only data from first-party apps connected to iCloud Drive are affected by the bug. Apple will activate iCloud Drive alongside the release of OS X Yosemite later this fall.

A report went viral that NBC meteorologist Mike Seidel got caught on camera peeing in the woods during a live weekend appearance with Lester Holt. NBC News decided Brian Williams needed to discuss it on NBC Nightly News tonight. Yes, it’s come to this.

Hank was one third of the famous Sugarhill Gang... which had the first mainstream rap hit "Rappers Delight" in 1979. His group mates Wonder Mike and Master Gee told TMZ... "So sad to hear of our brother's passing" Hank was 57 years old.

YouTube user JoeyTrombone had an extra special gift for his parents this Christmas. When they open the envelope to see that their mortgage has been paid their reaction is as heartwarming as you would imagine. I have no specifics on how he pulled it off, but of course the first YouTube comment is everything you need to know about YouTube commenters.

Gill Rosenberg, 31, joined the Kurdish peshmerga fighting force this year. ISIS sources reported Sunday that she was captured in Kobane, Syria. But Rosenberg, who has dual Canadian and Israeli citizenship, said she is fine. She took to social media to dispel the reports, saying she is 'totally safe and secure'

Apple is set to launch a 12-inch MacBook Air, which could just be Apple's biggest product in 2015. The new MacBook Air is said to be smaller than its 13-inch sibling and a bit thinner than the 11-inch version. The laptop is speculated to ship in mid-2015 and is expected to use one of the new dual-core Broadwell chips.

Dylan Thomas, 21, was on vacation in Bali and woke up one morning to discover a red "trail" of irritation running from his navel to his chest. He returned to the medical center where doctors discovered a tiny tropical spider beneath his skin. According to Thomas, his doctors speculated that it had entered his skin through an appendectomy scar.

Depressed Tan Shen, 26, from Chengdu, in China’s southwest Sichuan Province, decided she needed some finger licking good comfort food to get over her ex. After a few days employees at the chicken shop began to get concerned. Waitress Jiang Li Lung said: "I guess we kind of miss her. It certainly made work more interesting"

Dmitry Nikolaev, 30, is believed to be the target of a gang. Police believe the gang may be harvesting organs to sell on the black market. Nikolaev had a drink with a young blonde woman he met at a bar in a Moscow theatre before she invited him to a sauna. He woke up the next day in acute pain and noticed blood on his trousers.

Amazon plans to open its first physical store in New York City. The store will be located on 34th Street, right between Macy's and the Empire State Building. Amazon will accept returns at the location, and will use it as a mini-warehouse particularly tuned for same-day delivery of products.

Incident took place during a raid in the Now Zad district of Helmand Province. Video shows the marine being struck on the helmet by an unseen sniper. Afterwards the US serviceman tells his colleagues he is fine, other than a ringing in his ears. The video was uploaded on 26 September by Sam Arnold.

ISIS claims to have executed American freelance journalist James Foley. Foley had been missing since November 22, 2012 when he disappeared in Syria. ISIS is threatening to kill another reporter in retaliation for U.S. strikes on their forces in Iraq: Politico’s Blake Hounshell.

North Korean leader Kim Jong-Un's younger sister has taken over the running of the country. Kim Yo-Jong is making all the important decisions in her brother's absence, a think tank says. The North Korean government last week publicly admitted that Kim Kim-Un is unwell.

Banksy was arrested in the run-up to the Notting Hill Carnival. The story of his arrest bears a startling resemblance to a hoax that went around last year. Here’s who Paul Horner is, by the way. And that's the story of Banksy's arrest, in full.

Mohammed Islam, a Stuyvesant High senior, made a fortune investing in the stock market. In an exclusive interview with Mr. Islam and his friend Damir Tulemaganbetov, the baby faced boys who dress in suits with tie clips came clean. Swept up in a tide of media adulation, they made the whole thing up.New York has now altered its headline to back away from the $72 million figure but the story itself remains. Even if this working-class kid had somehow started with $100,000 as a high school freshman on day one at Stuy High, he’d have needed to average a compounded annualized return of something like 796% over the three years since.

North Korean leader Kim Jong Un had a cyst removed from his right ankle, a lawmaker says. A cyst was found on Kim's right ankle earlier this year, between May and June. That cyst may have caused muscle or nerve damage and prompted him to have surgery. Kim is believed to be recovering, South Korean lawmakers were told.

"Reset All Settings" in iOS 8 deletes documents from iCloud Drive. The option is found under Settings — General — Reset. All iWork documents stored in iCloud Drive both on the iPhone and on iCloud.com were gone. After iCloud synced with a Mac running OS X Yosemite, the documents were deleted from the Mac as well.

An image went viral over the weekend revealing that the condom company that isn't Trojan, Durex, is coming out with a pumpkin spice condom. It's just a photoshopped image and they have no such condoms in their product line. "We can't claim this one, but we do love it when people spice it up in the bedroom," the company said.

Apple Stores will accept in-store reservations for customers to try on the Apple Watch. The high-end Apple Watch Edition will have scratch-resistant gold. Apple is also said to have studied a platinum Apple Watch, but the model is unlikely to be announced Monday. Apple CEO Tim Cook told retail employees that Apple has "never sold anything as a company that people could try on before"

Comcast allegedly fired a man for complaining about shoddy customer service. The company claims the man name-dropped his employer during the call. The man says he never mentioned his employer and that someone at Comcast must have looked him up to figure out where he worked. Comcast has allegedly refused to release any tapes of the phone calls it made on the matter.

Iraqi media outlets reported that ISIS members had contracted Ebola. The World Health Organization and Iraq's Ministry of Health denied the reports. ISIS has not recruited fighters from any countries severely affected by the disease, Mashable reported. ISIS could use Ebola as a biological terror technique, a national security professor said.

YouTuber Josh Paler Lin gave $100 dollars to a homeless man. He hoped he could videotape the man wasting the money away on alcohol. But all Josh got was a shock, because Thomas, the homeless man, went into a liquor store, but came out with enough food to support everyone around him.

A website is reporting that the Batmobile, from the upcoming Batman v. Superman flick, has gone missing in Detroit and is presumed stolen. No other local media outlet has a word about it. "Presumed stolen" refers to a presumption by the anonymous writer of a four-paragraph post.

The rodents have pestered the staffs of Vanity Fair and Vogue. Conde told employees that they cannot eat at their desks and that a complaint will be made with the city’s health department. The Durst Organization, which manages One World Trade Center for the Port Authority, declined to comment.

US intelligence authenticated a gruesome Isis videotape showing the execution of captive journalist James Foley. Obama did not announce any intensification of his bombing campaign, now in its thirteenth day. US Central Command has yet to announce any new strikes since the Tuesday appearance of the social-media-borne Foley video.The Committee to Protect Journalists said the murder of Foley, 40, “sickens all decent people’ Foley’s mother Diane said: “We have never been prouder of our son Jim. He gave his life trying to expose the world to the suffering of the Syrian people”

ISIS believed to be carrying out test flights over captured al-Jarrah military airport east of Aleppo. Terrorists are using Iraqi pilots who were once officers in Saddam Hussein's air force to train Syria-based militants to operate the warplanes. News comes as Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula sought to mend its strained relations with ISIS. Terror group urged all jihadist groups operating in the Middle East to unite under common cause of fighting against Western 'crusader' armies.Titled 'Statement on the Crusader Coalition', the document is Al Qaeda's strongest show of support for ISIS since leader Ayman al-Zawahiri denounced the group for brutal tactics late last year. Earlier today, Iraqi officials in the western Anbar province said a curfew has been imposed in the provincial capital Ramadi over fears that the Islamic State group might try to advance on the city.

The Vladimir Putin penis motorcade has done the rounds many times before. It is doing the rounds again today. Why today? Because Reddit. When will it strike again? No one can say. It's not real, it's a Photoshop job on a still from this video of his 2012 inauguration.

Banksy spokesman: "We can confirm this is not by Banksy" The drawing is actually by French illustrator Lucille Clerc. She posted the tribute on her official Twitter page after the shooting. #JeSuisCharlie began trending worldwide shortly after the attack.

Anna Wintour reportedly has a major rat infestation at her Vogue office in New York City. According to Radar Online, some of the dirtiest rats have decided to move into Anna’s new office for herself and Vogue staffers at the Freedom Tower. Insiders claim that rodents invaded the beloved accessories closet, leaving an abundance of rat droppings all over their pricey couture, computers, and desks.

The World Health Organization is evaluating jihadist militants associated with ISIS, who may have contracted the virus responsible for Ebola. The WHO has yet to confirm whether or not the fighters are exhibiting symptoms. The Iraqi health ministry has issued a press release denying reports from Iraqi news outlets that claim the soldier are definitively infected and seeking treatment in Mosul.

Jess Smith was selected to be the giggling Baby Sun at the age of nine months. The 19-year-old is now a first-year dance education student at Canterbury Christ Church University. She broke the news on Facebook and said: 'I am the sun from Teletubbies'

Distributor circles in the Apple environment is heard that the Californian technology giant apparently not planning to send Apple Watch also to the resellers. At least in the initial phase will be the SmartWatch reserved exclusively for retail stores to monopolize the market and to create additional admissions in Apple Stores.

Google has bought about half of Pacific Shores office park. Google will use the space to build new offices. The office park is located in the heart of Los Angeles' tech hub. Google has been in the office park for more than a decade. The company bought the property for $2.5 billion in 2010.

News Shopper has received unconfirmed reports that a hand grenade has been found in a safe at a property in Shortlands. Alex McFee, who works at Curran and Pinner estate agents on Beckenham Lane, has sent in this picture of the road which has been taped off by police.

"Rapper's Delight" was the first rap song to reach the Top 40 on the U.S. Billboard charts. "Big Bank Hank," whose real name was Henry Jackson, died early Tuesday in Englewood, New Jersey. The New York native was 57. The song was born from the emerging New York hip-hop scene.

A video that appears to a show a bird pooping on Russian President Vladimir Putin’s suit during a speech last week is fake. The video–uploaded to YouTube–is going viral. A few media outlets appear to have been tricked by it. The Washington Post and TIME magazine both posted the video, apparently believing it.

Star Wars: The Force Awakens buzz seems to indicate that the much-awaited sci-fi's release date may be advanced. Rumor has it that director J.J. Abrams is getting fed up with the constant plot and image leaks. Disney has, for its part, started to go after those illegally releasing content from the film.

Tan Shen says she was walking the city feeling depressed when she decided to stop into a KFC outlet in a train station in Chengdu China. Shen ordered more wings and fries and continued to stay in her booth. After a week, local media reportedly started flocking to the restaurant so Shen decided it was time to leave.

Twitter users say their hair is getting caught in the seam between the glass screen and aluminum back of the iPhone 6. This news follows #GapGate, which focused on the Samsung Galaxy Note 4. It's unknown whether Samsung customers are also experiencing hair loss when taking calls on their phones.

Apple Watch launch set for 9 March in San Francisco. Apple expected to launch 100,000 Apple Watch apps at launch. Real life Wrong Trousers and crowdfunded augmented reality helmet also on the agenda. And Finally is our weekly synopsis of the rumours and rumblings of the wearable world.

Bhakkar Fatwa is an extremist splinter group of Al Qaeda. The group has begun actively recruiting on American soil. They are planning multiple attacks against American consumers as they wait in line for stores to open on November 28th. Intelligence points to the time spent waiting outside of the store as the time of greatest vulnerability.

Investment firm Piper Jaffray issued a report on Monday breaking down expected Apple Watch average selling prices. Analyst Gene Munster anticipates combined Apple Watch ASPs to fall closer to $550, or $575 to $600 including additional bands. Apple Watch will come in three separate price tiers — Apple Watch Sport, Apple Watch and Apple Watch Edition.

A report from Judicial Watch stated that four ISIS members were apprehended at the Mexican border. The report said that the ISIS members had been in Mexico for a few days. The ISIS members are believed to be from Syria, Iraq, and Libya. The group has been fighting in Syria and Iraq for months.

Islamic State militants have released a video allegedly depicting the beheading of American photojournalist James Wright Foley. The Islamist group also threatened to kill another American journalist, Steven Joel Sotloff, stating his fate is in the hands of President Barack Obama. Foley went missing almost two years ago while covering the conflict in Syria as a freelance photographer.

The schoolgirls, from the city of Banja Luka, went to the Bosnia and Herzegovina capital, Sarajevo. Furious parents are demanding to know why there was such a lack of teacher supervision. Nenad Babici, the National Coordinator for Reproductive Health of the Republika, blamed parents.

Juan Pedro Ramos died of anaphylaxis after eating recently developed tomatoes with fish genes, causing a violent and deadly allergic reaction. Medical staff could not identify the cause of the allergic reaction in the time and no treatments or conventional medications seemed to work. Mr. Ramos is the first human death officially confirmed linked to the ingestion of genetically modified foods.

The UK confirmed the video showing the beheading of aid worker David Haines. The video was posted on YouTube by a group calling themselves 'The Beheading Network' It shows a man being beheaded with the help of a machine gun and a chainsaw. The man is later seen being led away from the scene.

28 girls between the ages of 13 and 15 made the trip from their hometown of Banja Luka. The itinerary was to visit museums and historic sights in Sarajevo, ranked among the finest in the world. A gynecologist said a growing trend of underage pregnancies in Bosnia and Herzegovina is worrying.

A man rushed to a Kansas City-area hospital Saturday is not being treated for Ebola. HCA Midwest assistant vice president Chris Hamele said that the patient does not have the symptom profile of virus. It is unknown at this time what the patient is suffering from or if anyone else is sick. All or part of the medical facility was quarantined.

Vogue editor-in-chief, 65, left Conde Nast's new headquarters at One World Trade Center without her trademark Chanel sunglasses on Friday. According to reports, the swish new office building is infested with vermin and staff are understandably horrified. The city's health department was called in to deal with the infestation.

Nikolai Kryaglyachenko, 12, from Russia, was walking home from school. He was knocked out by a lamppost that was electrified from a faulty wire. The next day he found coins that had been lying on the mattress had stuck to his body.

Vice CEO Shane Smith spent $300,000 on a dinner at the Bellagio's Prime Steakhouse. A group of 12 diners joined Smith at the steakhouse. The majority of the check was spent on wine, with some bottles costing more than $20,000 each.

A shooting at Canada’s Parliament Hill took place on Wednesday morning. Two sources told the Canadian Press that Sergeant-At-Arms Kevin Vickers shot the first suspect. Vickers was a 29-year veteran of the RCMP before joining the House of Commons as Director of Security Operations in June 2005.

Federal judge rules that black women no longer have independent naming rights for their children. Rule applies to all black women, but judge singled out impoverished mothers. Ruling stemmed from lawsuit brought by 13-year-old girl whose mother created her name using Incan hieroglyphics.

Suresh Kumar, 40, was set upon when locals in Ganganagar heard a girl’s screams. A mob dragged Kumar away after he was found in an alley allegedly pinning his victim to a wall. He was beaten with sticks for an hour, and dragged into a local butcher's shop where his organ was severed with a meat cleaver. Kumar is still in a critical condition after the attack.

Amazon.com plans to open its first brick-and-mortar store, according to people familiar with the plans. The site would mark an experiment by Amazon to connect with customers in the physical world. Amazon’s space at 7 West 34th St. would function as a mini-warehouse, with limited inventory.Amazon also has set up large metal lockers in convenience stores and parking garages around the country. The lockers don’t offer same-day delivery, however. Amazon took some inspiration from a trial by the U.K.’s Home Retail Group PLC.

The audio is from an unnamed man who says he was having a video chat with a woman when shots rang out. In the recording, as the man speaks to the woman, a quick series of shots can be heard in the background. CNN says they are unable to independently verify authenticity of the tape, which has been turned over to investigators.

A group of real estate agents meeting in Ann Arbor surprised a man by giving him a $2,084 tip for delivering one pizza. The man, identified only as Rob, was stunned and said on video, "All I did was deliver pizza" Agents from Keller Williams Realty all pitched in while attending the company's regional conference.

Mohammed Emwazi is a Briton from a well-to-do family who grew up in West London. He is believed to have travelled to Syria around 2012 and to have later joined the Islamic State. He has appeared in a series of videos documenting the gruesome killings of other hostages, including four other Westerners.Emwazi came back to London twice, the second time to finalise his wedding plans to a woman in Kuwait. In June 2010, counterterrorism officials in Britain detained him again — this time fingerprinting him and searching his belongings. "I feel like a prisoner, only not in a cage, in London," he wrote in a June 2010 e-mail.

The Watch has an unannounced Power Reserve option that limits the device to telling time. Tim Cook and crew aren't likely to make a big deal of Power Reserve at Apple's March 9th event, assuming it shows up. It could be one of the Watch's most important real-world features.

InSerbia.info published a 400-word piece under the sensational headline: Seven Primary School Students Pregnant After Five-Day Excursion to Sarajevo. The original article has now been linked by the New York Post,  the London Daily Mail, the New. York Daily News, Australia’s Courier Mail, Newser, Cosmopolitan UK. None have performed any follow-up to confirm the original reporting.

Kansas City health officials say a man held in isolation at a local hospital is not infected. The man had recently traveled to Nigeria and did not possess the symptom profile for the deadly virus. No Ebola blood test was done, because the feared symptoms never materialized. The case marked the second known Ebola scare in the Kansas City area.

The United States appears to be flying unarmed surveillance drones over the IS stronghold of Raqqa, Syria. The pictures thus far suggest that the drone being used is the MQ-1 Reaper. There is little doubt that this mission is intended to give U.S. policymakers more information about IS positions in Raqqa.

Vice founder Shane Smith reportedly spent $300,000 on a dinner for a group of 12 at the Prime Steakhouse in Las Vegas. A source at Vice told BuzzFeed News that Smith won a sum “well north of that bill” while gambling during his week at the CES conference. Smith himself hasn’t commented on the story.The restaurant lists the item as market price, but Eater Las Vegas has it going for up to $2,500 per pound. At Mario Batali’s joint, a 1.5-liter bottle of Boërl & Kroff 1998 will set you back $15,000 each. For the reds, perhaps a couple of vintages on the more reasonable side.

The viral YouTube hit, “How Does A Homeless Man Spend $100?” was a fake, according to a witness. Josh Paler Lin gave a homeless man a hundred bucks in cash, then “secretly’ filmed him as he spent the money. The video was picked up by dozens of media outlets, including the Inquisitr, and in the week the clip has been on YouTube, has racked up more than 28 million views.

"Conal" began subscribing to Comcast in 2013 under a promotional offer. He almost immediately found himself charged for set-top boxes that had not been activated. Conal, an accountant, then contacted Comcast's controller. Comcast learned where Conal was employed. It just happened to be a company that does business with Comcast.

Urban Development Minister M. Venkaiah Naidu issued orders to dismiss A.K. Verma for unauthorised absence from duty. Mr Verma, who joined the CPWD as an assistant executive engineer in 1980, went on leave in December 1990 and did not report to work thereafter.

Rumours that the Caped Crusader's ride has been stolen have been greatly exaggerated. Detroit police confirmed with producers of Batman v. Superman: Dawn of Justice that the vehicle has not been stolen. “The Batmobile is safe in the Batcave where it belongs,” Sgt. Michael Woody said.

Esquire published a story about ESPN’s plans for a domestic violence panel on Monday Night Football. The story was quickly picked up on by other media outlets. The network has explicitly and publicly called the Esquire story false. ESPN also released their coverage plans for Monday Night Countdown tonight. The panel for that discussion will include the following people: Chris Berman, Cris Carter, Mike Ditka, Adam Schefter, Tom Jackson and Keyshawn Johnson.Esquire's news editor said there would be a special domestic violence panel with enough men to field an entire football team. Collins merely listed the talent that would be working the show and assumed the topic would come up at some point during the evening. Collins explained his position in greater detail on his Twitter page.

World Health Organization confirms there are no suspected cases of Ebola in Iraq. Three media outlets had said a number of militants had shown signs of the deadly virus in the city of Mosul. A WHO spokesperson said they were investigating the reports. "We have no official notification from [the Iraqi government] that it is Ebola," Christy Feig told Mashable.

Abubakar Shekau dashed hopes for a prisoner exchange to get the girls released. “The issue of the girls is long forgotten because I have long ago married them off,” he said. Nigeria’s chief of defense staff, Air Chief Marshal Alex Badeh, on Oct. 17 announced an immediate cease-fire.

Sons of Anarchy won't get made into a movie. A hoax article saying that creator Kurt Sutter will launch a film with Charlie Hunnam and Brad Pitt has gone viral. The bogus piece was published on Empire News, a satirical news website. It had more than 80,000 shares as of Wednesday.

Gillian Rosenberg, the Canadian-Israeli woman fighting ISIS with Kurdish forces in Syria, has updated her Facebook page to say that, contrary to reports, she has not been captured by militant forces. “Guys, I’m totally safe and secure,” she wrote Monday. Rosenberg is believed to be the first foreign female fighter to join Syrian Kurds in their fight against ISIS.

A story circulating online claims that Dog Whisperer Cesar Millan died of a heart attack. The report, however, is not true. The story is rife with grammatical and spelling errors. No legitimate media outlets have reported Millan’s death. There has been no such announcement on Millan's official Facebook page.

Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau claims the kidnapped schoolgirls have been converted to Islam and married off. He also denies having agreed to a ceasefire with the Nigerian government. "The issue of the girls is long forgotten because I have long ago married them off," he says.

The Ansar al-Deen Front posted a photo of a truck with Mark-1 Plumbing's logo on it. The company's owner says he has no idea how the truck ended up in Syria. An AutoNation spokesman says the company sent the truck to be sold at auction.

Absolutely awful news. Media are reporting that journalist James Foley, captured in 2012, has been beheaded by ISIS. James Foley was captured by ISIS in 2012 and has been held captive ever since. He is believed to have been killed in an ISIS-controlled area of Syria.

The tyrant is eyeing up locations as he looks to expand the state-backed chain of restaurants. The first North Korean government restaurant was opened in Amsterdam in 2012. It is reported that 30 % of the total takings of the food outlets goes to Pyongyang, but critics think the cash will be used to maintain his own lavish lifestyle.

Newly released audio allegedly records the moment that Officer Darren Wilson opened fire on unarmed Michael Brown. At least ten shots can be heard - in two separate volleys of gunfire.Experts have said this indicated a'moment of contemplation' for Wilson. FBI has confirmed it has interviewed the man who recorded audio.In recent days reports had emerged stating that Officer Wilson, 28, was badly beaten and left with serious facial injuries following the fatal shooting in the St Louis suburb. A police source has confirmed to MailOnline that Wilson was taken to hospital and treated for facial injuries sustained during the Brown incident but would not elaborate on the severity or nature of those injuries. Earlier reports had claimed that the officer was almost knocked unconscious by Brown's blows.

New York Post says Amazon is set to launch ad-supported video service. The service would be separate from its $99 Prime Instant Video offering. Amazon hasn't commented on the report. It recently scored a deal to stream classic HBO programs like The Sopranos and Six Feet Under.

North Korean leader, who has been missing for weeks from the public eye, is recuperating from surgery, according to a report. Kim had been on tour of military bases and factories wearing Cuban heels. Kim ended up in the hospital because he put off getting treatment for his injuries, The Chosun Ilbo reported.

Experts do not know whether the meteorite disintegrated on impact or shot into the ground. A committee formed to investigate the incident have confirmed that the noise was caused by a “relatively small’ meteorite that fell from an asteroid passing close to Earth. The meteorite left a crater with a radius 39 feet and a depth of 16 feet near Managua's international airport and an air force base.

Lebanese authorities are holding a daughter and an ex-wife of the head of the ISIS jihadist group, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi. The woman, who has been named as Saja al-Dulaimi, was travelling with two sons and a daughter, interior minister Nouhad Mashnuq said.

A soldier has been shot at Ottawa's War Memorial in Canada, near the parliament. The soldier was being treated by paramedics and police rushed on the scene. Witnesses told CBC News that the suspected shooter was carrying rifle. The Canadian parliament building was reported to be in lockdown following the shooting.

One of the five Taliban fighters traded last year for Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl is trying to make contact with the Taliban once again, Fox News has learned. The development comes amid rising concerns over former Guantanamo detainees returning to the battlefield. Despite the apparent outreach by one of the traded prisoners, all five of the so-called “Taliban 5” are still accounted for in Qatar, a senior U.S. defense official said.

Dino Ferrari hooked the whopper wels catfish, which was 2.67m in length. The biggest was 22st and 2.78m long, and was also from the Po Delta. Wels catfish can grow as long as 4m and up to 62st, but it is rare to catch one over two meters long.

State Department: "We have nothing to confirm these reports about missing airliners" Images have surfaced online showing militants posing with the jetliners taken when the militants overran Tripoli's airport.
