The Rev. Al Sharpton: "It is timely for the City of New York to revise its policies" Starting Nov. 19, anyone found with less than 25 grams of the drug on them will be issued a summons. The only caveat is there must not be a warrant out for the person's arrest.

Rodney Constantine was wanted on four warrants, including failing to attend court. He promised to turn himself in in a Facebook comment to police. Police say he has turned himself in, and he will be seen by a provincial court judge Tuesday. The unusual back-and-forth sparked a slew of comments from Facebook users.

Mohammed Emwazi is a Kuwaiti-born British man in his mid-20s. He was known to UK security services and was a "person of interest" to MI5. Friends say he was raised in a middle class area of West London. He is believed to have travelled to Syria in 2012 and joined Islamic State.

A fake MSNBC site is now reporting that Axl Rose was found dead in his home at the age of 52. Mediaite reached out to Rose’s camp to check on his pulse, and will update accordingly. The hoax bothered to call the reports “unconfirmed”

Sheikh Mohammed Saleh al-Munajjid issued a religious ruling forbidding the building of snowmen. Quoting from Muslim scholars, he argued that to build a snowman was to create an image of a human being. That provoked swift responses from Twitter users writing in Arabic.

ISIS claims it has captured weapons and ammunition dropped by the U.S. military. The airdrops Sunday were the first of their kind and followed weeks of airstrikes in and near Kobani. A senior administration official said the majority - but not necessarily all - of the bundles appeared to make it to their intended targets.

As many as seven students have become pregnant on a school trip in Bosnia. The girls were only 13 or 14 years old. The abortions were necessary to protect the girls and their health. Lack of education and the consequences - in Bosnia and Herzegovina is the an important issue.

Reddit user posted a letter that Lego included in boxes of its toy building bricks in the 1970s. Addressed to parents, the note has a message about gender equality and gendered children's products. This letter's message is consistent with the gender-neutral Lego ad from 1981 that made the Internet rounds back in February.

The Pentagon confirmed that a cache of weapons fell into the hands of ISIS. The weapons include machine guns, mortars, and mortars. The Pentagon says the weapons were stolen from a U.S. base in Falluja, Iraq. The U.N. estimates that more than 100,000 ISIS fighters are in the region.

Vladimir Putin spoke at the dedication of a new monument to the First World War in Moscow on Friday. The Russian president said that the lessons of the war were that peace is fragile, that military aggression is dangerous and that violence can generate more violence in turn. A bird defecated on Putin during his speech.

Former PGA Tour player claims Tiger Woods has been suspended for one month. Dan Olsen made the claim Friday on radio station WVFN to host David DeMarco. Olsen said Woods did not test positive for testosterone but for “something else.” Olsen also made several wild accusations concerning Woods’ golf ball.

Longtime "Nightly News" anchor Tom Brokaw wants Brian Williams thrown out of the big chair. Williams admitted fabricating key portions of a story he repeatedly told about his reporting experience during the Iraq War in 2003. The New York Post says NBC News executives had counseled Williams to stop telling the story. The paper says NBC will take no action against Williams.

A report surfaced claiming that Comcast has been discouraging customers from using the Tor Browser. The report may have generated a lot of clicks but is totally inaccurate. Comcast is not asking customers to stop using Tor, or any other browser for that matter. Customers are free to use their Xfinity Internet service to visit any website.

A site called DeepDotWeb claimed that Comcast has “declared war on Tor Browser’ Comcast says it investigated the story and found no evidence that the encounters ever happened. A search of the subreddit /r/darknetmarkets for Comcast and Tor turned up nothing.Tor was created by the US Naval Research Laboratory to protect government communications. It's used by many people with privacy concerns, including activists in repressive governments. Comcast was caught interfering with BitTorrent traffic in 2007. If the customers described by DeepDotWeb did have discussions with Comcast employees, it's possible they were being notified of a pending legal action.

No suspected cases of Ebola found in Iraq, despite reports to the contrary, WHO says. Reports of suspected Ebola cases appeared on December 31 in Iraq's Al-Sabah newspaper, Rudaw online newspaper and on the Shafaq news agency. "All sources contacted have negated the existence of any suspected cases," WHO says in statement.

The network was hammered with calls after an Esquire blog post indicated that an all-male lineup would debate the topic. Obesity rates in America have more than doubled over the last 2 decades and has become the leading public health issue in the U.S. With more than two-thirds of the adult population overweight, McDonald’s has decided to become part of the obesity rate solution – not the problem. They will define overweight by these standards: Over 170 lbs for women and 245 lbs for men.

A developer for Electric Boogie apparently had such disdain for the person he worked for he decided to ridicule them in a rather creative way. A "propaganda video" released by ISIS has set off a range of international responses. The video was released by the terror group in a bid to raise funds for their cause. Sen. Lindsey Graham says the Taliban detainees released from Guantanamo Bay in exchange for Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl have been in touch with members of the al-Qaida-linked Haqqani network. Christian Bale will no longer be playing Steve Jobs in Danny Boyle's upcoming biopic on the Apple founder. The decision to leave the film was made by Bale himself, who decided the film wasn't a good fit. Seth Rogen is also reportedly in talks to play Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak.

Report: Apple isn't happy with the watch's battery life just yet. Apple hasn't offered any further comment. Battery life has been one of the biggest obstacles facing wearable devices. Michael Zehaf-Bibeau has been identified as the suspect in the shooting at Parliament Hill in Ottawa, Canada on Wednesday. U.S. officials revealed Zehafi Bibeau’s identity to CBS News. New policy was ordered by de Blasio, whose campaign promises included ending marijuana arrests. Matt Taibbi, the star magazine writer hired earlier this year to start a satirical website for billionaire Pierre Omidyar's First Look Media, is on a leave of absence from the company. An unverified audio recording that may have captured the shooting of Michael Brown is being investigated by the FBI. Miami is fixated by the rumor that Mr. Castro, 88, has finally succumbed. “Hope springs eternal,” said James Cason, the former head of the U.S. Interests Section in Cuba. The North Korean embassy in London has denied reports that it is planning to open a restaurant in Scotland. The robot, dubbed K5, is five feet tall, weighs 300 pounds, and looks disturbingly like the Daleks of "Doctor Who" fame. They use cameras and sensors to monitor their assigned area and look for suspicious activity. Should they spot a problem, they call a human security guard.

Comcast got a guy named Conal fired from his company following ongoing problems he was having with Comcast. UK Prime Minister Cameron confirmed Haines' death and stated that the UK government was working to verify the video. UK government is working to verified the video to confirm the death of the British soldier. UK Prime Minister David Cameron confirmed the death on Monday. The death was confirmed by a spokesman for the British military.

A.K Verma went on leave in 1990 after joining India’s central public works department. He defied bosses’ orders to return to work after his requests for additional leave were denied. Even after an inquiry found him guilty of “wilful absence from duty” in 1992, it took another 22 years and a cabinet minister to remove him.

Google has agreed to lease all of Jay Paul Co.'s Moffett Place, a 1.9 million square foot office campus currently under construction in Sunnyvale. In a separate but no less notable deal, Google completed the purchase of six buildings from Blackstone Group and Starwood Capital totaling about 934,000 square feet in Redwood City.Google has already leased 949,000 square feet at a nearby campus called Technology Corners. The 10-building, 1.7-million-square-foot project was built by Jay Paul Co. in the early 2000s. Google's acquisition this week is only for the six Blackstone/Starwood buildings.

There have been reports of predator drones being launched from Iraq and reports of a US drone flying over Syria. There have also been reports that a drone has been seen flying over the country's border with Iran. There are also reports of US drones flying over Iraq and Syria.

Viking island owned by golfer Tiger Woods is up for sale. Stora Rullingen is on Lake Malaren, about an hour from Stockholm. It has a "hill fort" dating back to the Stone, Bronze and Iron ages. The asking price is 6 million euros, about $7.1 million.

The story of the Catholic priest who supposedly died briefly and saw a female God has gained massive traction online. The story does not appear to spring from any news outlets close to Boston, Massachusetts, where the priest was reportedly working. The images of “Father O’Neal” that accompany the stories appear to be stock photos.

The bear, named Bernard by staff at The Loft café in Shefford, stands outside each day bringing joy to passing children who run past him. On Monday an enforcement officer from Central Bedfordshire Council visited the café to inform staff that there had been complaints made about Bernard’s singing because he was causing a public nuisance.

The story of teacher Lucita Sandoval's affair with a 16-year-old student went viral. But the video in question is from a porn website, and features a woman and a college student. The woman in the video is not a teacher, and the “boy’s” age is well over 16 and in college.

A report says 11 commercial jets have been stolen in recent weeks in Libya. Western intelligence agencies have begun warning they could be used in terror attacks on Sept. 11. The anniversary is the 13th anniversary of the 9/11 terror attacks. Libya has been an uncontrolled disaster area since the removal in 2011 of strongman Muammar Gadhafi.

ISIS militants released a video of the beheading of photojournalist James Wright Foley. Foley was first captured in Libya in 2012, released, and then kidnapped again around Thanksgiving 2012. He was held captive for 635 days. Foley's family set up a Find James Foley website for him in 2013.

The retired fashion designer lured neighborhood cats with food and skinned them in her basement. She also used the meat of the cats to lure other cats who unwittingly were eating their own species. Legal experts assess the 85-year old woman could spend up to 18 months in jail for her crimes.

Reports had suggested that North Korean supreme leader Kim Jong-un may open a restaurant in Scotland. North Koreans consider Scotland, which leans more towards leftist ideals than England, more suitable to "deal with" The dictator already owns over a chain of restaurants "Pyongyang", with international branches including one in Amsterdam.

A short video clip has been circulating online that purports to show Saudi Arabia’s state television station blurring out the image of First Lady Michelle Obama. But according to reporters who were on the ground as well as the information director at the Saudi Embassy in Washington, that was not the case. “Saudi TV has been showing the total arrival ceremony at the airport and at the Palace and nowhere is anything blurred,” Nail al-Jubeir said.

Taylor Lianne Chandler, 41, wrote a lengthy post describing her early life. She had male genitalia with no testicles as well as a uterus, without ovaries. She writes that she went on testosterone blockers and changed her name to Paige Victoria Whitney. Phelps has not commented on the post.

Cristian Bale is in talks to play Steve Jobs in a biopic. Danny Boyle is directing the film. The script is by Aaron Sorkin, who won an Oscar for "The Social Network" The film is based on Walter Isaacson's bestselling biography "Steve Jobs"

Saudis in the northern areas drew on their imagination and sense of fun to build snow camels. One citizen in the Province of Tarif used his snow camel to promote the colours of local teams. However, it was not all fun for Saudis after a religious scholar said that building snowmen or snow animals was not acceptable in Islam.

An iPhone game designer decided he had had enough with his job and his boss, so instead of placing a letter of resignation on the higher-up’s desk, he decided to put the letter at the end of a game he helped design called Electric Boogie. A picture of the resignation letter has gone viral since one user apparently reached 100 points on the final level.

Joe Riquelme, a successful app developer from New York who goes by the YouTube user name joeytrombone, on Thursday shared a video showing his parents’ heartwarming reaction to his incredibly generous Christmas gift. The touching video has been viewed nearly 130,000 times in the last 24 hours, and counting. 'Sometimes the best gifts come in the lamest packages,' Riguelme later wrote on his Facebook page.

Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau says the schoolgirls have converted to Islam. "The issue of the girls is long forgotten because I have long ago married them off," he says. The news goes counter to what the Nigerian government said nearly two weeks ago. Human Rights Watch estimates Boko Haram has abducted around 500 young women.

Banksy has not been arrested, despite a report stating the contrary. “The Banksy arrest is a hoax,” the street artist’s publicist, Jo Brooks, told The Independent. A false story, published on US website National Report, alleged that the identity of the British street artist had finally been revealed.

The United States appears to be flying unarmed surveillance drones over the IS stronghold of Raqqa, Syria. The pictures thus far suggest that the drone being used is the Predator. There is little doubt that this mission is intended to give US policymakers more information about IS positions in Raqqa. It does not necessarily signal the imminent use of force against IS positions.

It was the first time in three years Kim hadn't attended the event in Pyongyang, which today marked the party's 69th anniversary. But a flower basket with his name on it was placed before statues of his father and grandfather, both of whom also ruled North Korea. His absence comes as speculation mounts that his sister, Kim Yo-jong, 24, who is Deputy Director of the Workers' Party, has taken over the leadership.North and South Korea exchange machinegun fire after the Communist state took objection to balloons loaded with leaflets condemning Kim Jong Un. No casualties were reported in the exchange of fire, a sign of the tensions which sill exist between the two states. North Korea has reacted angrily to leaflet drops by South Korean private groups that carried messages attacking the authoritarian leadership in Pyongyang.

Gill Rosenberg, 31, is a Canadian-born woman and resident of Tel Aviv. She volunteered to fight alongside Kurdish fighters in Syria. According to a blog linked to Isis, Ms Rosenberg was captured alongside several female fighters near Kobani. These reports have not yet been confirmed by Israeli officials.

Tim Cook told an Apple Store employee in Germany that he wears his Apple Watch with him in the shower, without any problem. Apple hasn’t claimed that it’s fully waterproof, which may make it less appealing to swimmers, divers and other people who want timepieces to survive an extended dip in the water.

Kim Yo-jong, the younger sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, might be leading the hermit kingdom instead of her brother. A recent report from Seoul-based think tank, North Korea Intellectuals Solidarity (NKIS) revealed that Kim is getting medical treatment at Bonghwa Clinic from both domestic and foreign medical teams. Meanwhile, in his absence, KimYo-jong is charged with handling important government decisions.

Adelaide men Eduard Neetz and Casey Dean purchased a Quarter Pounder from McDonald's 20 years ago. The pair have kept the burger under lock and key for the past two decades. They say the burger is 'rock hard' and'solid as a brick' They have now released a song in honour of 'Senior Burger' with all proceeds going to Beyond Blue.

No one so far has reported seeing a flash of light in the sky that would be expected to accompany such a meteor strike. It also appears that a meteor landing in Nicaragua could not have come from asteroid 2014 RC, also nicknamed "Pitbull," as first thought.

Apple is continuing to experience "Hairgate" problems but they may just be a publicity stunt launched by the company. Apple is still struggling to find a solution to its problems with the iPhone 6 and 6S. The iPhone 6 is expected to go on sale on September 12.

North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un has not been seen in public for more than a month. Analysts believe 27-year-old Kim Yo Jong may be secretly running the Hermit Kingdom. State media called what ails Kim "discomfort" in a Sept. 26 report.

The red and white spotted Amanita muscaria species - also known as fly agaric - has been discovered by Alan Titchmarsh. Discovery was recorded during a 12-month study for ITV show The Queen's Garden, which is to be aired on Christmas Day. Chemicals muscimol and ibotenic acid found in the fungi cause psychoactive effects.

The nun, 31, originally from South America, was part of the all-female convent in Macerata. Doctors performed an ultrasound only to discover that the woman was heavily pregnant. The Archbishop of Camerino-San Severino said it up to the unidentified sister if she wanted to stay within the Church.

The discovery was made while a television crew was touring the gardens in preparation for an ITV television show called The Queen’s Garden, which will air on Christmas day. Amanita muscaria is a naturally occurring fungus that is eaten in some cultures for its hallucinogenic affects. It is not the same as the illicit psychoactive mushroom that contains the illegal drug psilocybin.

The tape allegedly contains audio captured during a Ferguson resident's video chat. What appears to be gunfire can be heard in the background of the call. Michael Brown, 18, was shot six times, with two fatal shots to the head. The Ferguson officer involved has been identified as Darren Wilson, 28.

Kai was discovered tied to a railing outside Ayr station in Scotland. Andy Murray and Trainspotting author Irvine Welsh tweeted about Kai. Scottish SPCA has received dozens of calls from members of the public offering Kai a new home. “The phone’s been ringing off the hook all day. We’ve had over 100 offers to take him on,” the charity said.

A French website says the Apple Watch will start at around $500 for the steel model. Gold will be even more expensive. iGen.fr also suggests that the Watch will rank low on the iFixIt repairability scale. The only thing on the Apple watch that will be user-replaceable is the strap.

The contract was reportedly for 35 shows in three cities: London, Berlin, and an unnamed location in New Jersey. Each of the three remaining original members would have earned somewhere over $200 million each just for performing. Sir Richard Branson was reportedly also ready to supply the group with their own private jet for the tour.

Jordan's King Abdullah II has vowed to exact revenge on the ISIS. Reports in Arabic-language newspapers hinted he may don his pilot suit and drop the bombs himself. The news of the burning of Jordanian pilot First Lieutenant Moaz al-Kasasbeh by the ISIS happened while the king was in the U.S.

A nun who had sworn chastity to the Lord with eternal fidelity gave birth. She had arrived at the hospital, accompanied by her sisters, from the emergency room. The doctor on duty invited nun and sisters to immediately take the road of obstetrics. Amniotic sac broke and team immediately into action to deliver the nun.

A video that surfaced Tuesday appears to show the beheading of James Wright Foley. Foley was a freelancer who frequently reported for the Global Post and Agence France-Presse. The video was taken down from Youtube shortly after it was publicized. At least 30 journalists were being held captive in Syria as of November 2013.

Oliver Ilic, 22, had to call ambulance as he couldn't stop the bleeding. The jilted lover was taken on a stretcher in bloodstained jeans to hospital. Police searched his house and discovered the severed organ in a bin. Surgeons managed to reattach the penis in a complicated five-hour surgery.

9to5Mac's artist Michael Steeber designed renditions of what the new Air could look like. The 12-inch MacBook Air will be considerably smaller than the current 13-inch version. We’ll see features that are slimmer and more compact than before, with an edge-to-edge keyboard, a modified trackpad.

The rodents have literally been living it up in Vogue’s new luxurious digs at 1 World Trade Center in New York City. The rats have also reportedly eaten holes into shoe boxes and left droppings on the floor of the accessories closet. Anna Wintour is calling in the Olivia Pope of rat exterminators.

HCA Midwest assistant vice president Chris Hamele said that the patient does not have the symptom profile of virus and is being treated appropriately. Last night, it was reported that all or part of the medical facility was under quarantine. It is still unknown what the Nigerian man is suffering from or if anyone else is sick.

News that the ‘Home Alone’ star has allegedly died started spreading on Facebook and Twitter Nov. 6. Could the report be true or is Macaulay the latest victim of another internet death hoax? The fake story comes from a site called MSNBC.website, which some social media users believed was the real MSNBC, but it's definitely not.

Seven girls aged between 13 and 14 fell pregnant after a school trip to Sarajevo. Furious parents are demanding to know why there was a lack of teacher supervision. The case has provoked nationwide discussions about sex education in Bosnia. The number of sexually active girls aged 13 to 15 has increased significantly. Last year 31 underage girls became pregnant in the capital city.

Fidel Castro was pronounced dead on Twitter sometime around 3:59 p.m. on Thursday. It was an unconfirmed rumor, of course, but it was announced confidently so many folks assumed it was true — or at least worthy of retweet. Then separate rumors started about Raul Castro calling a press conference today, allegedly to announce his brother’s death. Some started questioning whether the users in their feed were talking about the right Fidel Castro.

28 girls, aged 13 and 14, from a small town went on a five-day school trip to the capital, Sarajevo. A quarter of the students returned home pregnant. The case has brought national attention to the increasing number of teen pregnancies in Bosnia and Herzegovina.

The cache of weapons included hand grenades, ammunition and rocket-propelled grenade launchers. The caches were airdropped early on Monday to Kurds in the embattled Syrian town of Kobani. The militant group has been trying to seize the town for over a month now. Syrian government airstrikes hit a rebel-held town along the country's southern border with Jordan.

The weather man was reporting from Sugar Mountain N.C. Saturday night when anchor Lester Holt said he was going to give a live report. But Seidel’s back was facing the camera and it appeared to many viewers he was answering Mother Nature's call instead of reporting on it. But the network said he had dropped his phone in the snow and was looking for it.

Paul Rudd was one of the many bystanders who tackled a violent, homophobic maniac to the ground after he attacked a man in a pink shirt at the Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport last week. Check out the guy in the blazer and plaid shirt who runs into the frame at around the 1:20 mark. Mediaite has reached out to Rudd’s reps for any confirmation that it is him.

On Friday, a rumor cropped up that one of the new Batmobile vehicles had been stolen in Detroit. The story wasn't verified, but it did end up at a couple bigger news outlets. Thankfully it was all just a rumor, but the story did give Batman v Superman director Zack Snyder a reason to pull together some of the minor resources at his disposal for a great photo op.

Anna Wintour, editor-in-chief on Vogue magazine is allegedly displeased with the publications's new 1 World Trade Center offices. Their new workplace at the 25th and 26th floors of the building is said to be infested with rats and vermins. Moving to this new offices may be postponed until the pests are cleared away.

The hoax story has been circulating far and wide on Twitter and Facebook. It claims that an incoming solar storm is to blame, causing "dust and space debris to become plentiful and thus block 90% sunlight" This is false. Solar storms are not like terrestrial storms that can blow up dust and dirt. Instead they create very minor disturbances in the Earth’s magnetosphere.

Kai, a male Shar-Pei crossbreed was found tied to a railing outside Ayr station in Scotland on Friday. Animal welfare charity the Scottish SPCA are trying to find who left him there. Charity managed to trace a previous owner through his microchip, but were told he had been sold two years ago to someone they did not have details for.

President Obama says the U.S. will "do what's necessary to see that justice is done" Obama offers no new policy measures to confront Islamic State. Foley, 40, was working in Syria for the Boston-based news Web site Global­Post when he disappeared.The Islamic State, an offshoot of al-Qaeda, is the most powerful among a number of extremist organizations. At least 66 journalists, all but 10 of them Syrian, have been killed covering the Syrian war. Foley would be the first American journalist known to be executed since the conflict began in early 2011.

A fake report claimed that Guns N’ Roses frontman Axl Rose was found dead in his West Hollywood home. The story was shared more than 39,000 times on social media like Facebook and Twitter. The site behind the phony report has no affiliation with the real news outlet and tries to fool people.

'Feminist' blog from the US causes outrage after its author apparently admitted aborting her male fetus based on her negative past experiences of men. The author purports to have fallen pregnant in 2012 and was overjoyed at the thought until she discovered she was to have a boy at which point she decided to have an abortion.

Intelligence agencies hunting for identity of jihadist who murdered reporter. Reports have suggested Abdel-Majed Abdel Bary, a 23-year-old from London. Abu Hussain al-Britani, 20, and Abu Abdullah al- Britani, also potential match. Young men have posed with heads and 'launched cyber attacks on West' Security sources say they are 'zeroing in' on suspected matched men. Police preparing to raid several British homes to help establish identity.Mr Foley's brother Michael urged officials to reconsider their policy of not negotiating in order to save another US journalist, Steven Sotloff. He said: 'I hope that Jim's death pushes us to take another look at our approach' General Martin Dempsey warned that IS had an 'apocalyptic, end-of-days strategic vision' and could only be defeated by a coalition of partners.

Microsoft is the first company in Silicon Valley to dispatch a fleet of the K5 policing robots. Each 5-foot tall, 300-pound K5 is equipped with arrays of high-definition camera, sensors, sirens, Wi-Fi and artificial intelligence. The robots are fully autonomous and can even refuel at a charging station without the guidance of humans.

The cease-fire was announced by Nigeria's chief of defense. The release of the girls is still being negotiated, a military official said. More than 200 schoolgirls were kidnapped in April. Boko Haram has previously demanded the release of rebel prisoners in exchange for the girls' release.

Former Guantanamo Bay prisoner in contact with Haqqani network, reports say. Former detainee was one of five men released in controversial swap for Bowe Bergdahl. Pentagon says it is working with Qatar to mitigate any threat posed by former detainees. Sen Lindsey Graham says all five detainees are still in Qatar.

Pizza delivery man thought he was dropping off food for a guest. He was escorted to a conference room where 200 Keller Williams realtors were holding their annual conference. They surprised him with a tip of more than $2,000 plus a VISA gift card.
